story:
Short Summary

The CasaShanti Community Wellness Project is passionate about providing community programs to all people from all walks of life. We have found a new location which will allow EVERYONE to enjoy the rewards and reap the benefits of the services and programs on offer at CasaShanti, which focus on holistic wellness and a non-theological meditative practice right in the heart of downtown Fort Myers, Florida. 

  • CasaShanti has been making a difference in the Ft Myers community since 2009.  As an open platform free from doctrine, dogma or obligation, it is a place for the exchange of  knowledge, where peace and communal dialog assist the further expansion of the human mind, body and soul. Its very existence is to serve the community by offering proven life management tools from a holistic perspective in the areas of physical, emotional, spiritual fitness and well-being.

  • We have now officially outgrown our current location and need your support to expand.  We will be adding many new classes and teachings in the coming year, including English as a Second Language (ESL) and Beginners Spanish courses. We are also in conversations with licensed Therapists, Counselors and Massage Therapists to join our staff, so we need a larger space, accessible to everyone.

  • Zachari VanDyne, CasaShanti founder, took spiritual refuge in the north of India for many years in the company of Buddhist Lamas, spiritual teachers and healers where he learned, first and foremost, to be of service. He brought his wealth of experience and knowledge to bear in his childhood home of Ft Myers and has since provided a space that hosts weekly meditation, yoga classes, energetic healings, grief and spiritual counseling, and wellness seminars. A new, easily accessible location will offer the opportunity to expand the community served AND the services offered. CasaShanti offers a refuge from the pressures of everyday life, providing a safe space to learn more about your personal journey. The CasaShanti community has grown exponentially over the last five years and needs more space.  A new, larger and more convenient location has been found that meets current handicap accessibility requirements. 

We need $17,000 and here is where it’s going:

The new CasaShanti will be located on Cottage St between MLK and Victoria Ave in downtown Ft Myers. The commercial space has been previously used as a lawyers' office and meets the ADA accessibility requirements. The current overall condition is adequate, however, updates are needed. Below is the general breakdown of requirements:

  • Administration (licenses, permits, liability insurance, etc) : $4900

  • Graphic Needs (signage, logo and ad design, promotional material, etc) : $1950

  • Construction (Ramp, floor repair, work spaces, bathroom and A/C updates) : $6200

  • Interiors (furniture and supplies) : $2750

  • Web Presence (design, construction, promotion, etc) : $1200

The above subsets contain specific budgeting details and are appropriately prioritized. If our funding goal is not met all monies raised will be distributed according to this prioritization. CasaShanti is already five years strong and will continue to grow. Any and all funds will be used exclusively for the development and promotion of the CasaShanti Community Wellness Project.

The Impact - How your contribution will make a difference:

We all know why centers like CasaShanti are needed. Just turn on the news (or look in the mirror). We are a society burdened with ever mounting pressures and struggles, senseless crimes, rage, violence, and anger. The collective life force pushes forward to ensure our survival while cultural fears of change and new understanding pulls back thus tearing at our individual emotional and moral fabric. In the negotiation of that tear is found our ever-surging personal transformation. 

 Our contemporary culture has seen enough Oprah and Dr. Phil, we've heard all the studies and reasons. The practice of meditation has permeated our pop culture and has been recognized by the most conservative journals and scholars as beneficial for multiple life realities such as stress, depression and addiction to name only three. We know  lots of things to help us build a stronger sense of self and community. What many are lacking is a place to go without doctrine or obligation to just gather and be, to meet like-minded friends and to foster a sense of confidence and clarity.  CasaShanti is just that place. 

CasaShanti will take our western culture's notion of meditation and holistic wellness practices off its sometimes-idealized pedestal of exclusivity and bring it our friends and neighbors, the marginalized and the disenfranchised. There is no one answer or certificate. This isn't about a class, philosophy or religion. The intent is to assist the community in creating daily practices that recognize the fire of life and give it the fuel to burn brightly and with intent.

Risks & Challenges

The most significant challenge to CasaShanti's professional space and presence is financial sustainability. The money we are campaigning for here is to get in, get set up and promote. Long-range plans call for grant funding based on our dedication to community service and a pending 501(c)(3) non-profit status from the IRS. In the mean time, how will CasaShanti pay its bills?

CasaShanti doesn't need a lot to operate. To keep the doors open to the community, $1500 will need to be generated monthly. CasaShanti already generates this amount for its current services offered. By expanding our reach and ability, offering more classes and seminars, including a membership plan and our new language courses, we are confident in our ability to not only continue  CasaShanti's work, but also to increase its breadth and scope.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • We at CasaShanti are grateful for any act of support. Please be in touch for a detailed list of items and equipment that are included in our budget, maybe you have just one thing we need that we can cross off our list...and that would be amazing for us. If you're local to the southwest Florida region, maybe you have a service we need, such as graphic support, web design, furniture, supplies, construction man power (we'll be refinishing 100 year-old heart of pine wooden floors, would love a great quote from a local professional). In any case, we encourage you to reach out to us and let us know of your interest. Our purpose is defined by the community, and we need the community's support, belief and encouragement.

  • If you want to join the CasaShanti community, please email us at info@CasaShanti.Us. We will gladly add you to our community and mailing list.

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.

  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.  Please donate today. Thank you for your love and support.

Visit us at CasaShanti.Us

                   Om Shanti Shanti Shanti....

appropriately prioritized. If our funding goal is not met all monies
raised will be distributed according to this prioritization.
CasaShanti is already five years strong and will continue to grow.
Any and all funds will be used exclusively for the development and
promotion of the CasaShanti Community Wellness Project.

The
Impact - How your contribution will make a difference:

We
all know why centers like CasaShanti are needed. Just turn on the
news (or look in the mirror). We are a society burdened with ever
mounting pressures and struggles, senseless crimes, rage, violence,
and anger. The collective life force pushes forward to ensure
our survival while cultural fears of change and new
understanding pulls back thus tearing at our individual emotional and
moral fabric. In the negotiation of that tear is found our
ever-surging personal transformation. 

 Our
contemporary culture has seen enough Oprah and Dr. Phil, we've
heard all the studies and reasons. The practice of meditation
has permeated our pop culture and
has been recognized by the most conservative journals and scholars as
beneficial for multiple life realities such as stress, depression and
addiction to name only three. We know
 lots
of things to help us build a stronger sense of self and
community. What many are lacking is a place to go without
doctrine or obligation to just gather and be, to meet like-minded
friends and to foster a sense of confidence
and clarity. 
CasaShanti is just that place. 

CasaShanti
will take our western culture's notion of meditation and holistic
wellness practices off its sometimes-idealized pedestal of
exclusivity and bring it our friends and neighbors, the marginalized
and the disenfranchised. There is no one answer or certificate. This
isn't about a class, philosophy or religion. The intent is to assist
the community in creating daily practices that recognize the
fire of life and give it the fuel to burn brightly and with intent.

Risks
& Challenges

The
most significant challenge to CasaShanti's professional space and
presence is financial sustainability. The money we are campaigning
for here is to get in, get set up and promote. Long-range plans call
for grant funding based on our dedication to community service and a
pending 501(c)(3) non-profit status from the IRS. In the mean time,
how will CasaShanti pay its bills?

CasaShanti
doesn't need a lot to operate. To keep the doors open to the
community, $1500 will need to be generated monthly. CasaShanti
already generates this amount for its current services offered. By
expanding our reach and ability, offering more classes and seminars,
including a membership plan and our new language courses, we are
confident in our ability to not only continue  CasaShanti's
work, but also to increase its breadth and scope.  

Other
Ways You Can Help

Maybe
you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:



	We
	at CasaShanti are grateful for any act of support.
	Please be in touch for a detailed list of items and equipment that
	are included in our budget, maybe you have just one thing we need
	that we can cross off our list...and that would be amazing for us.
	If you're local to the southwest Florida region, maybe you have a
	service we need, such as graphic support, web design,
	furniture, supplies, construction man power (we'll be refinishing
	100 year-old heart of pine wooden floors, would love a great quote
	from a local professional). In any case, we encourage you to reach
	out to us and let us know of your interest. Our purpose is
	defined by the community, and we need the community's support,
	belief and encouragement.



	If
	you want to join the CasaShanti community, please email us
	at info@CasaShanti.Us. We
	will gladly add you to our community and mailing list.



Please
	get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.



Remember
	to use the Indiegogo share tools!


And
that's all there is to it.  Please donate today. Thank you for
your love and support.

Visit
us at CasaShanti.Us

             
     Om
Shanti Shanti Shanti....

story:
CAMPAIGN UPDATE

We crossed the €10.000 border! Getting €35.000 will be difficult, but even if we don’t reach our target, every cent you donate will still go into the app development. Work on the back-end will start right away, and if we can cross €20.000 in the final week, you will see the iPhone version popping up soon enough.

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - 

WHAT IS USE-IT?

USE-IT is tourist info for young people. We make city maps that show alternative sightseeing spots, bars, cheap places to eat and clubs where only the locals go. USE-IT exists in more than 30 cities in Europe, and is growing pretty fast. That's probably because we're absolutely non-commercial and because the info is written by locals in a plain honest way.

The maps are free and distributed in hostels, tourist infos and in the Couchsurfing network. Around 1.5 million of our maps are printed every year.

AND WHAT IS THIS APP?

We are not going to stop making the paper maps, but we really want to reach more people with this smartphone version. Basically, the app is going to show the same good content as the printed map with an interactive interface. 

There's also going to be a dog walking around the streets on the map. Everybody who has downloaded the app will see the dog at the same place at the same time. So you can go and meet other travellers by going there and by "walking the dog" together.

The app will be available for iOS and Android, and will be free to download for everybody. However, we DO need your money to create this baby!

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

We need an app that will:

  • work offline
  • have a solid architecture 
  • allow every current and future USE-IT city to join 
  • work on iOS and Android
  • be free for everybody

What you get:

  • the app — but eh... so will everybody else

So why fund this project?

  • Because you like the USE-IT concept.
  • Because millions of people will get access to local tips while travelling.
  • Because we will show our love in other ways.
  • Because you can get the walking dog named after you!

WHEN AND HOW?

The development will start as soon as possible after the campaign. This kind of network application takes time and some heavy proof-testing, so we hope to have it fully functional by next summer.

What will we do with the money if we don't reach our goal?

  • We will develop the app in different steps:
  • step one: analysis + creating the back-end database (the first €15.000)
  • step two: creating the iOS version (the next €10.000)
  • step three: creating the android version (the next €10.000)

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Share the link on Facebook.
  • Write about USE-IT or the app anywhere, and include the indiegogo link.

story:
The Product:

In the days of Top Chef and Hell’s Kitchen more and more home cooks are delving into the culinary arts. Without proper training, cooking and prepping food can be a dangerous undertaking. When looking at the kitchen gadgets being sold today, most are geared towards efficiency and unique cooking needs. This leaves an opportunity in the market to fill a gap with an item that focuses on safety. The S.V.P. is that item. Safe Veggie Prep is an innovative kitchen tool that will serve all markets including the professional industry. The S.V.P. is a second skin that will protect the most vulnerable fingers during the peeling, chopping, cutting and preparation process. No other product on the market can fulfill these claims.

Our mission is to assist and aid those who are not as confident as professional chef’s when it comes to the preparation of vegetables, fruit and other foods in the kitchen. Our product, Safe Veggie Prep or S.V.P., will ensure safety in the kitchen while chopping, cutting, peeling, dicing or slicing vegetables, fruit and other foods. This unique tool is safe to be used by adults and older children with adult supervision.

There is nothing like this currently on the market. You cannot compare this to the bulky mesh cutting gloves being sold today. The S.V.P. covers only the fingers most vulnerable, features gripper fingertips, is dishwasher safe and extremely comfortable.  

In order to move forward with this amazing kitchen tool, funding is needed to make all of the necessary product molds, prototypes, and third run samples for testing as well as to assist with advertising, marketing, and the packaging of the product.

The safe veggie prep, is working it’s way into culinary schools, as well as a safety tool to transform our young minds into some of todays best chefs.  In the process during that time The Safe Veggie Prep is trying to establish a relationship in those places to make it even safer as a perfect learning tool to increase the curve. 

Upcoming Needs for final glove: 

 I have been diligently working for the past year to perfect the design and thoroughly develop all aspects of the S.V.P. Through trial and error we have chosen the best suitable material that is thin enough to allow flexibility while maintaining the strength to stand up to our rigorous safety testing. I know there will be challenges to come that we must surpass in order to succeed and I am confident we can do so.

ADDITIONAL PROTOTYPE:  

1 Additional prototype will be needed in the other 2 sizes being offered of the S.V.P. A portion of the funding will allow these key prototypes to be produced. All size variations are currently protected by my current patents.

WAREHOUSING: 

Our initial orders will ship directly off the product line but the need for an off site warehouse will be necessary once the S.V.P. becomes successful. We will need to find a warehouse in a good location that will provide adequate space.

                                                  *** [Patent Pending ] ***

                                                            2013-2014

story:
Help Commissioned Credentials Recover! 

We are dealers and through our previous campaign tried to raise money to expand and grow our company. We were fortunate enough to become venders at Dragon Con this past year, even though we hadn't meet our target goal. In turn that put a large financial burden on us that unfortunately puts our other shows that we go to where we have become a staple in jeopardy.

What We Need

This will enable us to get much needed supplies in order for us to make our products. As we mentioned up above our campaign to raise funds for Dragon Con was partially successful. We had raised enough money to be dealers at the show, how ever that was all we had been able to do. As a result our supplies for the remainder of the year were hit hard.

What You Get

Thank you perk –

$5 – You’ll receive a personalized thank you Christmas card and a permanent Thank You on our Facebook page.

The ID Card perk –

$25 – You’ll receive a personalized thank you Christmas card, a permanent Thank You on our Facebook page, and a randomly selected pre printed card from our catalog.

The Personalized ID Card perk –

$50 – You’ll receive a personalized thank you Christmas card, a permanent Thank You on our Facebook page, a randomly selected pre printed card, a Custom Card of your choosing.

The Wall (Stargate) perk –

$100 – You’ll receive a personalized thank you Christmas card, a permanent Thank You on our Facebook page, a randomly selected pre printed card, a Custom Card of your choosing and a framed autograph from Joe Flanagan as John Sheppard from Stargate Atlantis.

The Wall (Trek TOS) perk –

$100 – You’ll receive a personalized thank you Christmas card, a permanent Thank You on our Facebook page, a randomly selected pre printed card, a Custom Card of your choosing and a framed autograph from Nichelle Nichols as Uhura from Star Trek.

The Wall (Trek DS9) perk –

$100 – You’ll receive a personalized thank you Christmas card, a permanent Thank You on our Facebook page, a randomly selected pre printed card, a Custom Card of your choosing and a framed autograph from Armin Shimmerman as Quark from Star Trek: Deep Space Nine.

The Wall (Babylon 5) perk –

$100 – You’ll receive a personalized thank you Christmas card, a permanent Thank You on our Facebook page, a randomly selected pre printed card, a Custom Card of your choosing and a framed autograph from Marjorie Monaghan as Number One from Babylon 5.

The Wall (Buffy) perk –

$100 – You’ll receive a personalized thank you Christmas card, a permanent Thank You on our Facebook page, a randomly selected pre printed card, a Custom Card of your choosing and a framed autograph from Mercedes McNab as Harmony from Buffy the Vampire Slayer.

The Ultimate Wall (Doctor) perk  –

$500 – You’ll receive a personalized thank you Christmas card, a randomly selected pre printed card, a Custom Card of your choosing and a framed autograph from Matt Smith as the 11th Doctor from Doctor Who.

The Ultimate Wall (Pond) perk  –

$500 – You’ll receive a personalized thank you Christmas card, a permanent Thank You on our Facebook page, a randomly selected pre printed card, a Custom Card of your choosing and a framed autograph from Karen Gillan at the Amy Pond from Doctor Who.

The Ultimate Wall (Song) perk –

$500 – You’ll receive a personalized thank you Christmas card, a permanent Thank You on our Facebook page, a randomly selected pre printed card, a Custom Card of your choosing and a framed autograph from Alex Kingston as the River Song from Doctor Who.

All autographs come with a Certificate of Authenticity (COA).

Other ways to help

Share this page and get the word out.

story:
Short Summary

Chris and Virginia Kelly are long-time residents of the Baytown area. With an already successful business - CrossFit Baytown and their vision for community impact and the revival of the historic district of Texas Avenue, their concept of Cork Grinders is exactly what Baytown needs! It is because of this vision and their passion for revitalizing the Texas Avenue corridor that has prompted this campaign. With the community involvment, Baytown will see it's first and only wine and coffee bar concept come to fruition!

Virginia and Chris have a dream to open Cork Grinders! Virginia is a Paramedic, and wine enthusiast, and Chris is a firefighter. They need your help to bring Cork Grinders to Baytown. Currently there is no place to enjoy fine wine, craft beer, or exceptional coffee. Cork Grinders will be a community of like minded people in a place dedicated to serve, entertain and educate patrons, friends and family from the Baytown area and beyond.

The reason for this campaign is simple. Chris and Virginia have a vision of starting Cork Grinders. It is the first and only wine and coffee bar in Baytown and they need your help to see their concept, their vision, fulfilled.

Your contribution is key to helping them acheive the critical aspects of this endeavor. Please watch the video above or continue reading for details of what they are striving to accomplish and more importantly, how your thoughtfulness and investment can help them reach their goals.

They are seeking $35,000 to complete the design. buildout and subsequent launch of Cork Grinders. Please read on for more details as to exactly how your investment will be utilized. We greatly appreciate your support!

How you can help:

As I mentioned above, we are seeking $35,000 to complete the design, buildout and launch of the Cork Grinders concept.  We know that we are asking you to be a part of something exciting, incredible, epic even. In exchange for your support, we are also prepared to honor you and your support with some awesome perks and rewards. Please see the area to the right for a break down of the various perks we are offering you for joining this cause and supporting our efforts!

As you can tell, we have worked diligently to make sure that we show your our sincere appreciation by offering some incredible perks to you for joining our cause. By teaming up with exceptional companies like Katz Coffee, The Great Wine Guide, Glazer, Republic, Pioneer Wines, Yepez Winery and others, we are dedicated to making certain that we exceed your expectations in every possible way.

Obviously we are asking for $35,000 for a reason. That is the amount needed to fully realize our goal. Regardless of whether or not we reach the full goal amount, every dollar that comes in will be spent in accordance with helping us get as close as we can. Whether that amount is $5,000, $15,000 or $29,500, every dime will be spent according to the strategy to realize the dream of opening Cork Grinders as quickly and efficiently as possible. So, your contribution, no matter how large or how small, is significant and sincerely appreciated!

The Immediate Impact of Your Support:

Your contribution is essential to helping Cork Grinders bring this concept to the historic district of Baytown.

By joining this campaign, you are helping to promote small, limited production, boutique wineries and coffee growers from around the world. With an increasingly competitve wine and coffee market, countless wineries and coffee fields are forced out of business because they lack the exposure that major, corporately run companies possess. Cork Grinders is their platform to gain exposure to a growing population with a thirst for artisan crafted, delicious wine and exeptional coffee - right here in Baytown!

Other Ways You Can Help

We also understand that some people just can’t contribute financially, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help. If you are able to make a financial contribution to our cause, Thank You! If not, we still appreciate you helping to spread the word about Cork Grinders! It is critically important that we reach as many people as possible in order to reach our goal. Please forward this campaign to all of your friends. While you're at it, please join us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/corkgrinders

Finally, we ask that you please use the IndieGoGo.com share tools to post a direct link for this campaign to your Facebook wall or Twitter Feed! Thank you so very much!

Chris & Virginia Kelly
Cork Grinders

story:
Klik hier voor Nederlands

Festival Redhead Days

Each year, during the first weekend of September, something magical happens. A huge crowd of redheads and their family, friends & admirers descend upon the city of Breda in the Netherlands. During this weekend, redheads stand out by their number as several thousand redheads from over 70 countries are joining together in one place.

The festival offers more than 50 activities: lectures about the origin of red hair, professional photo shoots of you, a fashion show with redheaded mannequins, a pub crawl, music, dance, sports and much more. All activities are free and open to everyone. It is a weekend full of fun for redheads and their fans. 

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need your help. Many of you tell us that the festival makes lots of people happy and proud; it is a place to meet old and new friends. Each year more people attend the event and each year it gets bigger and better. But now, unfortunately, the continuation of the event is endangered due to finances. Last year, there was a shortage of a serious amount of money, which had to be settled by the event founder, Bart, personally. He cannot do that again and as such, additional funding is very much needed.

That’s why we hope for your support! Every cent we raise with this campaign will be used directly in favour of the event. All organizers are volunteers and work on the event in their spare time.

Of course you will get something in return, besides our gratitude and a great festival. We have some awesome perks to choose from, even for a single dollar. Shipping costs are included, which makes it easier for you. But please do not order the elephant if you live in Australia!

 

Perks: what do you get?

*Please note that the images are a representation of the perks, and that the final product may look slightly different.

 

Smile!
For just one dollar you will get the digital group photo of 2013, depicting more than a thousand redheads. In high resolution! If you visit the event, for sure you are in it. But be aware, it might take some time to figure out where you are at the photo since everybody has red hair!

Silicones are forever
Start your collection of exclusive Redhead Days wristbands now! These silicone wrist bands will be available for a short time: now. It'll be in this year's theme colour so when you wear it at the future Redhead Days, you can show everyone which editions of the event you attended, simply by wearing the wristbands of those years! 

Sponsor lunch: picnic in the park
An epic picnic in the park (rug or picnic table will be provided). Join hundreds of sponsoring redheads and fans in this outdoor lunch.

T-shirt
Prior to the event you will receive a T-shirt, so you will be dressed in a fashionable T-shirt with the right colour during the festival. We'll email you after the campaign, to ask which size you need.

THE Book
This is the book that we’ve been planning to make for the last five years, and this year it can be yours. The Redhead Days book contains the group photos from all previous Redhead Days, as well as new photos from the 2013 edition. But there is so much more: artwork, things you didn’t know about the festival, things no one knows about our future plans for the 10th anniversary festival in 2015. And many, many things about red hair. Pre-ordering the book during this campaign will be cheaper than ordering it later.

In the spotlight 1
Be a model for our festival posters. These posters will be spread across the Breda region and they are huge (A0 size)! Of course, you'll also receive some (10) copies of your poster for you and your friends.

OR

In the spotlight 2
This perk will launch you into redhead heaven, as you and your camera will join Bart on his crane platform during the big photo shoot on Sunday. Many have pleaded for this chance... now it is yours!

The royal treatment
Be a V.I.P. during the entire Redhead Days weekend. An organisation member will personally pick you up at the airport or any other location within the Netherlands, and accompany you to Breda where you will stay at the best hotel (included). During the event, you'll dine with the organisers. Of course we will also accompany you on your way back home (at least to the airport) and you can take your pick from the perks mentioned above.

Be a-muse-d

You (or your loved one) is going to be immortalised on a large painting by Bart, the founder of the Redhead Days. And after that, it will be on your wall. And if you like, it will be part of the exhibition on the 2014 Redhead Days.

Picture yourself entering the big church of Breda, glancing over the artwork, and suddenly realising all visitors of the exhibition seem to recognise you. And as the crowd steps back, you see yourself in a life-size painting…

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • How about becoming a volunteer for the event? Help out with the preparations, or during the event, or both. There are lots of possibilities and for sure it will be fun!
  • Please use Indiegogo's share tools to help us spread the word.
  • Last but not least: if you agree with us that the event is important, and if you happen to own a company or if you are a philanthropist, please contact us directly. We might have some suggestions for you to make a difference for the Redhead Days and we are also curious to hear about your ideas.

 

 

The Impact

The Redhead Days is a lot of fun, but for many of us it is more than ‘just’ fun. The large numbers of both local and foreign guests, many of which from outside of Europe, prove that the event has a large impact on its visitors.

Many of you say that being with so many likeminded people and meeting so many people with the same background is refreshing. Many friendships have been formed. And the lectures, workshops, exhibitions, photo shoots, fashion shows etcetera; all provide interesting experiences. But most of all, you will immerse yourself in a crowd of fellow redheads who are truly proud of having red hair.

What is your motivation (to travel half way around the globe) to join the festival? 

Goals

We want to make this campaign as exciting as a horse race with a ginger horse in the lead ;-)

 

So, we've made a list of finish lines. For instance: if we reach $ 10,000, Scott (the maker of Being Ginger - the film) will shave off his hair and beard after the campaign finishes. If you don't want to rob him of his hair, then make sure we reach $ 20,000 so he's off the hook.

 

Goal

Reward

$ 1,000

There’ll be a fashion show

$ 2,000

There'll be 5 individual photo shoots

$ 3,000

There'll be 10 individual photo shoots

$ 4,000

There'll be a very special activity for children

$ 5,000

To be announced

$ 6,000

Instead of a normal bouncy castle, there'll be a ginormous one

$ 7,000

The 2014 Redhead Days will take place at 5 - 7 Sept. '14!

$ 8,000

Mike will compose a RHD song and perform it at the camping

$ 9,000

We'll add a contest for the longest beard to the event

$ 10,000

Scott will shave his hair and beard and show it on YouTube

$ 11,000

Surprise 1

$ 12,000

We'll add a carrot tossing competition to the event

$ 13,000

Surprise 2

$ 14,000

Mike will perform his song during the group photo session

$ 15,000

Bart will dye his hair red

>$ 15,000

Several awesome surprises! :-)

$ 17,500

Chantal and her guitar will join Mike when he performs his song

$ 20,000

Scott is off the hook and will NOT shave his hair and beard

Redhead Days Website - Redhead Days on Facebook - Redhead Days on Twitter

 

Back to the top

Festival Redhead Days

Ieder eerste weekend van september gebeurt er iets magisch: Een enorm aantal roodharigen en hun familie en vrienden strijken neer in het Nederlandse stadje Breda. Tijdens dit weekend vallen de roodharigen op door hun aantallen; duizenden roodharigen uit maar liefst 70! landen komen op één plaats samen.

Het festival biedt meer dan 50 activiteiten: lezingen over de geschiedenis van rood haar, professionele fotosessies met jou voor de camera, een modeshow met roodharige modellen, een kroegentocht, muziek, dans, sport en nog veel meer. Alle activiteiten zijn gratis en vrij toegankelijk voor iedereen. Het is een weekend barstensvol plezier en herkenning voor roodharigen en hun fans.

 

 

Wat wij nodig hebben & wat jij krijgt

Wij hebben jouw hulp nodig, vandaar deze campagne. We horen  dat het evenement jullie trots en gelukkig maakt; het is een plek om oude en nieuwe vrienden te ontmoeten. Elk jaar komen er meer mensen naar het evenement en elk jaar wordt het groter en beter.

Maar nu wordt het voorbestaan van het evenement helaas bedreigd door financien, of eerder het gebrek daar aan. Vorig jaar was er een groot tekort dat door de oprichter van het evenement, Bart, persoonlijk moest worden bijgepast. Hij kan dat niet nog een keer doen en dus zijn aanvullende inkomsten heel hard nodig.

Dat is waarom we hopen op jouw steun! Elke cent die we ophalen met deze campagne wordt direct in het evenement geïnvesteerd. Alle organisatoren zijn vrijwilligers die het werk voor de Redhead Days in hun vrije tijd doen.

Natuurlijk krijg je er iets voor terug, naast onze dankbaarheid en een geweldig festival. We hebben een aantal gave ‘perks’ waar je uit kunt kiezen, zelfs al voor een enkele dollar. Verzendkosten zijn inbegrepen, wat het voor jou makkelijker maakt. Maar bestel alsjeblieft niet de olifant als je in Australië woont! 

 

Perks: wat krijg je?

* Let op, de getoonde afbeeldingen vertegenwoordigen de perks, maar het uiteindelijke product kan iets afwijken.

Lach! (Smile!)
Voor slechts 1 dollar krijg je een digitaal exemplaar van de groepsfoto van 2013, waar meer dan duizend roodharigen op afgebeeld staan. In een hoge resolutie! Als je het evenement bezoekt, sta je er zeker op! Maar hou er rekening mee dat het even zoeken kan zijn waar jij staat, aangezien iedereen rood haar heeft!

Siliconen voor altijd (Silicones are forever)
Begin nu je verzameling exclusieve Redhead Days armbandjes! Deze diliconen armbandjes zullen maar korte tijd te koop zijn: vanaf nu. Wacht dus niet, maar sla nu je slag! Het bandje heeft de kleur die past bij het thema van dit jaar, dus als je het op de toekomstige Redhead Days ook draagt, kan iedereen meteen zien naar welke edities je bent geweest. Zo kun je leuk met anderen vergelijken wie wanneer is geweest!

Sponsor picnic/lunch
Een epische picknick in het park (kleedje of tafel wordt verzorgd). Voeg je bij honderden roodharige sponsors voor deze lunch in de buitenlucht.

T-shirt
Voorafgaand aan het evenement ontvang je een T-shirt, zodat je tijdens het evenement gekleed gaat in een hip T-shirt in de kleur van het festival. Na de campagne krijg je een mail waarin we vragen welke maat je wilt hebben.

HET Boek (THE book)
Dit is het boek dat we al vijf jaar willen maken en dit jaar kan het van jou zijn. Het Redhead Days boek bevat alle groepsfoto’s van alle voorgaande Redhead Days en natuurlijk de nieuwe foto’s uit 2013. Maar er staat zoveel meer in: kunst, dingen die je niet wist over het evenement en dingen die nog niemand weet over de toekomstplannen voor het festival in 2015. En heel veel dingen over rood haar. Vooraf bestellen tijdens de campagne is goedkoper dan het later kopen.

Het middelpunt van de aandacht (In the spotlight)
1: Word een model voor onze festivalposters. Deze posters worden in Breda en omgeving verspreid en ze zijn gigantisch (A0 formaat)! Natuurlijk krijg je ook een aantal (10) exemplaren van jouw poster voor jezelf en je vrienden.

OF

Het middelpunt van de aandacht (In the spotlight)
2: Met deze perk word je zo de roodharigen hemel in gelanceerd want jij en je camera gaan samen met Bart met een kraan de lucht in tijdens de grote fotosessie op zondag. Velen hebben gesmeekt om deze kans… Nu heb je hem!

 

De koning te rijk (The royal treatment)
Wees een V.I.P. tijdens het hele Redhead Days weekend. Een organisator van de Redhead Days haalt je op van het vliegveld of elke gewenste locatie in Nederland, waarna je naar Breda wordt gebracht. Daar verblijf je in het beste hotel (inbegrepen). Tijdens het evenement dineer je met de organisatie. Natuurlijk brengen we je ook weer terug (in elk geval naar het vliegveld) en je mag kiezen uit een van de bovenstaande perks.

Wees gea-muse-erd (Be a-muse-d)
Jij (of iemand van wie je houdt) wordt vereeuwigd in een groot schilderij, gemaakt door Bart, de oprichter van de Redhead Days. En daarna hangt het aan jouw muur. En als je wilt, wordt het tentoongesteld tijdens de Redhead Days 2014 kunst tentoonstelling.

 

 

Andere manieren om te helpen

 

  • Word vrijwilliger!Help ons bij de voorbereidingen, tijdens het festival, of allebei. Er zijn voldoende mogelijkheden en het is absoluut leuk om te doen!
  • Word ambassadeur:Gebruik alsjeblieft de deel-opties van Indiegogo om anderen over de campagne te vertellen.
  • Word sponsor/ filantroop: Als laatste, maar zeker niet als minste: als je het met ons eens bent dat het evenement belangrijk is en je toevallig een bedrijf hebt of filantroop bent  neem dan alsjeblieft direct contact met ons op. Misschien kunnen we elkaar helpen. Wij hebben genoeg suggesties voor een interessante samenwerking en zijn benieuwd naar die van jou.

 

De impact van de Redhead Days

De Redhead Days zijn hartstikke leuk, maar voor velen van ons is het veel meer dan ‘alleen’ maar leuk. De enorme aantallen bezoekers uit zowel binnen- als buitenland, waarvan velen zelfs van buiten Europa, bewijzen dat het evenement in een behoefte voorziet en een enorme indruk achterlaat bij de bezoekers.

Velen van jullie geven aan dat omgeven zijn door zoveel mensen met een vergelijkbare achtergrond en vergelijkbare ervaringen, heel verfrissend is. Vele vriendschappen zijn hier gevormd door de jaren heen.
De lezingen, workshops, tentoonstellingen, fotosessies, modeshow, enz., leveren stuk voor stuk bijzondere ervaringen op. Maar bovenal word je omgeven door een massa roodharigen die oprecht trots zijn op hun mooie rode haren.

Wat is jouw motivatie (om de halve wereld af te reizen) om naar het evenement te komen? 

 

Doelen

Doelen

We willen dat deze campagne zo spannend is als een paardenrace met een voskleurig paard aan kop ;-)

Daarom hebben we een lijst met finishes gemaakt. Bijvoorbeeld, als we $10,000 bereiken, scheert Scott (Harris, de maker van Being Ginger) na de campagne zijn haar en baard af. Als je hem niet van zijn haar wilt beroven, zorg dan dat we de $20,000 halen zodat hij opgelucht adem kan halen.

Doel

Beloning

$ 1,000

Er komt een modeshow

$ 2,000

Er komen 5 individuele fotosessies

$ 3,000

Er komen 10 individuele fotosessies

$ 4,000

Er komt een heel bijzondere activiteit voor kinderen

$ 5,000

Dit gaan we nog bedenken

$ 6,000

In plaats van een gewoon springkussen komt er een mega exemplaar

$ 7,000

De Redhead Days 2014 gaan definitief door op 5 - 7 sept. '14!

$ 8,000

Mike componeert een RHD lied en speelt het op de camping

$ 9,000

Er komt een wedstrijd voor de langste baard

$ 10,000

Scott scheert zijn hoofd kaal en plaatst het filmpje op YouTube

$ 11,000

Surprise 1

$ 12,000

Er komt een wedstrijd wortelsmijten

$ 13,000

Surprise 2

$ 14,000

Mike zal zijn lied spelen tijdens de grote fotosessie

$ 15,000

Bart verft zijn haar rood

>$ 15,000

Diverse geweldige verrassingen :-)

$17,500

Chantal en haar gitaar doen met Mike mee als hij zijn lied speelt

$ 20,000

Scott scheert zijn hoofd NIET kaal

Redhead Days Website - Redhead Days op Facebook - Redhead Days op Twitter

 Terug naar boven

Back to the top

Festival Redhead Days
Each year, during the first weekend of September, something magical happens. A huge crowd of redheads and their family, friends & admirers descend upon the city of Breda in the Netherlands. During this weekend, redheads stand out by their number as several thousand redheads from over 70 countries are joining together in one place. The festival offers more than 50 activities: lectures about the origin of red hair, professional photo shoots of you, a fashion show with redheaded mannequins, a pub crawl, music, dance, sports and much more. Wees gea-muse-erd (Be a-muse-d) Jij (of iemand van wie je houdt) wordt vereeuwigd in een groot schilderij, gemaakt door Bart, de oprichter van de Redhead Days. En daarna hangt het aan jouw muur. En als je wilt, wordt het tentoongesteld tijdens de Redhead Days 2014 kunst tentoonstelling.
 

 
Andere manieren om te helpen
 

Word vrijwilliger!Help ons bij de voorbereidingen, tijdens het festival, of allebei. Er zijn voldoende mogelijkheden en het is absoluut leuk om te doen!
Word ambassadeur:Gebruik alsjeblieft de deel-opties van Indiegogo om anderen over de campagne te vertellen.
Word sponsor/ filantroop: Als laatste, maar zeker niet als minste: als je het met ons eens bent dat het evenement belangrijk is en je toevallig een bedrijf hebt of filantroop bent  neem dan alsjeblieft direct contact met ons op. Misschien kunnen we elkaar helpen. Wij hebben genoeg suggesties voor een interessante samenwerking en zijn benieuwd naar die van jou.

 
De impact van de Redhead Days
De Redhead Days zijn hartstikke leuk, maar voor velen van ons is het veel meer dan ‘alleen’ maar leuk. De enorme aantallen bezoekers uit zowel binnen- als buitenland, waarvan velen zelfs van buiten Europa, bewijzen dat het evenement in een behoefte voorziet en een enorme indruk achterlaat bij de bezoekers.
Velen van jullie geven aan dat omgeven zijn door zoveel mensen met een vergelijkbare achtergrond en vergelijkbare ervaringen, heel verfrissend is. Vele vriendschappen zijn hier gevormd door de jaren heen.  De lezingen, workshops, tentoonstellingen, fotosessies, modeshow, enz., leveren stuk voor stuk bijzondere ervaringen op. Maar bovenal word je omgeven door een massa roodharigen die oprecht trots zijn op hun mooie rode haren.
Wat is jouw motivatie (om de halve wereld af te reizen) om naar het evenement te komen? 
 
Doelen
Doelen
We willen dat deze campagne zo spannend is als een paardenrace met een voskleurig paard aan kop ;-)

Daarom hebben we een lijst met finishes gemaakt. Bijvoorbeeld, als we $10,000 bereiken, scheert Scott (Harris, de maker van Being Ginger) na de campagne zijn haar en baard af. Als je hem niet van zijn haar wilt beroven, zorg dan dat we de $20,000 halen zodat hij opgelucht adem kan halen.



Doel


Beloning




$ 1,000


Er komt een modeshow




$ 2,000


Er komen 5 individuele fotosessies




$ 3,000


Er komen 10 individuele fotosessies




$ 4,000


Er komt een heel bijzondere activiteit voor kinderen




$ 5,000


Dit gaan we nog bedenken




$ 6,000


In plaats van een gewoon springkussen komt er een mega exemplaar




$ 7,000


De Redhead Days 2014 gaan definitief door op 5 - 7 sept. '14!




$ 8,000


Mike componeert een RHD lied en speelt het op de camping




$ 9,000


Er komt een wedstrijd voor de langste baard




$ 10,000


Scott scheert zijn hoofd kaal en plaatst het filmpje op YouTube




$ 11,000


Surprise 1




$ 12,000


Er komt een wedstrijd wortelsmijten




$ 13,000


Surprise 2




$ 14,000


Mike zal zijn lied spelen tijdens de grote fotosessie




$ 15,000


Bart verft zijn haar rood




>$ 15,000


Diverse geweldige verrassingen :-)




$17,500


Chantal en haar gitaar doen met Mike mee als hij zijn lied speelt




$ 20,000


Scott scheert zijn hoofd NIET kaal



Redhead Days Website - Redhead Days op Facebook - Redhead Days op Twitter
 Terug naar boven

Back to the top

story:
Short Summary

My name is Taylor Evans, I'm currently a yoga instructor in Harrisonburg, VA. I've been practicing for 5+ years and teaching for just over a year and it's the most rewarding job I've ever had by far.  

I'm hear to ask for your help: I need to raise $10,000 in order to join an amazing team of individuals who work as ambassadors to Africa Yoga Project (AYP) based in Nairobi, Kenya. 

AYP is a non-profit organization that provides 300+ free yoga classes a week in Kenya, both in Nairobi and villages across the country. While that's awesome, what drew me to AYP was their commitment to training Kenyans to be their own leaders, in the yoga classroom and out. AYP has trained over 50 individuals to be instructors in a classroom context as well as leaders of change in their own communities, providing support to at-risk youth, the homeless, and HIV/AIDS afflicted communities. My hope is to join this wonderful team for a minimum of 14 days in service to the communities of Nairobi and beyond by donating my time and my skills as a yoga instructor, organizer, and former farmer to help build healthy and sustainable communities. 

Yoga has changed my life beyond all my expectations. This practice has empowered me to be authentic to myself and to be of service to others in everything that I do. The small piece of peace I've come to know and love from yoga has motivated me to share this amazing tool for self-empowerment with others, I'm hoping you can help with that dream. 

What We Need & What You Get

The total cost for the ambassador program is $10,000, all of which goes towards AYP and their projects. This may include: paying local teacher's salaries for their donation-based classes, funding education for youth throughout Kenya, funding trauma-relief training for individuals to better serve in their communities.  

Regardless of the total amount raised, all funding will go to AYP and the eventual fundraising goal of $10,000. For more information on AYP's business and philanthropic model, visit this link.  

I'm asking for your help in raising at least a portion of these funds, thanks so much for your input!

The Impact

AYP works tirelessly to provide a path towards peace for individuals who might otherwise not ever get to experience the joy of getting in touch with themselves. I was drawn to AYP not only because of my personal experience with yoga, but because of their dedication to training individuals to empower themselves and their communities. The world needs leaders willing to be in action in their communities more than anything so that change becomes sustainable. Having met and trained with several individuals from AYP, I'm unable to express the sheer joy and possibility these people have in their life thanks to this program. 

More concretely, given the recent events in Nairobi, a significant portion of these funds will go towards providing trauma-response training to teachers so that they may better serve their communities that have been impacted by violence, corruption, and poverty.  

The funds raised will also assist me in giving back to these communities as well. Each ambassador spends one week "observing" and one week "serving" using unique skills they have. Given my experience with farming, gardening, and food production, I hope to spend my service week establishing several plots to provide food and a small outlet for stress to the communities I am assigned.  

Your donation can help make a direct impact in my life and the lives of the hundreds of people that pass through AYP's doors each week. Thank you so much!

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread to word here and on every social media platform you know of (heck, instagram this page if you want).

story:
About Keith Walters...

What do you do when life knocks you down? You get back up and keep reaching for your dream!

There are many people in the world struggling with financial difficulties these days, and I'm no stranger to that experience!

That's the situation I found myself in early last year when my health forced me to leave the "comfortable" 9-to-5 job world behind. I didn't accept defeat! I was determined to march forward and find a better and more satisfying way to make a living working on my own...

So I thought about all of the things that I loved to do... photography, video, working with computers, helping others... and the result was Refresh Your Life TV!

I've been climbing my way up in the Home Business Market over the past few months... but now I need your help to Overcome this Health Related Financial Obstacle so I can Move Forward... FULL STEAM AHEAD!!!

RefreshYourLife.TV is going to be my "One Stop Shop" for everything I have been working on over the past few months.

Your contributions will enable me to pay off my medical debt so I can FOCUS on building my business and helping other people learn how to become successful while doing the things they love to do!

I'm offering a few fun incentives for helping me make this happen!

I Really Need You're Help asap!

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

What I NEED is to get rid of this Medical Debt so I can have the Financial Resources I need to move forward with my business.

You get the satisfaction of being a blessing to me and knowing that your contribution will enable me to be successful and to ultimately help other people do the same.

 

The Impact

By contributing to this campaign you are ultimately helping other people to acquire training and new skills that will help them overcome their financial difficulties.

Starting this business has been a Life Changing Event for me (as it would be for anyone), and it requires a lot of time and money "over and above" just meeting my monthly expenses in order to get all of the work completed. Your support will help me overcome my final obstacles as I move forward.

I sincerely appreciate anything and everything you can do to help me make this a great success!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

For those of you who can contribute financially, and for those of you who can't - I ask the following:

Please help me get the word out about my campaign!

Please use the share tools under the video to Email, Tweet, or Share with Your Friends, Family, Co-workers, Neighbors on Facebook... or...

Send them an email with the link to this campaign...

 

I sincerely appreciate anything you can do to help!

 

Thanks SO much, and Have a Great Day!!!

story:
Video produced by Red Door Media

If these walls could talk, they would tell you of potluck suppers, and Maine farming families, of dances and rituals, and of the important role that Granges played for farmers in America.  They would tell of talent shows, and abundant harvests, crop failures and where we got our seed.  And, these walls would sing in support of keeping central Maine's farms and families strong.

With help from Indiegogo, we aim to raise $40,000 in 40 days to begin renovations to the former Grange which will join the local food 'hub' by providing a home for another creative food-based startup business downtown.

A young entrepreneur from Maine aims to launch a local grain malting operation, Blue Ox Malt, using the first floor of the old grange. Malting is the craft of germinating, caramelizing, and drying grain for use in making beer, spirits, confections, malt vinegar, milkshakes and more. With a burgeoning local food movement afoot nationwide, small craft malting operations are beginning to pop up in places like MA and SC. This would be the first in Maine.

Scheduled for demolition, Stephen Dionne and Amber Lambke put in a bid to buy the Grange.  The owner, Skowhegan Savings Bank, granted the sale of the building for $15,000- with the promise that Steve and Amber repurpose the building and make a positive contribution to the local economy.

The old Grange building is structurally sound and has beautiful features still intact, like the hand painted canvas curtain hanging in the upstairs stage area, and the original 118 year old windows.  The upstairs floor will be used by cloggers, a theater group, and contra dancers for old fashioned family fun. Indiegogo funds will be used to paint the building, restore the windows, and repair the roof, preparing the building for tenants.                

            

The Maine State Grange, an agricultural organization known formally as the Maine State Grange of the Patrons of Husbandry, was organized in Maine in 1873. As well as providing a place for rural men and women to meet, learn and socialize, the Grange also worked to improve economic and social conditions, engaging in cooperative activities, offering insurance and taking positions on important legislative issues. The Grange grew rapidly after its formation, having over 200 chapters by 1876 and reaching almost 600 chapters at its peak. After 1960 the number of Granges began to decline sharply and the upkeep of their foundation buildings in rural centers became too expensive.   The Skowhegan Grange building was originally built in 1894.   

Dionne has just completed a two year renovation of the former Somerset County Jail building to house a new gristmill for processing Maine grown grains and has been impressed by the substantial growth of the downtown farmer's market in recent years. "With the successful Kneading Conference and Artisan Bread Fair, the Gristmill, a Main Street Program and the farmer's market right here in Skowhegan, the Grange will be another important addition to the infrastructure that can house a growing number of food businesses here in Skowhegan. With all of the positive effort going in to agriculture and downtown revitalization in this area, it seems only appropriate to restore one of Skowhegan's most important agricultural buildings in the community." 

Crowd funding platforms like Indiegogo provide a valuable tool for making posiitve change.  We hope you'll give what you can, check back often to see how we're doing meeting out $40,000 goal.  Thank you so much for your support!!

Steve and Amber

story:
About BLANKS®

My name is Alex Levytskyi, Inventor and Co-Founder of BLANKS. Along with my partner and Co-founder Natalia Mordarskyi, we’re launching this Crowd Funding Campaign to help us introduce BLANKS Pre-Rolled Smoking Papers across the World. With your generous contributions we plan to:

  • Upgrade to next level manufacturing

  • Increase Inventory

  • Expand sales and marketing across the world

With your help we can reach out and spread the word about the convenience, cost savings and Earth-friendliness of BLANKS. We put 10 Pre-Rolled Smoking Paper tubes in every box of BLANKS. At about $3 a box that’s already a huge savings over what you’re probably paying for cigarettes plus there’s no need to take in all of those chemicals that most cigarette manufacturers add.

BLANKS are always ready to be filled with whatever smoking mixture you enjoy. BLANKS are totally adjustable and provide a much purer smoke with no waste of your mixture or pollution of filtered butts loading into landfill. We think we’ve come up with a smarter, cleaner way to roll your own with BLANKS and we’re excited to show you why.

We are passionate about our project because we believe that with BLANKS, for those of us who chose to smoke, we can now choose the length and quality of our smoke.

We’re proud to offer a whole range of thank you perks in return for your kind donations to our little start-up. We’re passionate about it and are glad you are too. We’ve even made up BLANKS branded lighters, ashtrays and t-shirts for you... We’re also offering our major supporters opportunities to become Distributors of BLANKS Pre-Rolled Smoking Papers. For our biggest supporters we reserve Wholesaler Level perks.

So that’s the whole story. If you want to take part in our venture and to make rolling your own easier, less costly and friendlier to the Earth please contribute.

We’re planning many fun events to go along with this crowd funding campaign and hope we can include you among our new friends and supporters. As a contributor we will send you invitations to all of our events. We'll send you status of our crowd funding. And news and information on BLANKS. And of course our huge gratitude on our supporters page.

Thank you for the time you took to find out about our project. We hope to see you soon at one of our events or on our growing online community.

 

About the Founders of BLANKS®

Alex Levitsky and Natalia Mordarskyi were both born in Ukraine. Alex came to the US to attend Brooklyn College to study Finance with a minor in Accounting. Natalia went to the prestigious Ivano-Frankvisk National Technical University before coming to New York. She instantly fell in love with New York and chose to make it her home. Alex and Natalia met as co-workers.

Alex had been experimenting with evolving a smoking device that had been popular in Russia for over 75 years. Papirosi are hollow cigarette tubes with a cardboard extender and he had been using them for a little while. His college classmates had never tried them and though they were able to fill them with the smoking mixture of their choice there were many issues that made them utterly frustrating. First you would have to dump the cheap, low grade tobacco of the papirosi. Then the fill would land up in your mouth and the design was nearly impossible to adjust. With some ingenuity and access to a manufacturer of the old style papirosi back in Ukraine Alex directed a smart yet simple retooling of the machinery and BLANKS® were born. When Natalia entered the picture she saw the potential of this easy, new way to “roll your own” as having huge potential in her adopted home, America. She recognized smokers everywhere are tired of all of the chemicals added to domestic cigarettes and will also appreciate the minimized ecological impact of BLANKS. A partnership emerged. Together Natalia and Alex got the international patents, created a company and developed BLANKS into the entrepreneurial endeavor it is today.

Budget

$15,000: modernize manufacture (Equipment, machinery), increase production capacity beyond current rate of the Ukraine machine

$4,000: build inventory

$6,000: spread the word with various marketing methods, including video marketing, and event marketing

story:
Lets raise some bucks for the family of the Heroes,every little helps a lot. Thanks to everyone

I can't remember the last time I cried before today. I worked side by side with the Granite Mountain crew for two weeks last summer on the Wesley Fire in Idaho. During that two weeks I got to know these men in a way that only men can become acquainted on a fireline. Tired, dirty and pushing ourselves to the limits daily we still found time for pleasantries and humor. They were one of the strongest crews I have ever worked with and I will never forget them. I have many photos from that fire I will try to post in here for everyone. My thoughts and prayers are with these heroes and their families and loved ones. -Justin Tyler

I want to thank everyone for prayers and support to the families it means a lot to us...... My cousin Garrett was a member of the Granite Mountain Hot Shots. He's the redhead.... he didn't survive.

story:
This campaign is raising funds on behalf of Lake Baikal Heritage Foundation, a verified nonprofit. The campaign does not necessarily reflect the views of the nonprofit or have any formal association with it. All contributions are considered unrestricted gifts and can't be specified for any particular purpose.

Hi all, Hans here.

I have always enjoyed the beautiful wilderness spaces available to us all in and around California, and am passionate about preserving undeveloped space for wildlife habitat and the mental health of humans, and have fantasized about exploring other parts of the world and have always thought that the best way to get to know a place is to go there with a purpose!

Over the past few months I have been moved by the beauty of Mongolia and one of the last, ancient largest freshwater lakes in the world, Lake Hovsgol.  The Mongolians call this body of water "The Mother Sea".  The Lake and the wildlife park around it are unique on this planet, and under threat from poachers and illegal developers tooling around in jeeps and 4x4's.  

The park is patrolled by rangers, mostly on horseback or decrepit old motorcycles.  The rangers need better transportation to do their job catching poachers and illegal developers, and the motorcycles they have are old, tired and inadequate.  The horses are even less effective.

I am raising funds to buy an off-road motorcycles and gear.  On my own dime, I am going to go to Mongolia and deliver them to the rangers in person. My team-mates will train them in off-road riding techniques and motorcycle maintenance (something I'll learn there as well!) It'll be a long ride of 1200 miles in 9 days - quite a challenge for me since I haven't really ridden much over the last 20 years!

Lake Hovsgol is one of the last best places!

The Lake and surrounding wildlife area is a National Park bigger than Yellowstone and strictly protected as a transition zone between Central Asian Steppe and the Siberian Taiga.  It's one of 17 ancient lakes that are more than 2 million years old, and the water is so clean you can drink it without any treatment.  There are a number of indigenous people that live around it and depend on it for their water supply.  In fact  it contains 70% of all the surface freshwater supply for the whole country of Mongolia.  There is no body of water this clean and this large in America.

So what's threatening it?

Illegal poaching, including illegal drift net fishing: The lake has fish, including two endemic species, and since it's a lake, those fish can easily become overfished as every other fish population in the world has become.  The surrounding parklands are home to a number of really awesome animals, including ibex, argali, elk, wolf, wolverine, musk deer, brown bear, Siberian moose, and sable.

Mongolia has done a good job designating this area as a wildlife preserve to protect the survival of these animals, but enforcement is challenging.  Rangers have been stabbed and injured trying to enforce the law against poachers, who stand to make a great deal of money in the short term.

Illegal development and tourism: It shouldn't be news to Americans that people in and from outside Mongolia are eager to develop properties around the lake.  Rangers have caught individuals simply building around it without permits. Run off and pollution from illegal development and road building is certain to pollute the lake, as well as impact wildlife habitat.  Additionally outsiders have come in and started developing environmental tourism projects without necessarily caring for the habitat or obtaining permission.

But they have rangers to enforce the laws, right?

Yes, the whole park is about 4,600 square miles (1.2m hectares) and there are 15 permanent rangers and a few seasonal ones.  Each ranger patrols over 300 square miles of park, which is about the same size as all the boroughs in New York City.  And they do it mostly on horseback.    Imagine if there was only one policeman in a space as big as the five boroughs of New York City, and he was on horseback chasing bad guys in jeeps.

The poachers and illegal users in the park tool around in jeeps, 4x4's, and other vehicles.  Did I also mention the poachers are armed?

The rangers have asked for help by in the form of offroad motorcycles, gear, and training.  With modern offroad motorcycles, they could patrol more effectively and discourage lawbreakers.

So why do I care, and how can I help?

It's true, Mongolia is halfway around the world, but I care, and here's why:

  • We don't have that many wild places left in the world.  
  • We don't have that much wildlife left in the world.
  • I love motorcycles, and it's not often that my love of motorcycles could have such a huge impact for a good cause.

Even if you aren't moved by this situation, I ask that you support me in my effort to keep this wild area as pristine as possible.   You can help by donating to help cover the cost of two motorcycles and equipment.

Where does the money go?

100% of the money you donate is tax-deductible, and goes to buy and ship the motorcycles and equipment. I am paying my own ticket over, and the Mongol Ecology Center is not taking any of it for administration, it all goes directly to equipment for the rangers! 

I am trying to fund one motorcycles and equipment.  Each motorcycle and equipment, along with shipping, costs $7,550. Indiegogo fees on the total amount are $585.12  ($7,550*2+$585.12 = $8135.12)   I am trying to raise enough to outfit one of the 15 rangers.  Any additional money goes to buying a second and eventually third motorcycle if I exceed my fundraising goal.  

If I raise additional funds, but not enough for an entire motorcycle and gear, the Mongol Ecology Center has agreed to pool it with the funds raised by other riders to fund another complete motorcycle.

How you can help

Please donate, donate, donate!!!!

story:
Glasgow Skeptics - a grassroots, non-aligned, not-for-profit organisation - has already done the hard work, and has organised a large, open, and accessible debate, to take place in the Mitchell Theatre on March 24th.

Three speakers for both Yes and No will make their case in this open, free, and public forum. Details can be found here and here.

Speaking for Yes

  • Tasmina Ahmed-Sheikh, Yes Scotland Advisory Board Member & SNP MEP Candidate
  • Patrick Harvie MSP, co-convenor of the Scottish Green Party
  • Cat Boyd, Radical Independence Campaign



Speaking for No

  • Jackson Carlaw MSP, Deputy Leader of the Scottish Conservatives
  • Jackie Ballie MSP, Scottish Labour Party, Shadow Cabinet Secretary for Health
  • Willie Rennie MSP, Leader of the Scottish Liberal Democrats


It's not been easy, but we've managed to make this event free and open to all who wish to attend, because the question we need to answer on September 18th is so important.

If you believe that fair and impartial debates organised by non-aligned organisations form an important part of the dialogue that should take place in modern society, please do consider helping to fund this event.

We have always sought to make our events free and open to all, counting solely on the generosity of our audiences to make ends meet. We are proud to be able to deliver a free and open event once again, and hope for your support in allowing this to continue into the future.


Thanks,

Glasgow Skeptics

story:
Youth Batters Mat

The Youth Batters Mat was an idea I came up with while watching my 4 year old at softball practice. I noticed the coach drawing lines in the sand, putting bats behind the kids, and always adjusting their legs, and so my idea was born. I designed a prototype and started the testing. The results were phenomenal. I had the Batters mat patented with a provisional patent, redesigned to work for kids aged from 4 to 13 and had a few made and sent to me for further testing. I sent pictures and videos of my product to only 2 sport retail chains and they both have placed 2000 piece orders as soon as production starts. The Youth Batters Mat will work for left handed or right handed batters, its lightweight, durable, teaches muscle memory, and improves a child's batting for softball, T'ball and baseball. I will be distributing these mats from a local warehouse facility to the distribution centers of sport retail stores.
The ware house is a 4000 sq ft facility and to make up some of the room I would like to open an indoor skateboard park for kids to have a place to go, off the streets, where they can be safe, active, and enjoy themselves while doing what they love, skateboarding. 

WHO AM I?

My name is Steve, I started a residential rehab business 5 years ago that has grown to be a very successful company. I currently rehab houses for 3 different banks,2 asset companies and 2 local companies. I am married, have 2  kids, a 16 year old son, a 5 year old daughter, and both of them love to skateboard and my daughter loves softball just as much. I have been skateboarding with my son since he was 5 years old and my daughter just started 2 years ago. I am very active personally and professionally.
WHY WE NEED FUNDING?
The first order of mats will cost me $32,000 to get them printed and shipped, I have already spent roughly $12,000 in design and manufacturing thus far to get to a final product and to have it patented. The Warehouse cost I am covering myself as i do have my own funds aside for this project. The wooden ramps in the warehouse for the park will cost roughly $25,000 to build. Permits and Licenses for the building will be roughly $2000.
WHAT WILL THE IMPACT BE?
We have decided that if this campaign is successful we will donate $1 from every Batters Mat sold to the Richland NICU hospital so they can maintain and keep the equipment they need to save childrens' lives just as they did with my daughter, she was dead for 3 1/2 minutes when she was born and had lost 2/3 of her blood. We will also hold 2 fundraisers a year at the skate park, 1 for the American Cancer Society as this is important because I lost my mother to cancer when i was 20, and 1 for the local fire dept. and police dept. because these are the people that put their lives on the line for us and our kids when we need them. I believe holding these fundraisers will teach the kids how to give back to the community in a positive way and teach them the positive impact they can make to their community and the people in it. They are they future!

story:
Hello! I am Araya (like A-Ray-A Sunshine).  I am a wife, mother of two and gal behind Wind & Willow Home.  I created Wind & Willow Home two years ago out of necessity when I was laid off after twelve years as a Kitchen and Bath Designer.  I decided to channel the same passion for beauty and functional design into creating a line of modern-classic wooden housewares. I design, then slowly hand dip each piece into a custom rubber material that I carefully mix in my basement studio in Minneapolis, Minnesota. 


    ____________________________________________________________

GROWING

While I completely love creating modern wooden housewares, I am consistently getting requests for coordinating table wares such as tea towels, napkins and table linens in the same organic modern to style Wind and Willow Home has come to be known by. I am excited to have this crowd funding opportunity to accommodate these requests and introduce a line of soft goods that complement the cheerful aesthetic of my housewares as the next step in growing my business.

    ______________________________________________________________

PAYING IT FORWARD

It has always been a dream of mine to help change people’s lives. I have been so fortunate in this endeavor that I want to show my gratitude by paying it forward.   A portion of the funds raised through this Indigogo campaign will help to launch our BOWL FULL initiatives.  Through the BOWL FULL project, Wind & Willow Home will donate a minimum of 1 meal per item sold to feed the hungry near and far, in addition to volunteering our time in pursuit of this cause. 

    ____________________________________________________________

HOW YOU CAN HELP

I need your help!  I am turning to my strongest supporters to ask for contributions to assist with my growth plans. I need to raise $12,200 to help cover the cost of materials, development, production and support to bring the soft goods line to life.  I also need to hire professional help to integrate the giving aspect into the website in order to launch the BOWL FULL project and help to hire our first full-time employee to assist in increasing operations.

42% of your pledges will cover the raw materials, inks and set up needed to begin creating the first full line of our new collection.

18% of your pledges will cover the production costs associated with the first run of product.

30%  of your pledges will go to hiring the necessary professional website design and development help to integrate the giving aspect of the BOWL FULL project into our website.

The remaining 10% will go towards incentives and admin. fees

   ____________________________________________________________

GIVING AT IT'S BEST

In exchange for your help, I'm offering some exclusive products made only for this event.  I am also giving you a chance to join the creative team by producing an exclusive color, in your name, to add to our seasonal offerings. Your contribution will help maintain my important retail partnerships, grow the brand and further, it will help Wind & Willow Home stay at the forefront of modern housewares while doing good for others.


 

These incentives are geared toward giving, whether it be for Mother's Day, Wedding Gifts or a great piece for a Graduate.  It's a great way for you to score fantastic products in addition to helping a small business grow. It's giving at it's best.



    ____________________________________________________________

WHY SUPPORT MY PROJECT

UNIQUENESS: You will be giving a one of a kind gift (or receive a special piece for yourself) since each and every incentive is make exclusively for this Indiegogo Project.

QUALITY: Wind and Willow Home is part of the "maker movement" which means we value quality over quantity. Our products are made by hand, with care and attention to detail.

SUPPORT A SMALL BRAND: Many incredible brands such as Google, Apple and Yankee Candle started out from small beginnings.  I am still a small brand in need of your help to expand and realize our full potential.

MAKE A DIFFERENCE:  Upon the launch of our BOWL FULL project, each and every purchase from Wind & Willow Home will help feed those near and far.  I also want you to join me in future volunteer events that I will be holding.

INNOVATION WORTH SPREADING: You'll help to run our first softgoods production so more people can enjoy our pieces! We believe in creating modern housewares, designed and made sustainably in the USA.

    ____________________________________________________________

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Please get the word out. Tell everyone you know about our campaign!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools. It really makes a difference!
  • Volunteer with us.  If you are in the Minneapolis area and would like to help us fill bowls, please feel free to contact us at hello@windandwillowhome.com
    _____________________________________________________________

A HUGE THANKS

A huge thank you to those who have helped this project come to fruition:

The lovely and talented Maribeth Romslo of Hello Sunshine Films for the beautiful introduction video.

Brittany White for her help in the studio and her graphic talents as seen above.

Forage Modern Workshop for this beautiful write up, hosting our crowdfunding launch party and for being a great source of support for not only myself and Wind & Willow Home but many, many Artists and Makers.

Thanks to BRIKA for the support of the hand made community sharing the importance of a Well-Crafted Life.

MADESMITH and Wing Ta of Canary Grey photography for the beautiful images of me in my studio and helping support and build a beautiful community of American Makers.

JORDAN for relentlessly researching ways to make my job and life easier.  Thanks honey!

Thanks to all of my friends and fans who have encouraged and supported me in this exciting and challenging endovor.  You guys are the greatest!
