story:
Minifigs Bricks and More needs your help to open our doors

We are a company that specializes in New and Used Lego® Merchandise. We have been selling Lego® products on the internet for more than five years. It has been our dream to open a brick and mortar store since 2007. It will be like a Gamestop®, but with Lego products. (The Gamestop® of Lego®) We will also provide a great place to have a birthday party. We are Minifigs Bricks and More, LLC.

We are running this campaign because we have been approved by a bank for a $25,000 line of credit. Which is great news, but the one stipulation is that we come up with $25,000 of our own money before they will open the line of credit. Without your help to make this campaign succeed, the brick and mortar store will not open. The dream of bringing an awesome Lego experience to Denton, TX will just remain a dream.

The bank has agreed to use our $10,000 in inventory as part of the $25,000 stipulation. So it is vital to raise the remaining $15,000 to get our store off the ground.

We will use the $15,000 from this campaign to buy key items for our store (i.e. POS machines, fixtures, computers) as well as securing a lease on a store front. Any amount that you could contribute would be awesome!  We also have some great perks such as Lego Minifigures, Lego blocks, and birthday parties.

Finally, we need your help in sharing our campaign to the social media world. Please tweet, like, +1, pin, instagram, yelp, and share our campaign and website on all of your social media outlets to get the word out and make this campaign a success.

 

What You Get

I have already explained what we need, so here is what YOU get. By contributing to the campaign you will receive many awesome items once our store opens, such as build your own Lego minifigs, Lego blocks, and even birthday parties. Check out the perks on the right side of this page.

 

The Impact

This campaign is just a starter to bigger and brighter things for Minifigs Bricks and More. Some future plans include: after school enrichment programs involving Lego Robotics, sponsoring and helping out a First Lego League team (Robotics Team).  Many more ideas are in the works and we can share them at a later date.

As parents of three, we love kids and enjoy spending time with them. Lego® is a great teaching tool and we are excited to show kids how to not only have fun but to learn while having fun. Science, Technology, Engineering and Math are the areas of education we would like to reach. As teachers at heart we see Lego as the perfect toy to acheive this.

Our store will also have a large impact on the local environment. We will provide a place for people to bring their Lego pieces in for store credit or cash, rather than throwing them in the local dump. I can't tell you how many times I have heard that parents just throw their kids Lego in the garbage.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can contribute financially, but don't let that stop you from helping us out. You can help by spreading the word to your friends, family, and everyone you know, and by sharing this campaign on all of your social networks. Click on the share links below . This would help us out tremendously. Thanks.

Disclaimer:

LEGO® is a trademark of the LEGO Group, which does not sponsor, authorize, or endorse this project. Gamestop® is a trademark of GameStop Corporation, which does not sponsor, authorize, or endorse this project.
story_txt:
Minifigs Bricks and More needs your help to open our doors
We are a company that specializes in New and Used Lego® Merchandise. We have been selling Lego® products on the internet for more than five years. It has been our dream to open a brick and mortar store since 2007. It will be like a Gamestop®, but with Lego products. (The Gamestop® of Lego®) We will also provide a great place to have a birthday party. We are Minifigs Bricks and More, LLC.
We are running this campaign because we have been approved by a bank for a $25,000 line of credit. Which is great news, but the one stipulation is that we come up with $25,000 of our own money before they will open the line of credit. Without your help to make this campaign succeed, the brick and mortar store will not open. The dream of bringing an awesome Lego experience to Denton, TX will just remain a dream.
The bank has agreed to use our $10,000 in inventory as part of the $25,000 stipulation. So it is vital to raise the remaining $15,000 to get our store off the ground.
We will use the $15,000 from this campaign to buy key items for our store (i.e. POS machines, fixtures, computers) as well as securing a lease on a store front. Any amount that you could contribute would be awesome!  We also have some great perks such as Lego Minifigures, Lego blocks, and birthday parties.
Finally, we need your help in sharing our campaign to the social media world. Please tweet, like, +1, pin, instagram, yelp, and share our campaign and website on all of your social media outlets to get the word out and make this campaign a success.

story:
Katavi Sun Project

For Each Item Purchased We Will Donate An Item To Someone In Need.

Katavi has developed a natural sunscreen made from 75% organic ingredients to safely fight against the sun’s harsh rays. Our sunscreen was created while taking into consideration our environment, our customers, and those in need. We want to bring you with the best natural sunscreen at a competitive price. In addition, we want to extend our belief in proper sun protection to other great products including sun protective clothing, sun protective hats, lip balms, and more.

This Indiegogo project was started to help us raise the funds needed to finish our line of sunscreen, graphic t-shirts, and to help us raise awareness for the Katavi brand and mission. Our commitment to the "buy one, give one" model begins with this project. Your donations will not only supply you with awesome sunscreen and sun gear, it will also send those same items to someone in need.

Katavi was founded under the simple notion that everyone deserves proper sun protection. The sunscreen industry is dominated by major global pharmaceutical companies who are purveying inferior products and swimming in profit, while others suffer. Our mission is to provide consumers with a higher-quality sunscreen combined with a greater social purpose.

Our company was founded on a strong belief in sustainability and giving back. We have partnered with non-profits to help bring proper sun protection products to those in need. When you purchase our sunscreen and other products, you are protecting yourself as well as helping others. “Be Safe. Help Others.”

Read more about our mission to provide sun protection to those in need at:http://www.katavisun.com/our-mission/

Please help us spread the word about the Katavi Sun Project by telling your friends and family, and be sure to join us on Facebook and Twitter.

Our Perks

Check out our perks. All contribution amounts include shipping. International contributers please add $10.

story:
We are two kids (not really kids @ 26 & 36 ) who are madly in love.

We could use any help in funding our 2013 wedding that we can get, being as it is just us (seriously no help) who are paying for everything.

It would be so great to have the worry of expenses behind us when we finally tie the knot.

With your support we can be at ease by paying for:

 

Event location=$3500

Reception=$3000+

Event insurrance + wedding license= $380+or-

Rental of pa and chairs etc= $500+or-

 

By contributing to our cause you can feel greatness in knowing that two amazing lives will begin the greatest days they could have ever dreamed of in marital bliss...


With much appreciation and sincerest regards we thank you for your support.

Please leave contact info after contributing and we will be certain to reward your generosity with a token (artwork or photo, we are artists hence the need for help) of our grattitude.

story:
Introducing our Robotics Development Environment

Hi, we are Damiano and Dario, two brothers from Rome, Italy. We are both fans of Robotics, Computer programming and electronics.

We would like to present you a new Open Source mechanical system designed mainly for the development of robotics solutions.

Have you ever dreamed of a system similar to the one you played when you were a child, but that allows you to create professional machines?

This system is already here!

We have called this system Rackbot (N.B. We are currently looking for a new name)

This system is based on a series of professional aluminum metal components that can be interconnected with each other using screws and nuts to create an infinite number of combinations.

Our system allows to create:

  • Robotics Chassis
  • Robotics Arms
  • Computer Cases
  • Boxes, Cubes, Parallelepipeds
  • Electronics Boards Holders
  • Frames for Vehicles models
  • Rovers
  • Electric Motors and RC Servo Brackets
  • Moving Parts
  • Suspensions Systems
  • Whatever your imagination can create!

 

Our Dream

Our solution was born from problems we have personally experienced regarding the difficulty in finding material for mechanics prototyping.

Our philosophy was to create a fully compatible hardware and software ecosystem, a reference point for those who want to invent and create without wasting time and money searching for components from different suppliers and without building mechanical parts with wood, plastic and non-professional materials.

When we designed our chassis system we had the following features in mind:

  • Durable, professional and light components made in Aluminum
  • Smart project design: very few pieces to build everything!
  • Easily hackable and expandable with DIY components
  • Open Source!
  • Support for electronic boards, servomotors, electric engines, sensors and wheels
  • Development Kits for Mechanics, Rovers, Hexapods, Humanoid Robots and Arms
  • Arduino based electronics
  • Smartphone support: iPhone and Android
  • And, last but not least, a Stunning Cutting-Edge design!

 

Open Source!

When we will open again the website we will release this system under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported License to enable students and researchers to expand the chassis without any restrictions.  This means that the community will contribuite to expand the ecosystem!

 

What we want to do

We would like to offer several, well documented, different types of development kits:

The Arduino Development Kits - The Brain

These Development Kits include an Arduino, a breadboard, a LCD, several hardware parts and a cool chassis! The most advanced kit is called iDK. The iDK includes a special Arduino shield that allows the iDK to be remotely controlled by iPhone, iPod Touch and iPad (Android coming soon). It can be used for many applications like domotics, data-logging, remote control and also like the CPU part of the Rovers.

The Lunar Rover Development Kits

The Lunar Rover is a Robotics Development platform very durable and affordable. It is possible to choose the 2WD or the 4WD version and the electronics is optional. There is also a Sumo Warrior version that is not yet listed in the website.

The Mars Explorer Development Kits

The Mars Explorer is a stunning Robotics Development platform with a smart suspension system that allows the Rover to easily climb obstacles. It is possible to choose the 4WD or the 6WD version with optional electronics. 

 

Mechanics And Electronics Spare Parts

We offer also Mechanics and Electronics spare parts to allow users to personalize, expand and create their own Robot Platform.

Software and Apps

We have already developed two Applications for iOS that can connect via WiFi to the Arduino. Our applications allow you to remotely control the Arduino I/Os and drive the rovers via accelerometer. They are already on the iOS App Store and can be downloaded for free (Search "Rackbot" on the App Store).

We have also developed a firmware for Arduino board that allows you to drive the Arduino I/O from remote and control the rovers

 IMPORTANT NEWS! Now you can control the Rovers also with Android Devices! The App was developed by some students from the University of Rome. Thanks Guys and keep up the good work! To download the Android App please follow this link:https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=i...

What We Need

We have in mind a lot of news for the next future but we are software developers and earn on commission, which means that we do not have much time to devote to this project. Having some income would incredibly help us both in terms of time to devote to the project and the quantity production of raw materials.

We have prepared a list of the plans we have for the near future corresponding to the level of funds that we will achieve:

From 5000$

  1. We will change the brand name to something more appropriate for a Mechanics building system paying a trademark research registration service.
  2. We will design and produce a set of components for Servomotors that will allow to build mechanical arms and hexapods.
  3. We will update the current versions of the Lunar and Mars Rovers to include a cutting edge plastic cover (like in the campaign photo) and include them in the already existing Perks!
  4. We will design and produce a new rover, the Mercury Rover that will have Four Wheels independent steering. For those who have already bought the Lunar Rover we will also release an addon pack to transform the Lunar to the Mercury Rover! 
  5. We will design and produce a new rover, the Titan Rover that will have Four/Six Wheels independent steering with the same suspension system of the Mars Explorer. For those who have already bought the Mars Explorer we will also release an addon pack to transform the Mars Explorer to the Titan Rover!
  6. We will design and produce a Sumo Extension for all the Rovers.

From 5000$ to 10000$

  1. We will design and produce a new development kit to build a robotic arm.
  2. We will design and produce a new development kit to build an hexapod.
  3. We will introduce a new set of very powerful engines to drastically increase the speed of the rovers.
  4. We will write new tutorials and update the website!
  5. We will pay an Android developer to develop a new Android version of the iDK and Rover App.

From 10000$

  1. With this income we will be able to produce a good quantity of mechanics and make a discrete stock. This means that we will need less time in order to fulfill the orders and we can decrease prices of all the mechanics products up to 20%.
  2. We will design and produce a new development kit to build a humanoid robot development kit.
  3. We will also get a help from an English native language people that will help us to create video tutorials and helps us with the educational part.
  4. We will insert a discussion forum on the website and allow the people to share their projects and propose their custom parts.

What You Get

We have prepared several exclusive perks for you.

We start from the Robot Brain Kit to the Mars Explorer Extreme Pack that includes all the electronics and a videocamera that let you see the world from the point of view of the Rover!

Perks Features and Prices

This table will help you understand what is included in each perk, choose the right one according to your finances or needs. Afterwards you can always expand it.

 

International taxes and shipping

Our rewards are not including the cost of the shipping. Backers should pay the cost of the shipping that can vary from 10$ to 50$ according to the destination and weight of the package. Backers outside the EU will also be responsible for taxes, duties, and customs fees for their orders.  We will do our best to assist our backers with this ;)

story:
Hello my name is Daryll Ford. My wife Doris and I own and operate an Auto Dealership in the city of Westminster California. We have over 15 years experience in the sale of new and Pre-owned vehicles, a lot of times assisting those who cannot get traditional financing obtain great transportation. However, recently I was involved in a very unique transaction. A woman with children was attempting to buy a car to escape from an abusive situation. This woman, unfortunately, did not have the resources to buy a car. I could see her frustration. I could see her fear. I gave her some information about places that might be able to help her, she thanked me, she left, and that situation continued to haunt me to this very day.

 

After doing some serious research on the problem that women with children coming out of serious, abusive situations were facing, I found that most of these women were not only without the funds for transportation but they were also without the funds needed to create a fresh start. In many cases, all they really want is to get away from the danger.

 

I was overwhelmed by how wide spread this situation is nationwide. Many times these women are from other countries and have been abandoned with no resources. I did find that there are some organizations out there that receive donated cars and try to help, but it seems that many of these cars are far from being in the condition that would be useful in the long run. So at long last, Cars For Moms With Children was born.

Our goal is to provide these families with a car that will not require any money out of their pocket. All paid. Car, Tax, and License fees. This is my campaign, because I’m an auto dealer with the capability to buy at discount prices and with the capability to restore these cars to a comfortable, reliable condition. This is where you can help. Doris and I are raising funds to get cars for these women in serious need free of charge to them. We will be working with organizations around the country that have such women in need of this program. And what types of cars can we provide? These cars will be 2002, or newer, 4-door sedans that will be in great running condition and look great inside and out that will give the women receiving these cars the self-esteem and confidence they’re going to need to build a new foundation for their life. These cars will also come with a 1-year, 12,000 mile warranty and a full tank of gas at time of delivery.

 

Our goal in this first round of fundraising is to deliver 20 cars to such families across the country. It takes approximately $7000 to $8500 which includes tax, license fees, and warrantee per car. And we are not charging any dealer fees for these cars. So with $175,000 dollars raised, this can be accomplished in a short time frame since it takes about a week from purchase to recondition for a car to be ready because we have our own shops that can do everything that’s needed to get these cars ready for the families they will be given to. If we do not reach our goal we will still deliver as many cars as can be provided.

 

Hopefully you will never have to sit in front of a woman with children who is terrified and looking for help, but by donating toward this campaign you will have a dramatic effect on a families in need. We encourage you to get involved, tell your family and friends, and spread the word with us because every car delivered is a family free to create a new start.

 

Our sincerest thanks,

Daryll & Doris

story:
BIO's:

Pavel Braude - 25 smart, funny, ambitious and can't wait to open a bar that has an all new design and atmosphere! I met and made a ton of friends in college, almost wish I could continue forever! We all grow up though. I am passionate about this project and it is my goal, my priority, my dream and obstacle to make it a reality. A bar based around everything I have seen and heard around the world. I want to unite a bar and make it the place to go for a fun and awesome time everyday. Give back to the community make it safe and enjoyable!

Daniel Corrigan - Born and raised in the city of Boston and I am 25. I have worked steadily since I was 16, working as a cook and now I help run a convenience store. My parents helped me realize that with hard work, I can go and get anything that I put my mind to. This is what I now plan on doing. All I have ever wanted to do, since the age of 18, is to own a bar and make it the best one around. two years ago, I was diagnosed with type 1 diabetes. The doctors told me I should have died with the amount of time passed when I procured the disease. I now finally see that life is too short to waste the goals I want to accomplish.

We don't want to wait anymore for something in my life to happen. We are going out there and making it happen! No risk no reward life is too short to wait.

 

Our Bar in the Making/Project/Dream


Bars the #1 place to go for drinks, parties, a great time, and an entertaining day or evening!

We have all heard of sports bars, pubs, luxury bars, gay bars, clubs, college bars, dive bars and so on. Our project is to create a new bar! A new bar that will be better than any bar before! This will be a community bar, new innovative and full of risk! A mix between a sports bar, a club, a pub, and dive bar. We will have everything you are used to but with dozens of new aspects brought to the bar scene. Making the Bar a happy, safe, upbeat and fun environment from open to close. The design is formatted to engage all the parties in the bar, the atmosphere inside the bar has a fun factor only rivaled by an amusement park. Although Alcohol is a depressant, it is clear Americans love alcohol for a variety of reasons. The number 1 reason is because a few drinks let one be themselves, less shy, more fun, happier, able to let loose, add some confidence, etc. The bar scenes today don't allow people to do what they enjoy to fullest! Our project will bring a new view, atmosphere and environment to bars in the long run. We will emerge as the worlds first hands-on bar with rewards for repeat clients/friends, chances for prizes on a daily basis and a new engaging and competitive environment which will include everyone and exclude no one, lead to new friendships and relationships as well as a brand new level of fun and experience that everyone will want to have!  


Email: Legendaryalecbg@outlook.com if you have any questions.

 

Donating and pledging will help the our dreams come true and potentially change the bar scene forever!!! We can use any and all support please don't hesitate to email if you have a question or want more information!
story_txt:
BIO's:
Pavel Braude - 25 smart, funny, ambitious and can't wait to open a bar that has an all new design and atmosphere! I met and made a ton of friends in college, almost wish I could continue forever! We all grow up though. I am passionate about this project and it is my goal, my priority, my dream and obstacle to make it a reality. A bar based around everything I have seen and heard around the world. I want to unite a bar and make it the place to go for a fun and awesome time everyday. Give back to the community make it safe and enjoyable! Daniel Corrigan - Born and raised in the city of Boston and I am 25. I have worked steadily since I was 16, working as a cook and now I help run a convenience store. My parents helped me realize that with hard work, I can go and get anything that I put my mind to. story:
Update: 20 December 2013

We did it!

That's our first big fundraising campaign in the books!

90 people donated a total of $6,070 to help us get ROOTS off
the ground. Thank you. Every last one of you. Having your support right from the beginning means the world to us.

We've begun reaching out to donors whose reward level included a choice of some sort (eg. "Sketchy Seeder" and "Stellar Seeder"). Rewards for levels "Double Seeder" and "Charming Seeder"  will be mailed out starting next week. We'll keep you posted when future perks are ready to be dispatched!

Donors are invited as we officially launch The ROOTS
Project and begin our countdown to the YouthROOTS Summer Program on December 29th.
 

Join us as we ring in 2014 by: 
  • Connecting with amazing people
  • Learning more about the ROOTS vision and how to get involved
  • Engaging in personal and community development!
It should be a great day full of activities, conversation, snacks, and the chance to get your hands on some ROOTS Project merchandise.

All donors should have received an Evite for the event. If you did not receive the invite, or are interested in attending but did not or could not donate, please drop us a line at rootsprojectinc@gmail.com and
we'll send you the details. 

Thank you again. We could not have done it without you. 
_________________________

Update: 1 December 2013


IT'S OFFICIAL! 

WE REACHED OUR FIRST GOAL!

If there hadn’t been quite so much shouting and clapping, we’d say we were speechless. 

What we absolutely are is grateful to every single one of you who made a donation or posted a link to the campaign. We are thrilled to have you all backing us on this. Thank you.

We’ve also still got a whole bunch of days left in this campaign...

Our first stretch goal is to reach a total of $8,000. If we make it to this amount, we'll not only be able to follow through with our plans to pay for our legal bills, open a bank account, and fulfill your donor perks, but we could ALSO subsidize the cost of attendance for at least five students to attend our youthROOTS program next summer. 

Keep posting links to this campaign. Keep reposting stuff on Facebook and retweeting our Twitter updates. Honestly, all of those things help. 

And of course, if you've been waiting to donate ... we'd really appreciate it if you could. 

This campaign will end on December 18th. That's a handful of Wednesdays from now. You've been amazing already, but we know we can do even more. 

Thank you. Thank you, thank you, thank you. 

 - The ROOTS Project crew ♥

__________________________________________________

Who Are We?

We're a group of people who have been working together in social justice education for many years. 

Our founding members are Nkosi Anderson, Chancy Bhatt, Henaz Bhatt, Michele Carroll, Maria Lopez, Nicole Mulligan, Neha Raval, Mustafa Rourk, and Stef Stein. 

Earlier this year, we got together and started to get really excited about bringing fresh ideas to social justice programming and developing something that went beyond the models in which we had worked in the past. We developed a new mission vision, which we're so proud to present to you here.


The mission of The ROOTS Project is to inspire individuals ("Seedlings") to catalyze social change by challenging injustice and inequity when they arise in interactions, institutions and within themselves. Through experiential and testimony-based community building, participants develop empathy, resiliency in the face of obstacles and prejudice, self-reflection, cultural intelligence and critical thinking skills.

Our vision at ROOTS is for our Seedlings to cultivate a stronger and more whole sense of self, to be true allies in creating a more equitable and inclusive society, and to begin to dismantle oppression at internal, interpersonal, and institutional levels.

At ROOTS, we believe that every individual has a story that is multidimensional, and when those complex and beautiful stories are shared and heard, people begin to heal. Individual healing is undeniably linked to the healing of our society and earth.


We have already registered as a New Jersey nonprofit corporation*, and are awaiting approval on our federal 501(c)(3) application. 

Things we're talking about include teacher trainings, a conference for High School students, and family outreach programs. The plans we have are exciting, and developing by the day. We want to do so much, and we can't wait to start building this community. 

*we have a stamp and everything. It's pretty cool.


Where Your Money Goes

The money raised through this campaign will go towards covering initial costs of incorporation on the state and federal level, and provide a funding base onto which we can begin building our first programs & events. 

To be as transparent as possible, what that all means is: the money will go towards paying our legal bills, opening a bank/credit union account, paying for web hosting, and postage and shipping for campaign rewards. The amount left over will be banked for our costs moving forward. 

We will continue to buy our own meeting snacks and pizzas. 

We've lined up some great rewards provided by members of our board. Expect more great perks to be added as folks continue to volunteer their skills and time. 

Please click the box on the right which contains the reward you'd like. Or, if you just want to donate, click the "contribute now" button up top.

We're setting our first fundraising goal at $5,000. A cool thing about indiegogo is that even if we don't reach our goal, we'll still receive all the funds we manage to raise. Any amount will help. Having SAID that ... it would be really great if we reached our goal, right?

So great. 


Bottom Line

We're hoping you see a familiar name (or, like, nine) up there, and that you're interested in being a part of this. 

This endeavor is being launched with full knowledge of other organizations in the state doing social justice education/awareness work. We aren't competitors. We believe there's more than one way to do it, and that the issues we face are big enough for multiple groups to tackle. 

And ... I mean, look. If the worst problem New Jersey faces is that "too many people are trying to make our world better"? We've got a pretty good thing going. 


Community Building

Ok, so, if everyone on the board had piles of cash lying around, we wouldn't need to ask folks to chip in. So we totally get it if you can't contribute right now. That doesn't mean we don't need you. There are lots of other ways to get involved.

  • We're going to be painting/crafting rewards at some point soon. Want to spend some time with us, some paint, a stack of tote bags, and the aforementioned pizza? Drop us a line at rootsprojectinc@gmail.com, and we'll let you know when we'll be up all night to get crafty.
  • Help us get the word out about our campaign. We know there are lots of organizations vying for people's money, and we're hoping that you'll vouch for us to your friends/loved ones/philanthropic billionaire relatives. 

  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools to let other folks know what we're doing here!


When this thing gets going, it will be because we've put our heads and hearts into it. We can't do this without your help, and more importantly: we don't want to. 

Lucky for us, the people we've met through this work possess some of the most amazing hearts and heads ever. 

We can totally do this. It's going to be amazing. Let's go.

October 25, 2013: UPDATE!!

We've added some new rewards!

At the $30 reward level, we now have TWO mug options.

And at the $200 level, we have one fresh cut Christmas tree (picked out by you), awesomely donated to us by the Farinella family. If you choose this level, you must have the ability to visit their farm in central NJ this December to pick out & pick up your tree.  - SOLD OUT!

story:
Our Story

We formed Smoked Trout Productions as a group of friends wanting to host a New Years Eve event to benefit a beloved organization within the Minneapolis theater community. 


The Feast of Fools Masquerade Ball on New Years Eve will create a space for the community to come together and celebrate within the historic In the Heart of the Beast Theater, a space that has been devoted to building a stronger community through art and celebration for over 38 years. 


We are raising funds prior to the event to cover the cost of performers, decorations, food, and beverages. Any remaining funds will go towards the benefit donation.


All ticket sales and donations received on the night of the event will be donated to the In the Heart of the Beast puppet and mask theater to support the important work they do within the Minneapolis community.


Check out the Facebook event page here: http://www.facebook.com/events/157346401030483/


Event Details:

  • $10 tickets will be sold prior to the event and $15 tickets will be sold at the door. (Bring your own mask for 10$ or 15$ Ticket price includes the cost of the mask - it's a masquerade ball after all!)
  • Doors open at 8:00pm - close at 2:00am
  • Music - local Minneapolis bands and DJs keeping the dance party going all night long.
  • Performers - Puppets, stilt walkers, and fire performances throughout the night
  • Food - local restaurants are donating food to be served throughout the night
  • Drinks - Beer, wine, and champagne will be served. ($3-5 suggested donation per drink)


What We Need & What You Get

With the money raised here we will be able to cover the costs of the event including:

  • Beverages - beer, wine, champagne, and water.
  • Food - appetizers and deserts on the heavily laden Feast of Fools table which will be rolled out following the midnight celebration.
  • Performers - while performers have an option to donate their pay to the benefit fund, we need funding to hire stilt walkers, fire dancers, and live bands to perform on New Years Eve.
  • Decorations - to a space that will transport guests into the world of the Feast of Fools, a place of dreaming and wonderment. In the space between, anything is possible.


In exchange for donating to this project, we offer the following Thank You gifts:

  • Donate $30 and receive free admission to the event
  • Donate $50 and receive a "Feast of Fools" print Thank You card
  • Donate $100 and receive a special mask to wear on the night of the event
  • Donate $500 and we will give you our undying love.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share the word about this event and help us make this night a success as we come together to dream and dance and celebrate our lives and our futures.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it’s important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it’s going. Be transparent and specific—people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don’t reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

If you found yourself here, hopefully you know who we are.  (In case you don't, we are the Last Bookstore, the largest used & new bookstore in southern CA).  This is our fundraiser page to pay for the lumber and labor to expand our store into 6100 sq. ft. of the mezzanine above our ground floor. 

We have an insane floor plan for the mezzanine that will be an adventure all by itself for you all to explore!  We're calling it the "Labyrinth above the Last Bookstore," because we like alliteration (although it's not really a true labyrinth).  We'll even be opening up the walls so you can see up into the Labyrinth from below and our store will become a true two-floor book bonanzarama.

The Labyrinth will house over 100,000 books, all $1 each.  We are drowning in good books and need more space to pass them along to you dirt cheap.  Half of all net proceeds from the mezzanine will go to support tutoring homeless kids on Skid Row.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Our starting goal is $10,000 to pay for the lumber.  That's the minimum we need to stay out of additional crushing debt.
  • We could also really use an additional $10,000 to pay the workers to assemble the Labyrinthine floor plan all this month.  To avoid further debt.
  • If you want to pledge it up higher than $20,000, we would use the money towards making the new floor super awesome with local design and art commissioned from local artists.  So pledge away!
  • When you pledge your support now to this campaign, you'll actually make 20-100% on your money thanks to our store credit perks (i.e. rewards).  See them all along the right side of our page.  It's better than the stock market...if books are your currency.

The Impact

If you already know and love us, you know what to do.  If not, come and visit our store (the gigantic new one opened June, 2011) at 453 S Spring St in downtown LA and then make up your mind whether to pledge or not.  We've put almost every dollar we've ever made back into making our store as amazing and positive for our local community as we can, and our expansion will be no different. 

No Money?

If you have no money, we understand.  We ourselves are only able to do this by borrowing money!  But you can still help by sending the link to this fundraiser to other book-lovers you know who do have a few dollars to spare in keeping printed books alive and on the shelves of independent bookstores like ours.

Finally, an Apology...

...for our lame video.  We aren't filmmakers and owner Josh always looks sleepy.  He and his wife shot the video and learned how to use iMovie in a couple hours to make it.  We didn't have the funds to get a pro video made.  Hopefully you can overlook that and support us anyway!

The Labyrinth will house over 100,000 books, all $1 each.  We are drowning in good books and need more space to pass them along to you dirt cheap.  Half of all net proceeds from the mezzanine will go to support tutoring homeless kids on Skid Row.


What We Need & What You Get

Our starting goal is $10,000 to pay for the lumber.  That's the minimum we need to stay out of additional crushing debt.
We could also really use an additional $10,000 to pay the workers to assemble the Labyrinthine floor plan all this month.  To avoid further debt.
If you want to pledge it up higher than $20,000, we would use the money towards making the new floor super awesome with local design and art commissioned from local artists.  So pledge away!
When you pledge your support now to this campaign, you'll actually make 20-100% on your money thanks to our store credit perks (i.e. rewards).  See them all along the right side of our page.  It's better than the stock market...if books are your currency.



The Impact
If you already know and love us, you know what to do.  If not, come and visit our store (the gigantic new one opened June, 2011) at 453 S Spring St in downtown LA and then make up your mind whether to pledge or not.  We've put almost every dollar we've ever made back into making our store as amazing and positive for our local community as we can, and our expansion will be no different. 

No Money?

If you have no money, we understand.  We ourselves are only able to do this by borrowing money!  But you can still help by sending the link to this fundraiser to other book-lovers you know who do have a few dollars to spare in keeping printed books alive and on the shelves of independent bookstores like ours.
Finally, an Apology...
...for our lame video.  We aren't filmmakers and owner Josh always looks sleepy.  He and his wife shot the video and learned how to use iMovie in a couple hours to make it.  We didn't have the funds to get a pro video made.  Hopefully you can overlook that and support us anyway!

story:
Growing up in a household of Chicano activists, the expectation was that we (kids) would grow up and create a revolution. As a kid I selfishly dreamt about defying my parents, being on stage and creating my own works of comedic flare with a slew of adoring fans. That was my cause. And as life would have it, my parents were right. On my own terms my dream has come true with the success of my young adult writing career. 

But that's not the end of my story. Life had way more in store for me. After the publication of my first two novels, I decided to run off into the mountains of Northern New Mexico. I sought a deeper connection with the earth, the seasons, and myself. I came from a family of farm workers and activists (as college students my parents organized for farm worker rights with Cesar Chavez). What I remember most though was my grandfather Julian Dumlao, a Filipino immigrant, who arrived in the Imperial Valley with nothing but the clothes on his back. As a kid I remember going to his ranch, playing with his fighting roosters, and the delicate affection he showed to his tomato plants.  My grandfather was also right, I needed that connection to the land.

 

Since 2006 I've worked with the Traditional Native American Farmers' Association (TNAFA) in Santa Fe, NM. TNAFA is a collective of Indigenous farmers committed to the preservation of traditional agricultural techniques and practices and building sustainable communities amongst indigenous communities across the Americas. Through TNAFA I have learned about permaculture, GMOs, and seed sovereignty. In addition, I've become a part of a network of agroecology leaders across the USA, Mexico, Belize, and Guatemala who are all working for community food security.

In 2012 I moved to San Jose, California and became the manager of Sacred Heart Community Service, La Mesa Verde Program (LMV). LMV started as a kitchen garden program for low-income families in San Jose. Since joining the program, we have moved a step further into building sustainable and sovereign urban food secure communities through the development of critically conscious home-scale food producers. In short, a grassroots food sovereignty movement.

Slow Food USA has invited 220 food movement leaders to join the U.S. delegation to a landmark international food and farming conference on October 25-29 in Turin, Italy. Being selected for this historic event is a special honor. The 220 U.S. delegates were chosen from a competitive pool of 600 applicants by 20 regional selection committees comprised of Slow Food and Terra Madre leaders. With almost 25% people of color and folks from 50 different food communities spanning all sectors of the food movement from labor to production to students, this year’s delegation is by far the most diverse the U.S. has ever sent. Delegates play a key role in showcasing good, clean, and fair products and practices, leading workshops, and speaking on issues from land grabbing to GMOs to gastronomy.

I am proud to have been chosen to represent TNAFA and Sacred Heart's LMV families. As an urban woman of color, I feel like it is my duty (cause) to bring light to the issues and needs of urban working poor communities to an international audience. 

What I Need & What You Get

I need $1200 to cover the cost of my flight to Italy. As an invited representative all the expenses on site will be covered by Slow Food International i.e., the entrance fee, housing, and ground transportation.

**Perks**

For $25 donation you get an autographed copy of my new teen book Border Town "Crossing the Line".

For $50 donation you get a kitchen towel (hand made by my mother).

For $100 donation you get set of tea towels and home made bottle of organic salsa.

For $500 donation you get a one hour skype author presentation or a harvest basket (filled with a handcrafted kitchen towel, fruits of our garden TBD, and one of my books).

The Impact

The Slow Food Conference is a global response to the work I do locally in regards to local food issues. A backyard garden effects the global food production just as the drought in the Midwest effects food production everywhere in the world. I will be able to make connections with other community projects, food researchers, chefs, and community leaders and bring back ideas on organizing food issues. In addition, the majority of the families I work with are transnational; the issues around food are transnational. Since the beginning of time, people have been transnational and have moved in search of food. Issues of food security and food sovereignty are transnational issues that need transnational solidarity.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you support this cause but can't contribute monetarily, feel free to forward this campaign on to your networks. In addition you can follow me at the Slow Food Conference via my blog at www.malinalegria.com or on twitter at www.twitter.com/malinalegria

story:
Live Free, Think Big, Get Tiny...

 After spending a good amount of time in a variety of living areas, Kendra is seeking something more. Whether living urban, suburban, rural or in the wilderness, there's always a price to pay. Rent payments are neverending, and no kind of investment to speak of. To make a home somewhere so often means signing up for a mortgage or non-stop payment. The jobs we love can't afford us a living, and we work tirelessly and spend the rest of our money trying to make ourselves happy while we work in jobs we're not fully fulfilled by. Folks who are unfufilled will often seek to travel to somewhere new to start a living, where they eventually find themselves trapped in the same cycle.

How can we pay off these debts, live a more connected, mindful life, and pursue that which fulfills us? How can we build a life that helps us live more sustainably on this planet?

Tiny houses are moveable, personalized living spaces that allow their owner to simplify their life. It opens the homeowner to new flexible life choices and frees them from the limitations of renting a home. This allows you to choose new life paths that would otherwise be unsustainable, and take your cozy home with you!

Kendra plans to build her Tiny Home when the sun comes back to Seattle. From there she hopes build a farm, create a community center and continue her passion of working in outdoor education and community healing. She may even start a food truck (or food cabin on wheels), or help you build your tiny home, or your dream. Let's free up our time and our lives to connect with what really matters to us.

Adventure!

 

What's happened so far?

Kendra has taken a woodworking course and a Tiny House Building Workshop. The house is chosen, plans purchased, and the salvaging has begun!

Building starts: Summer 2013

Building ends: Fall 2013

What can you do? Build it!

For each material you fund, you will receive a custom craft using recycled items from the project and other reclaimed goodies that didn't end up getting used! You will also receive a patch indicating your participation in the project.

Wondering what it would be like to live tiny? Donations over $300 will get the opportunity to stay in the tiny house for a night!

All funders may suggest a name, which will be entered in a raffle to name the house!

Materials List:

Custom double axle utility trailer $2,200
Lumber $1,700
Screws and Fasteners 
Nails $50
Pipes $55
Miniature Fireplace (Dickinson 9000) $ 800
Sink $100
5 - Light fixtures $20 each
3 - Small Windows $75 each
4 - Large Windows $125 each
Skylight $300
2 rolls Tyvek House Wrap $56 each

Electrician $60/hr 

*I chose a much smaller monetary goal than what will actually be needed. Actual cost will probably be closer to $10,000. 

How you can Help:

Donate!

Wanna build with me? Have supplies? Wanna go on a trip? Interested in building your own? Wanna talk gardens? Know some good connections? Get in touch! 

I'm also looking for folks with experience installing plumbing and wiring!

All funds will go toward the purchasing of supplies for the house! You'll get pictures of where your money went, and my assistance if you should choose to build your own, or want help with another project!

Thank you for your support!

 To learn more about Tiny Houses, you can go to www.tumbleweedhouses.com

story:
UPDATE: My flights are booked and paid for! I will be travelling from May 5th to Aug 6th 2013, a 94 day journey including Tanzania, Rwanda and DR Congo. 

Although I am now 100% for sure going, I need your help to make this trip a success. Please click donate and together Let's Rethink World Aid.  

 My name is David Giesbrecht and I am an 18 year old Canadian nursing student. I am passionate about helping people and making a difference through medical care.

During recent visits to Haiti and Kenya, I witnessed grinding poverty and its impact on life expectancy. I became inspired to make a difference and I am convinced of a fundamental reality: for a community to be strong, local leaders need to be at the heart of change and development.

Local leaders have sustainable solutions, but current aid decisions are made by the people giving the money and this out-dated method has not been effective.

I want to ask rural nurses in areas of extreme poverty how their communities can be self-sufficient, using available resources to strengthen medical care, small business, food security and civic governance. I want to learn from indigenous leaders on the ground in impoverished regions. Through local, relevant insights and responses, I will develop a plan to partner with nurses worldwide for the development of sustainable communities.

In the summer of 2013, I will be living in rural Tanzania for 3 months, helping local nurses administer medical care in remote villages. The regions I will be working in experience high rates of under-five mortality and maternal death. While in the Sumbawanga District, I will be able to interview nurses to explore effective and sustainable aid solutions. I will also be visiting areas in Kenya and the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC). The answers I discover will be documented in partnership with a videographer.

In order for this project to be a full success, I need to raise money. The first priority of all funds raised is to make my upcoming trip financially possible. I will dedicate 100% of all funds raised to that goal. However, if I am able to raise more than what I need for that trip, I will use the extra money to help make my nursing education possible.

You can be a part of this process as I seek to begin helping people in a practical way, starting now. If just 1000 people donated $25, I would be able to succeed in not just this trip and but the education beyond. 

Check out my video and send it to your friends. Let’s work together to help people worldwide.

let’s rethink world aid.

story:
sovereign grounds is expanding and we need your help!

We are renovating our coffee shop and indoor playground to offer our customers and their children an even better space to play and enjoy their coffee.

who we are

Sovereign Grounds is a community-oriented, parent-friendly coffeehouse in South Minneapolis and the first in the Twin Cities to combine a coffee shop with an indoor playroom. We cater to urban families and offer our customers a place to relax, talk, and meet neighbors and other parents. We offer a wide selection of in-house coffee blends and we roast and ground all our coffee beans on-site. With your coffee, you can enjoy a home-made baked good or one of our delicious sandwiches or spinach pies. We also offer a selection of snacks and juice boxes for kids.

our goal

After a lot of planning, we have the go-ahead to expand and renovate our space. We have financial support for the construction of the new space - an expansion that includes a new kitchen, kids playground, and seating area.

But we need funds to cover costs of the playroom furnishings, children's toys, and a new and improved website to keep you in the loop on the promotions, our coffee beans, and of course the renovation progress.

We're hoping to raise $20,000 to cover these costs so this is your chance to further contribute to your Minneapolis community. We want you to help shape this café into something you'll keep enjoying. We're convinced this spark of communal participation will provide an ideal place for any growing family because we're here to grow with you.

your contribution

You can contribute in the following ways:

  • A financial contribution. Your contribution will go toward playroom furniture, brand-new, high-quality toys, and our brand-new website. For every donation level, there is a perk so the more you give, the more you get! But regardless of the amount you contribute, we are eternally thankful for your support.
  • Share our campaign with your Facebook friends, Twitter followers and email contacts. See the "Share This Campaign" bar? That's a great place to start! Indiegogo also measures the activity on our page and rewards us when people click on or share our campaign. So, further your donation without any added cost!
  • Keep drinking our coffee. The coffee shop and playroom will stay open during the renovations so come in, have a coffee, and see the progress with your own eyes.

story:
Why Fund Us?

LU Radio is a campus based community radio station located in Thunder Bay, Ontario Canada. We are partially funded by the students of Lakehead University, as well as by fundraising, and the small amount of advertising allowed to a not-for-profit station (approximately 4 minutes per hour).

LU Radio runs 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, 365 days a year. Our budget is approximately $90,000 a year to keep the station running at an incredibly bare bones level. That means keeping the station running at the bare minimum costs approximately $10.30 per hour. We have only two full time employees* to keep things running and about 50 volunteers doing their shows and pitching in where they can. The student funding from Lakehead University is traditionally around $60,000 however this year with enrollment down, we can expect that to be closer to $55,000. This means a short fall of approximately $35,000 that we need to make up through fundraising, donations and the little bit of advertising we are allowed to do. 

You may have noticed in the calculations that our campaign goal doesn’t reflect what we need for a total…well, that’s because this is all new for us. We’re hoping that all of you out there will help us blow past the campaign goal, but if we meet the set out goal, that’s okay too!

*We actually have a third full time employee this year, however this position (the Local News Director) is currently funded through a grant from the Community Radio Fund of Canada, and the funding runs out in August.

Where will the money we earn from Fund Drive go?

Well, it will help things like: SOCAN fees which we need to pay every year for the right to broadcast music; the new tariffs being proposed by RE:SOUND which would have us paying for the right to stream the music over the internet as well; continuing the Local News Directors position until at we are at least able to obtain a further grant; repair and replace some of our aging CD Players and other equipment…yes, there are plenty of things to do with the money. All of which result in the same thing: continuing the ability of LU Radio to bring free broadcast training to volunteers, allowing the voices of people with no other avenue to be heard, and giving grass roots media and independent music a home in Thunder Bay. 

 

The Perks:

Here's the complete details on our perks for you funders!

A couple of things to note: we will NOT mail items within the Thunder Bay area. Items may be picked up at the station (707 Oliver Rd.) upon notification of arrival or we can arrange to have them delivered to you by one of our volunteers if you cannot make it to the station.

All products are unique only to Fund Drive 2013. The headphone logos will not be reprinted on t-shirts, nor will the posters be screen printed again. Once these are gone, they are gone. On the off chance that anything is left over, it goes into the LU Radio vault for at least 5 years.

The LU Radio Mix:  $20 Each programmer has been asked to create a mix specifically for Fund Drive 2013. Mixes are each at least one hour long and representative of the show hosted by the programmer. Also comes with LU Radio buttons, stickers, on air and website/Facebook thank-you’s and  shout outs. The complete list of available mixes will be posted on March 1st, however at this time we have confirmation of mixes being created by JAFO’s Mood, Digging Through The Rubble, Blowing Up The Lakehead, Radio Gaga, Iron Maple, Queer Radio, Turntables and Fables, Little Moma’s Kitchen Party, Book Girl’s Big Read, LU Radio Variety Hour, 1550, Jens Bent, Live Fast Die Fast and more! Check back for the complete list!

Turntables and Fables: $75 A unique Turntables and Fables T-Shirt, The Turntables and Fables Mix with specific dedication to your child (or person of your choice), and a personalized autographed picture of Record and Tape. Also, the on air and website/Facebook shout outs.

Pocket Transistor Radio: $75 You get the LU Radio headphone shirt with bronze headphones, the mix of your choice, the buttons and the stickers, the on air and website/Facebook shout outs.

Boombox:  $125 You get the LU Radio headphone shirt with silver headphones, your choice of any two mixes, the buttons and the stickers the on air and website/Facebook shout outs.

Home Stereo: $175 You get the LU Radio headphone shirt with gold headphones, your choice of any 3 mixes, the buttons and the stickers the on air and website/Facebook shout outs.

Post With The Most: $150 Don’t need a T-Shirt? We have a limited edition (one of only 25!) hand silk screened poster of the ‘Love Your Radio’ artwork. Artwork created by Mr. Kyle Lees and lovingly silk screened by Julia McArthur for LU Radio. You also get a mix, the buttons, stickers and the on air and website/Facebook shout outs. Since the poster is also offered on several other offers, there are only 15 of these available at this level.

Jimmy Wiggins Golden Ticket! $150 Your ticket allows you and one friend admission to all of the Wiggins Pro-Ductions shows for one year* (April 1st 2013-April 1st 2014). You also get the on air, website/Facebook shout outs, the stickers, the buttons and the poster. (Only 1 Available!)

*Excluding charity fundraisers

Black Pirates Pub Gold Plaque! $300 Your name goes on a plaque on the wall at Black Pirates Pub for one year. Giving you and a guest admission to all Black Pirates Pub shows for one year* (April 1st 2013-April 1st 2014). You also get the on air, website/Facebook shout outs, the stickers, the buttons and the poster. (Only 1 available!)

*Excluding charity fundraisers

You Be The Host! $250 Co-host your favourite radio show. You pick the music, you pick the topics of conversation and our regular DJ will operate the board and help keep the show running. You also get the gold t-shirt, a copy of your radio show on CD, the mix, the buttons and the stickers ,the on air and website/Facebook shout outs. Live too far away to come to the studio? Through the magic of the internet we can still make this happen!

Host Your Own Radio Special! ** $500 LU Radio personnel will help you create a 4 hour radio show of your choice. You pick the topic, the music & host the show. We’ll teach you how to record the show, ensure its broadcast ready, mix it down and air it for you (during an appropriate time).  You also receive the poster, a gold shirt, a copy of your radio show on CD, a mix, buttons, stickers, the on air and website/Facebook shout outs. Live too far away to come to the studio? Through the magic of the internet we can still make this happen! (Only 4 Available)

**show must conform to CRTC guidelines and fit with the LU Radio mandate.

LU Radio DJ’s Your Event! $750 Hey Bosses and Party Planners!! Big party coming up? Perhaps a wedding reception and you’d like to avoid the Macarena? LU Radio’s own DJ Luv and JAFO will DJ your event with our gear! (Only 1 available)

LU Radio Fund Drive 2013 Sponsor!*** $1000 Essentially this is the same as our station sponsorship package. You get your name (or business name) and a liner about you/your business in our sponsorship ‘Thank You’ ad. (A specific one will be created for our Fund Drive Sponsors), a rotating banner for you/your business can be placed in the top bar of LU Radio.ca in a special Fund Drive Sponsor location, you/your business will be placed in our ‘Sponsors’ listing on the website, your name/logo included in our general print advertising, as well as both full colour ‘Thank You’ ads we place in the Argus (Lakehead University’s student newspaper) every year. This is a one year sponsorship which runs April 1st 2013 to April 1st 2014. (Only 5 available)

* **You may want to check with us before purchasing this one. Fund Drive Sponsors still need to fall into the advertising guidelines we have set out for the station already. Feel free to email Jason at: manager@luradio.ca or call 807-766-7260 

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you love LU Radio, but you just can’t help out this time around, that’s okay! We all definitely know that times are tough! There are still MANY ways you can help out! You can share this campaign on your Facebook page (if you have one), tell your friends, family or co-workers about this little station you’d love to help out, get excited about it and try to get others excited about it as well. You can come out to any of the events we are having (a complete list is below), or you can check out the donations page at www.luradio.ca where we have a list of items the station needs regularly that you could donate as well. Simple things like toilet paper, pens, cleaning supplies that maybe you have already and would like to pass on if you have them. If all you can do is read this and tell a friend about it that is still a big help. Thank you!

FUND DRIVE 2013 Events:

March 1st & 2nd - Kick Off Party At Black Pirates Pub. Live music from Pretty.Ugly, Point North, Murray, Fin'r Things and Reverb Bomb on night one, then a Sugar Shakedown dance party on night two.

March 8th - Time Travellers Ball at the Finlandia Club. A people's prom featuring DJ Diskette and live music from the Lakehead University Music Students. 

March 16th and 17th - Open house weekend at LU Radio. Come take a tour of 707 Oliver Rd. Meet some of our programmers and see what it is we do

March 23rd - Live from the Thunder Bay Country Market. We will be live on location from 7am to 1pm and broadcasting live for How Blue Can You Get from 10am to Noon.

March 28th - Our annual Wrap Party at The Finlandia Club. DJ Big D from The Tropical Storm keeps you dancing in between sets from Mark Potvin & The Potvin Horns, The Damon Dowbak Trio and Robin Ranger. Our buffet style Indian dinner returns to the menue as well.
story_txt:
Why Fund Us?
LU Radio is a campus based community radio station located in Thunder Bay, Ontario Canada. We are partially funded by the students of Lakehead University, as well as by fundraising, and the small amount of advertising allowed to a not-for-profit station (approximately 4 minutes per hour).
LU Radio runs 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, 365 days a year. Our budget is approximately $90,000 a year to keep the station running at an incredibly bare bones level. That means keeping the station running at the bare minimum costs approximately $10.30 per hour. We have only two full time employees* to keep things running and about 50 volunteers doing their shows and pitching in where they can. The student funding from Lakehead University is traditionally around $60,000 however this year with enrollment down, we can expect that to be closer to $55,000. This means a short fall of approximately $35,000 that we need to make up through fundraising, donations and the little bit of advertising we are allowed to do. 


You may have noticed in the calculations that our campaign goal doesn’t reflect what we need for a total…well, that’s because this is all new for us. We’re hoping that all of you out there will help us blow past the campaign goal, but if we meet the set out goal, that’s okay too!
*We actually have a third full time employee this year, however this position (the Local News Director) is currently funded through a grant from the Community Radio Fund of Canada, and the funding runs out in August.


Where will the money we earn from Fund Drive go?
Well, it will help things like: SOCAN fees which we need to pay every year for the right to broadcast music; the new tariffs being proposed by RE:SOUND which would have us paying for the right to stream the music over the internet as well; continuing the Local News Directors position until at we are at least able to obtain a further grant; repair and replace some of our aging CD Players and other equipment…yes, there are plenty of things to do with the money. All of which result in the same thing: continuing the ability of LU Radio to bring free broadcast training to volunteers, allowing the voices of people with no other avenue to be heard, and giving grass roots media and independent music a home in Thunder Bay. 


 
The Perks:
Here's the complete details on our perks for you funders!
A couple of things to note: we will NOT mail items within the Thunder Bay area. Items may be picked up at the station (707 Oliver Rd.) upon notification of arrival or we can arrange to have them delivered to you by one of our volunteers if you cannot make it to the station.
All products are unique only to Fund Drive 2013. The headphone logos will not be reprinted on t-shirts, nor will the posters be screen printed again. Once these are gone, they are gone. On the off chance that anything is left over, it goes into the LU Radio vault for at least 5 years.
The LU Radio Mix:  $20 Each programmer has been asked to create a mix specifically for Fund Drive 2013. Mixes are each at least one hour long and representative of the show hosted by the programmer. Also comes with LU Radio buttons, stickers, on air and website/Facebook thank-you’s and  shout outs. The complete list of available mixes will be posted on March 1st, however at this time we have confirmation of mixes being created by JAFO’s Mood, Digging Through The Rubble, Blowing Up The Lakehead, Radio Gaga, Iron Maple, Queer Radio, Turntables and Fables, Little Moma’s Kitchen Party, Book Girl’s Big Read, LU Radio Variety Hour, 1550, Jens Bent, Live Fast Die Fast and more! Check back for the complete list!
Turntables and Fables: $75 A unique Turntables and Fables T-Shirt, The Turntables and Fables Mix with specific dedication to your child (or person of your choice), and a personalized autographed picture of Record and Tape. Also, the on air and website/Facebook shout outs.
Pocket Transistor Radio: $75 You get the LU Radio headphone shirt with bronze headphones, the mix of your choice, the buttons and the stickers, the on air and website/Facebook shout outs.
Boombox:  $125 You get the LU Radio headphone shirt with silver headphones, your choice of any two mixes, the buttons and the stickers the on air and website/Facebook shout outs.
Home Stereo: $175 You get the LU Radio headphone shirt with gold headphones, your choice of any 3 mixes, the buttons and the stickers the on air and website/Facebook shout outs.
Post With The Most: $150 Don’t need a T-Shirt? We have a limited edition (one of only 25!) hand silk screened poster of the ‘Love Your Radio’ artwork. Artwork created by Mr. Kyle Lees and lovingly silk screened by Julia McArthur for LU Radio. You also get a mix, the buttons, stickers and the on air and website/Facebook shout outs. Since the poster is also offered on several other offers, there are only 15 of these available at this level.
Jimmy Wiggins Golden Ticket! $150 Your ticket allows you and one friend admission to all of the Wiggins Pro-Ductions shows for one year* (April 1st 2013-April 1st 2014). You also get the on air, website/Facebook shout outs, the stickers, the buttons and the poster. (Only 1 Available!)
*Excluding charity fundraisers
Black Pirates Pub Gold Plaque! $300 Your name goes on a plaque on the wall at Black Pirates Pub for one year. Giving you and a guest admission to all Black Pirates Pub shows for one year* (April 1st 2013-April 1st 2014). You also get the on air, website/Facebook shout outs, the stickers, the buttons and the poster. (Only 1 available!)
*Excluding charity fundraisers
You Be The Host! $250 Co-host your favourite radio show. You pick the music, you pick the topics of conversation and our regular DJ will operate the board and help keep the show running. You also get the gold t-shirt, a copy of your radio show on CD, the mix, the buttons and the stickers ,the on air and website/Facebook shout outs. Live too far away to come to the studio? Through the magic of the internet we can still make this happen!
Host Your Own Radio Special! ** $500 LU Radio personnel will help you create a 4 hour radio show of your choice. You pick the topic, the music & host the show. We’ll teach you how to record the show, ensure its broadcast ready, mix it down and air it for you (during an appropriate time).  You also receive the poster, a gold shirt, a copy of your radio show on CD, a mix, buttons, stickers, the on air and website/Facebook shout outs. Live too far away to come to the studio? Through the magic of the internet we can still make this happen! (Only 4 Available)
**show must conform to CRTC guidelines and fit with the LU Radio mandate.
LU Radio DJ’s Your Event! $750 Hey Bosses and Party Planners!! Big party coming up? Perhaps a wedding reception and you’d like to avoid the Macarena? LU Radio’s own DJ Luv and JAFO will DJ your event with our gear! (Only 1 available)
LU Radio Fund Drive 2013 Sponsor!*** $1000 Essentially this is the same as our station sponsorship package. You get your name (or business name) and a liner about you/your business in our sponsorship ‘Thank You’ ad. (A specific one will be created for our Fund Drive Sponsors), a rotating banner for you/your business can be placed in the top bar of LU Radio.ca in a special Fund Drive Sponsor location, you/your business will be placed in our ‘Sponsors’ listing on the website, your name/logo included in our general print advertising, as well as both full colour ‘Thank You’ ads we place in the Argus (Lakehead University’s student newspaper) every year. This is a one year sponsorship which runs April 1st 2013 to April 1st 2014. (Only 5 available)
* **You may want to check with us before purchasing this one. Fund Drive Sponsors still need to fall into the advertising guidelines we have set out for the station already. Feel free to email Jason at: manager@luradio.ca or call 807-766-7260

story:
We are sending boxes to 2 Forward Operating Bases where the soldiers are only recieving 2 meals a day due to budget cuts. They have to skip breakfast. We can do something about that!

75 Care Packages are being prepared, and we have to ship them to the FOBs! 

We need to cover the cost of the shipping. Plain and simple. Every penny helps.

-----

Other Ways You Can Help: Share this on Facebook, Twitter, Email, word of mouth, etc.

story:
Walden Family Services

Walden opened it's doors in 1976 with the goal to create a treatment level foster care program that would provide foster youth with an alternative to group home placements. Now in it's 37th year, Walden is a recognized leader in providing programs and services to foster youth with special health care needs and foster youth who have developmental disabilities.


In 2008 Walden secured an adoption license and expanded services to become a full service adoption agency providing support from the initial family assessment through post-adoptive support.


Walden is raising $5,500 to send our foster youth to summer camps where they learn valuable leadership and social skills, set in an unforgettable childhood experience. A tragedy of the foster care system is that our children miss experiencing the joys of childhood so many of us take for granted. Your donation means a Walden foster youth can live this cherished right of passage and have a lifetime of memories.

 

Walden's Need

Walden's foster youth are eligibile for camp scholarships because of their special health care needs and developmental disabilities - but we still need your help to send them on the adventure of a lifetime.

$5,500 will allow Walden to send 33 youth to camp this summer, paying for the cost of room and board; meals; transportation; special activities and equipment; and any miscellaneous items youth need in order to spend time away from home.

 

The Impact

Memories of summers spent at camp are unqiue and special to all of us. One Walden Social Worker described camp as "the best six summers of my life, you live ten months for those two!"

For many of us camp was our first time away from home, our first taste of independence and we immediately wanted to come back every summer thereafter. For Walden foster youth with special health care needs and developmental disabilities this is truly the experience of a life time, a place where they can revel in the excitement of childhood and simply enjoy being children.

When you make a donation to Walden's Summer Camps 4 Foster Youth Campaign, you're giving more than just money. You're giving trail rides and canoe trips, camp fire sing alongs and roasted marshmallows, capture the flag and late night card games, best friends and pen-pals. You're giving adventures and memories.

Your donation means a summer of excitement and a lifetime of possibilities.
 

Other Ways You Can Help Walden

We appreciate donations of all amounts, but understand that not everyone can contribute financially. That's ok, because we still need your help sharing our video with your friends, family, co-workers, followers, neighbors, anyone and everyone you know! The more people who know about Walden Summer Camps 4 Foster Youth, the better chance we have of sending our youth to camp. That means 33 foster youth who have the best summer of their lives!

So please, use the share tools and help us get the word out - we just need $125 a day to reach our goal and we know with your help, we will!

story:
For a review of my readings, please see the recent article on xoJane, "We Got Tarot Readings via Email, and They Were Actually Pretty Cool."

My name is Kathleen and I read tarot under the name Ananda, which means "bliss" in Sanskrit. I am a disabled woman hoping to supplement my income by starting my own business reading tarot cards online via email. I have been an initiated Wiccan High Priestess for 25 years and tarot reading has always been an integral part of my spiritual practice.

I'm asking for funding to help with the costs of setting up and registering a business, including website development, advertising, shopping cart services, a PayPal business account, and other expenses.

Thirteen years ago I had to quit my job as an R.N. due to chronic illness. I applied for and began receiving Social Security Disability. When I left an abusive relationship and my divorce was finalized last year, my financial situation became even more difficult. Due to the variable nature of my illness, I am unable to do readings in person or via chat. Corresponding by email allows me to work on my own schedule, when my health allows it.

I have extensive training and experience as a crisis counselor, as well as a depth of spiritual understanding of tarot cards from my many years studying Wicca. I believe this combination has left me exceptionally well suited to be a talented card reader who can help people through my insights.

I feel this is my opportunity to help others doing something I love, while also increasing my financial independence. Contribute $5 or more and receive a reading. You will experience for yourself how insightful the cards can be when interpreted by a gifted reader. I hope you will join me in creating my path toward helping others and myself.

Your generous contributions will help us create more $5000 voting campaigns just like this one on any website - and at givkwik.com. 

We will promote our technology services to other socially responsible companies to sponsor new voting campaigns just like this with even more causes. 

The funds we raise here will help launch our startup company, pay some bills and expand our hard-working team of volunteers. 

Shirts available in unisex and all sizes. 

Perks will be delivered within 30 days.


       



Jason Rosado, CEO & President - Thaddeus Wojcik, Business Affairs & Legal - Tom Roli, Technology - Jaclyn Roth, Branding & User Experience - Moises Vela, Board Member - Ramon Gonzalez, Marketing - Roxy Rosales, User Experience - John Douglas, User Experience - Brian Barela, Social Media - Ocean Tran Vu, Social Media - Brad Michaels, Business Development - Carlos Rivera, Visual Design - Christopher Correa, Video Production - Michael Yip, Video Production
