story:
Everyone knows capitalism is broken.

Here's one little thing we can all do to start fixing it.

What is Community Commerce?

Simply, Community Commerce is the radical idea that a business can also operate for the benefit of the community it serves rather than for just stockholders.

Sunnyside Up Café in Corvallis, OR has long contributed to the community in ways that go beyond the mere requirements of commerce. In addition to great organic coffee and food, Sunnyside Up provides a place to meet new people, a place to gather with old friends, a place to connect with the community. From our local donation programs, to supporting the Empty Bowls program, to our Community Food Share, and Drop-In Center contributions, to our soup for the homeless program, to hosting fundraisers and the Second Saturday Concert series, we strive to contribute to the well-being of our fair city.

But that's just a part-time effort. What if we could put all the resources of a profitable business to work for the community all the time?

We are proposing community stewardship of Sunnyside Up, in the form of a non-profit organization. Our goal is to raise $225,000 through donations in order to establish a non-profit entity that will take over the operation of Sunnyside Up.

From that point forward, all profits from the café will be used to support organizations such as the South Corvallis Food Bank, the Jackson Street Youth Shelter, Community Food Share, the Corvallis Environmental Center, the Youth Garden Project, Community Outreach, CASA, Empty Bowls, etc.

A portion of the proceeds would also be set aside each year for national and global efforts such as Doctors Without Borders, Heifer International, and Rolling Jubilee.

The idea is to extend our service to the community from part-time to all of the time. This concept has a multiplier effect that will turn your small one-time donation into $35-$50,000 worth of charitable donations every year.

And by virtue of being a non-profit organization, all our tax money that the government squanders on senseless wars and bank bailouts, will now go directly to the people who need it, without politicians being able to meddle with it.

Community Commerce. It’s a powerful idea that could help transform lives, cities, and maybe even the concept of capitalism.  Your donation to make this happen is a donation that keeps on donating.

Process: All donations will be set aside until we reach our funding goal. The funds will be used to

1) establish the non-profit entity

2) set aside a capital reserve fund for Sunnyside Up

3) transfer ownership of Sunnyside Up to the non-profit

4) provide help to the people who need it most in an ongoing, self-sustaining basis

We look upon this proposal as a unique way to help strengthen our community and expand the traditional boundaries of what capitalism does, for the betterment of all.

Thank you for listening.

You can check us out here: sunnyside-up-cafe.com

Community Commerce. Help make it happen here. And then everywhere.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Full Disclosure:

Our total investment in Sunnyside Up, over the course of a dozen years, is nearly a quarter million dollars. We’re not trying to enrich ourselves from this effort. We would like to recoup $150—175k from the business. We will consider the difference between what we've invested and what we raise to be our contribution to this idea.

Funds donated that exceed what we need will go to the capital reserve fund of the non-profit, legal expenses for establishing the non-profit, taxes, and fees from the fundraising effort (did you know they charge for this stuff?).

If we raise a million bucks, we’ll use it to turn other profitable businesses into non-profits. Maybe we'll start a movement. Maybe people everywhere will realize the benefits of using business to help one another rather than just for the sake of profit.

Occupy everything.

___________________________________________________
FAQ

1.  Why don’t you just do this on your own without soliciting donations?

We would if were independently wealthy. However, our life savings are invested in Sunnyside Up. We are the 99%.

2.  Is this a membership, stock, or security?

This is not a stock or a security, nor is it a membership. This is a donation to help create a self-sustaining charitable entity.

3.  What do I get out of this for my donation?

The knowledge that your small contribution helped create an annual source of $35-50,000 worth of contri­butions to organizations that help our neediest citizens. That’s a huge multiplier effect for your donation.

4.  What if you don’t reach your funding goal?

We will evaluate the level we get to and see if it is still plausible to proceed. If not, we will provide an accounting of what we took in, and donate all of it to the same organizations we propose to support through this effort.

5.  Who will run Sunnyside Up?

The Board of Directors will hire a General Manager to oversee the day-to-day operation. Jon will stay on for a time in an advisory and training role to ensure a smooth transition. He will also be available in the longer term to offer direction as needed.

6.  Are you socialists or something?

We are practicing capitalists who simply believe that capitalism can, and should, also be used to help people.

7.  Will there be an accounting each year of the donations made?

The Board of Directors will produce an annual report of operating expenses and contributions made.

8.  What other changes do you anticipate from this?

We envision Sunnyside Up expanding its role as a center for the community. For example, it would be great to host a weekly Teen Night, with music and dancing. Perhaps a monthly Craft Night for knitters and jewelry makers. A monthly Open-Mic night or Poetry Slam would be awesome. Book clubs? You tell us.

9.  Is my donation tax-deductible?

Not until the non-profit is organized and can issue receipts.

10.  I don’t have any money to spare since Wall Street stole all my savings. Is there anything else I can do to contribute?

·  Spread the word and encourage others to participate.

·  Buy a latte. ;-)

the Youth Garden Project, Community Outreach, CASA, Empty Bowls, etc.A portion of the proceeds would also be set aside each year for national and global efforts such as Doctors Without Borders, Heifer International, and Rolling Jubilee.
The idea is to extend our service to the community from part-time to all of the time. This concept has a multiplier effect
that will turn your small one-time donation into $35-$50,000 worth of charitable
donations every year.And by virtue of being a non-profit organization, all our tax money that the government squanders on senseless wars and bank bailouts, will now go directly to the people who need it, without politicians being able to meddle with it.
Community Commerce.
It’s a powerful idea that could help transform lives, cities,
and maybe even the concept of capitalism.  Your donation to make this happen is a donation that keeps on donating.Process: All donations will be set aside until we reach our funding
goal. The funds will be used to
1) establish the non-profit entity 
2) set aside a capital reserve fund for Sunnyside Up 
3) transfer ownership of Sunnyside Up to the non-profit4) provide help to the people who need it most in an ongoing, self-sustaining basisWe look upon this proposal as a unique way to help strengthen our community and expand the traditional boundaries of what capitalism does, for the betterment of all.Thank you for listening.You can check us out here: sunnyside-up-cafe.comCommunity Commerce. Help make it happen here. And then everywhere.------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Full Disclosure:
Our total investment
in Sunnyside Up, over the course of a dozen years, is nearly a quarter million dollars. We’re not trying to enrich ourselves from this effort. We would
like to recoup $150—175k from the business. We will consider the difference between what we've
invested and what we raise to be our contribution to this idea.
Funds donated
that exceed what we need will go to the capital reserve fund of the non-profit, legal
expenses for establishing the non-profit, taxes, and fees from the fundraising effort (did you know they charge for this stuff?).
If we raise a
million bucks, we’ll use it to turn other profitable businesses into non-profits. Maybe we'll start a movement. Maybe people everywhere will realize the benefits of using business to help one another rather than just for the sake of profit.  Occupy everything. ___________________________________________________FAQ
1. 
Why don’t you just do
this on your own without soliciting donations?
We
would if were independently wealthy. However, our life savings are invested in
Sunnyside Up. We are the 99%.
2. 
Is this a membership,
stock, or security?
This
is not a stock or a security, nor is it a membership. This is a donation to
help create a self-sustaining charitable entity.

3.  What do I get out of this for my donation?
The
knowledge that your small contribution helped create an annual source of $35-50,000
worth of contri­butions to organizations that help our neediest
citizens. That’s a huge multiplier effect for your donation.
4. 
What if you don’t reach
your funding goal?
We
will evaluate the level we get to and see if it is still plausible to proceed.
If not, we will provide an accounting of what we took in, and donate all of it
to the same organizations we propose to support through this effort.5. 
Who will run Sunnyside
Up?
The
Board of Directors will hire a General Manager to oversee the day-to-day operation. Jon will
stay on for a time in an advisory and training role to ensure a smooth
transition. He will also be available in the longer term to offer direction as
needed.
6.  Are you socialists or something?
We
are practicing capitalists who simply believe that capitalism can, and should, also
be used to help people.
7.  Will there be an accounting each year of the donations
made?
The Board of Directors will produce an annual
report of operating expenses and contributions made.8.  What other changes do you anticipate from this?
We
envision Sunnyside Up expanding its role as a center for the community. For example,
it would be great to host a weekly Teen Night, with music and dancing. Perhaps a
monthly Craft Night for knitters and jewelry makers. A monthly Open-Mic night
or Poetry Slam would be awesome. Book clubs? You tell us.
9.  Is my donation tax-deductible?
Not
until the non-profit is organized and can issue receipts.
10.  I don’t have any money to spare since Wall Street stole
all my savings. Is there anything else I can do to contribute?
·  Spread the word and
encourage others to participate.
·  Buy a latte. ;-)

story:
Since 1928, people have walked by a classic red brick structure with white pillars on Forest Avenue in Oak Park.  This historic landmark building across from Austin Gardens is the Nineteenth Century Charitable Association and is an attractive and popular venue for community events.

     In 2012, The Nineteenth Century hosted 349 events: 80% non-profit events and 20% were private rentals. More than 24,000 people attended averaging 2,000 people per month.        

   The Nineteenth Century Charitable Association dates back to 1891 when a group of far-sighted women realized that education and civic involvement were essential to a vibrant community.  The organization provided opportunities for women and developed support systems for families within the community.  It was instrumental in establishing the OPRF Day Nursery, League of Women Voters and Infant Welfare.  Many were leaders in the women’s suffragette movement.  We continue our tradition of Learning and Giving by promoting social responsibility and life-long learning through scholarships, community grants and programs for intergenerational, ethnically diverse audiences.

     2013 finds the building in need of extensive exterior and interior restoration.  The Board of Directors invites you to join our major effort of restoration by supporting a three-year capital campaign to raise $500,000.  The Board and members have raised more than 70% of the funds needed.

  • Your support ensures:

  • The viability of this important and beautiful historic landmark building

  • The ability of affordable event space for community use, 

  •  The access by citizens of the community to stimulating educational and cultural programs

  •   The benefit of scholarships and monetary grants. 

    Please join us in our campaign to restore this Oak Park landmark.

story:
Did you know that 50% of start-up businesses fail within the first 4 years?

IT'S THIS SIMPLE - If we help more Entrepreneurs that start businesses succeed on the first try, then there would be more businesses and more jobs that benefit the entire economy.

Together we can create a new business model that improves the classroom subject they call "Entrepreneurship" and in the process help more Entrepreneurs be successful when starting new businesses. 

Introduction:

My name is Suresh but you can call me "Stretch".  I am well-educated with an MBA from Indiana University's Kelley School of Business and a BA from the University of Michigan where I was a 4-year starter and captain of Michigan Men's Volleyball team. 

After 5 years on Wall Street, 10 years of Entrepreneurship and also involvement in numerous businesses (here is my Linkedin), I have learned that what is taught to students in classes about starting a business (it's called "Entrepreneurship") only teaches a small % of students that follow the "rules" to succeed. 

This is because the main focus of Entrepreneurship classes is about how to attract venture capital, not how to start and succeed at running a business. The student is taught to choose their best idea (put all of their eggs in one basket) and work their butts off on one idea hoping to one day land a large check from investor. When the check doesn't come, the business fails. 

Most of the classes are about presenting to investors when they should be about skills that are skipped like incorporating your business, generating first sales, and then only if necessary, presenting to investors and raising capital. In actuality, if given different set of rules to follow, I feel an Entrepreneur has a better chance of success for both themselves and their investors. 

The goal of this project is to seek out and implement feedback from fellow Entrepreneurs called "Advisors" from around the world and create a new model with real-time case studies designed to help Entrepreneurs increase their odds of success. 

Please take a look at our plan to change how Entrepreneurs think about starting a business and help us empower the next generation of Entrepreneurs to improve their chances of success (and check out all the awesome perks you get by helping us make history!)

We look forward to hearing everyone's feedback! Much love!

-Stretch (aka Suresh)


Our Difference:

First, we want the Entrepreneur to look at themselves as the "Portfolio Manager" or "Investment Manager" of a portfolio of stocks would. 

Now as a Portfolio Manager, would you put all of time into researching one idea and putting all of your investor's money into that one idea? Of course not!

WE recommend every entrepreneur DIVERSIFY, just like a Portfolio Manager would right from the start and protect their time investment and their investors' money and instead of asking potential investors to bet on any individual one of your ideas, ask them to bet on YOU (your team) instead of the ideas. 

Now why would an investor bet on the Entrepreneur vs. any one great business idea? Because the type of investors (angel investors) that invest in start-up companies base 80% of their investment decisions on the Entrepreneurs themselves. 

That leaves only 20% of the investor's bet on the actual business idea. We say focus on the 80% (YOU) because that is the main bulk of an investor's decision. And that is the focus of the model we would like to share. 

The Companies:

To create a model that other Entrepreneurs can follow we are going to start a new type of company called an "Entrepreneurship Company". 

The more preparation, the better your chances of success so we took our best three ideas (one that is already making money just needed a rebranding), started building them out, and now we are going to combine them under one leadership team and assign Project Managers rather than Entrepreneurs to run the businesses. 

We feel with this structure, we can not only make decisions faster, but have greater flexibility when it comes to changing leadership or making finance decisions ( i.e. if a business is not producing we can immediately drop it no issues)

Here are the descriptions of the 3 businesses:

With three businesses up and running, we will have plenty of real-world case studies for other Entrepreneurs to learn from. Also, we are giving aspiring Entrepreneurs the opportunity to join the front lines of our company by becoming a Mastiff Advisor (see perks to the right). 

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

SOPTEX

Custom Cloud Software Company (www.soptex.com)

The Company: SOPTEX's BAM software, located at www.soptex.com, combines classic CRM functionality with custom electronic "tickets" that deliver the exact functionality, financial calculations and reporting that companies require to manage all of their employees and their business processes in real-time.  Go Custom. Go Cloud. Go SOPTEX!

Industry: The Cloud (SaaS) software industry reached $14.5 billion in size by 2012 and is expected to grow at 17% per year until at least 2018. 

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Bombay Bakehouse

Indian-American Restaurant and On-line Store

The Company: Introducing a new concept in Indian style food, "Bombay Bakehouse", an online store combined with fast-casual Indian-American restaurant that will be opened in New Jersey in the Spring of 2015. The restaurant will be based on the style of popular franchises like Chipotle except that the food would be fast and healthy Indian style food. The featured product would be fresh flavored Indian bread (naan) baked in tandoori ovens directly in front of guests. To open the restaurant to non-Indian customers, the restaurant would have a simple menu with no Indian food names, have innovative and less spicy food options, and feature a modern decor rather than a traditIonal decor. 

Get Baked. Bombay Bakehouse. 

Industry: In 2012, Fast Casual Restaurants were a $30 billion industry increasing at 10% per year. 

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Wrap Mogul 

Vinyl Wrap Installation, Training and Sales

The Company: Wrap Mogul will feature a mobile wrap business, a vinyl wrap installation facility, a state-of-the-art training center and a retail showroom combined with online store and distribution center. We have contracted the world's foremost expert on vinyl wrap installation and training to design our process and workspace. Be a Mogul. Wrap Mogul. 


Industry - Vinyl Wrap is a growing industry people are just learning about (you see the graphically wrapped commercial vehicles more and more these days) expected to reach $1 billion a year by 2017. A $4000 commercial vehicle wrap is worth about $85,000 in advertising due to the number of daily impressions. Currently the manufacturers are focusing on developing more pre-fabricated wraps and that is where Wrap Mogul will focus. 

Mastiff Ventures Growth Plan:

Here is how we intend to start and grow our businesses:

My Mastiff:

Here is myself and the inspiration for the "Mastiff" in "Mastiff Ventures"- my dog "Pookie". I bought her 10 years ago when I decided to become an Entrepreneur and she has been my best friend through the ups and downs of our journey:

Perk Examples:


Here is a representation of what the "Get Baked." t-shirt is going to look like. I made this quickly to give people an idea the real t-shirt you can expect to look as good or better.  

Here is a representation of what the "I love Pookie!" button is going to look like. You can totally expect the button to be better looking and probably round as I have no idea how to design a button and am going to let a professsional do it :)  Enjoy this and the other perks!

Conclusion:

Thank you very much for your time to check out my project and hope you were inspired by the efforts I am making. 

To sum up: I feel that I can easily accomplish this project's goals if this project is funded. I really hope you choose to support my team in our efforts.

Again, please check out the perks on the right. With three companies there are plenty of things we can offer so we hope you can find one you like and help me support this effort. 

I want to thank everyone that has helped me get to the point in my Entrepreneurial journey!

If you have any feedback I would love to hear it. Please feel free to contact me.

Please share this with your family, friends, and anyone else that you think might be interested. Together we can really help this economy by having more start-up businesses succeed!

Thank you!

Stretch (Suresh)

story:
Short Summary

Hi my name is Daniela Goldsberry & I am looking for your help! I am very devastated by the natural disaster that hit Cabo San Lucas. It touches so close to heart because my entire family is from Mexico! I also know that many of these families struggled daily, even before the hurricane hit, so they could really use any help we could give them! Not only the families, but the firefighters trying to bring a helping hand to these families, are struggling as well, and they are even running out of food and water! I cannot express enough how much EVERYONE in this area needs our help , support and love! Please, anything and everything helps, even a prayer or a meditation session focused on the lives that were affected by this hurricane. I really hope you find it in your heart (and wallet) to give your love and support to these individuals.Thank you so much, love you all.  

What We Need & What You Get

What I need? NOTHING! But these individuals need everything! I will be sending the donations to families & fire departments in the Cabo San Lucas area. 

    The Impact

    The positive energy from this fund, will lift their spirits, and reassure these people that we do care! We do love them!! 

      Risks & Challenges

      Not getting enough supporters! But I believe in the goodness of all people :) 

        Other Ways You Can Help

        Tell others about my campaign! Send love, positive energy, prayers, what have you!! Also you can send food, clothes, etc. to those in need! GET INVOLVED THEY NEED OUR HELP!

story:
The History

For as long as I can remember, I have been dreaming about creating my own greeting card company. When I was seven, my parents brought home our first computer and I began creating greeting cards to give to family and friends through an old school program called Print Maker.

Since then, my design skills and clever phrases have improved and the desire in me to create cards and keep snail mail alive has only become stronger as well. Through this project, I hope that we can make that dream become a reality.

The driving force(s) behind Marion Claire Stationery are the women it is named after...my grandmothers. My strong, beautiful, and greatly missed grandmothers are my inspiration and the purpose behind this company. Marion, my maternal grandma, passed away when I was 13, and my paternal grandma, Patricia, when I was only 3. Wait a minute, where did Claire come from if her name is Patricia? Settle down, friends...her middle name is Claire. I wanted the sound of this company to have a strong and sweet name. Strong is Marion, sweet is Claire. Although both grandmothers had a tough attitude, they still knew what it meant to be lovely and to love, deeply. These cards and this company, much like the women who inspired them, are full of heart and sass, which are the two most obvious traits that they have passed on to me.

With your support in this journey, I will be able to bring you cards that help you and those who receive them create memories, cherish and celebrate milestones and remember that life is a beautiful mess that we travel through with the help of each other. 

Because I want this to be more than just "my company," I have enlisted the printing staff of a local, family-owned, print shop to produce high quality prints that I could otherwise not produce on my own. By supporting this project, you're supporting another; it's a win-win. My designs come to life through this print shop, which makes me proud to present my products to you and your loved ones. While outsourcing my printing does make the costs of starting slightly higher, I believe the quality is worth it. Other costs include envelopes, packing materials, and general startup costs. The reason my funding goal might seem so high is because I'm starting this during peak summer arts festival time and I want to be able to have enough inventory to head out to those festivals so that I can remain in the minds of my buyers through the rest of the year and into the heavy card-buying seasons of Christmas and Valentine's day. By supporting this project, you are supporting various phases of Marion Claire Stationery.

I hope you will embark on this journey with me so we can launch this life-long dream of mine and get started on making and cherishing those memories!

Not convinced? Read more at www.marionclairestationery.com


What Marion Claire Needs & What You Get

Allow me to break it down for you:

  • $1,700 will go towards the cost of printing this first round of cards, envelopes for each of them, cellophane sleeves, business cards, flat mailers and various other materials to get this project off the ground during the busy summer festival season. It will also cover the cost of sending each of you some gifts in exchange for your donations!
  • Those gifts, depending on the price range, will be sent before the end of 2014. Talk about turn-around time!
  • If I do not reach my goal, I will have to drastically downsize. Because I am outsourcing my printing, I have to print within their quantity restrictions and if I do not meet the $1,700 goal, I will have to print less of each design to be able to comply with that rule. That would cut into the impact I hope to make this summer. With your help, I'll be able to make more cards, which will reach more customers and jumpstart this business in a big way!


The Impact of Your Gift

Besides just making me smile and making me even more grateful for the wonderful people in my life, your gift will create a partnership between us as I start my greeting card business. What exactly does that mean?

  • With your support, I vow to keep you in mind while designing. I want to create something that warms your heart and/or makes you laugh and something you are proud to purchase and send to a loved one. With your support in this fundraiser, I promise to continue to do that.
  • By supporting this fundraiser, you are literally helping me make a life-long dream come true and helping me to live up to the legacy of my grandmothers. 
  • Honestly, the impact of your gift, no matter what size, is unmeasurable. I will be forever grateful that you were placed in my life and were able to support this venture.


Other Ways You Can Help

I understand if you cannot help financially because I have been in that situation as well. However, I could use your help in other ways. 

  • Please spread the word and make some noise about this campaign! You might think this is pointless but trust me, word of mouth (or a social media shoutout) spreads much farther than you might think!


More than anything, thank you. I appreciate you more than you'll ever know.

With heart & sass,

-Chelsea
story_txt:
The HistoryFor as long as I can remember, I have been dreaming about creating my own greeting card company. When I was seven, my parents brought home our first computer and I began creating greeting cards to give to family and friends through an old school program called Print Maker.Since then, my design skills and clever phrases have improved and the desire in me to create cards and keep snail mail alive has only become stronger as well. Through this project, I hope that we can make that dream become a reality.The driving force(s) behind Marion Claire Stationery are the women it is named after...my grandmothers. My strong, beautiful, and greatly missed grandmothers are my inspiration and the purpose behind this company. Marion, my maternal grandma, passed away when I was 13, and my paternal grandma, Patricia, when I was only 3. Wait a minute, where did Claire come from if her name is Patricia? Settle down, friends...her middle name is Claire. I wanted the sound of this company to have a strong and sweet name. Strong is Marion, sweet is Claire. Although both grandmothers had a tough attitude, they still knew what it meant to be lovely and to love, deeply. These cards and this company, much like the women who inspired them, are full of heart and sass, which are the two most obvious traits that they have passed on to me.With your support in this journey, I will be able to bring you cards that help you and those who receive them create memories, cherish and celebrate milestones and remember that life is a beautiful mess that we travel through with the help of each other. Because I want this to be more than just "my company," I have enlisted the printing staff of a local, family-owned, print shop to produce high quality prints that I could otherwise not produce on my own. By supporting this project, you're supporting another; it's a win-win. My designs come to life through this print shop, which makes me proud to present my products to you and your loved ones. While outsourcing my printing does make the costs of starting slightly higher, I believe the quality is worth it. Other costs include envelopes, packing materials, and general startup costs. The reason my funding goal might seem so high is because I'm starting this during peak summer arts festival time and I want to be able to have enough inventory to head out to those festivals so that I can remain in the minds of my buyers through the rest of the year and into the heavy card-buying seasons of Christmas and Valentine's day. By supporting this project, you are supporting various phases of Marion Claire Stationery.I hope you will embark on this journey with me so we can launch this life-long dream of mine and get started on making and cherishing those memories!Not convinced? Read more at www.marionclairestationery.comWhat Marion Claire Needs & What You GetAllow me to break it down for you:
$1,700 will go towards the cost of printing this first round of cards, envelopes for each of them, cellophane sleeves, business cards, flat mailers and various other materials to get this project off the ground during the busy summer festival season. It will also cover the cost of sending each of you some gifts in exchange for your donations!
Those gifts, depending on the price range, will be sent before the end of 2014. Talk about turn-around time!
If I do not reach my goal, I will have to drastically downsize. Because I am outsourcing my printing, I have to print within their quantity restrictions and if I do not meet the $1,700 goal, I will have to print less of each design to be able to comply with that rule. That would cut into the impact I hope to make this summer. With your help, I'll be able to make more cards, which will reach more customers and jumpstart this business in a big way!
The Impact of Your GiftBesides just making me smile and making me even more grateful for the wonderful people in my life, your gift will create a partnership between us as I start my greeting card business. What exactly does that mean?
With your support, I vow to keep you in mind while designing. I want to create something that warms your heart and/or makes you laugh and something you are proud to purchase and send to a loved one. With your support in this fundraiser, I promise to continue to do that.
By supporting this fundraiser, you are literally helping me make a life-long dream come true and helping me to live up to the legacy of my grandmothers. 
Honestly, the impact of your gift, no matter what size, is unmeasurable. I will be forever grateful that you were placed in my life and were able to support this venture.
Other Ways You Can HelpI understand if you cannot help financially because I have been in that situation as well. However, I could use your help in other ways. Please spread the word and make some noise about this campaign! You might think this is pointless but trust me, word of mouth (or a social media shoutout) spreads much farther than you might think!More than anything, thank you. I appreciate you more than you'll ever know.With heart & sass,-Chelsea

story:
Hello and Thank You!

Hello from Filipino Advocates for Justice (FAJ for short). Our organization, including myself, Chris Cara, Lillian Galedo, Fiona Cruz and many others have been working with the Bay Area Filipino American community and many national collaborators for over 40 years. FAJ's mission is to build a strong and empowered Filipino community by organizing constituents, developing leaders, providing services, and advocating for policies that promote social and economic equity. FAJ serves the 120,000+ Filipinos in the East Bay through Youth Development, Low-Wage Worker Support and Civic Engagement programs.

A challenge we face today is that our office technology is severely outdated. Phones malfunction, the server has viruses, yet we move forward. Unfortunately it has come to the point that upgrades must happen in order for us to continue doing good work and that is why we are turning to you, the public to support us.

Your support will allow us to upgrade and/or replace our technology infrastructure that will enhance our ability to serve the community without the hindrance of lost call transfers, damaged computer files and other obstacles we currently face. 

Thank you in advance for your amazing support of our youth, worker-organizers and community as a whole!

What We Need & What You Get

Here are our needs. A small portion of our operating budget has been saved up for these purposes but we need your help to fill the gap!

  • Replacing the phone system (total estimated cost $6,500)
  • New desktop computers (total estimated cost $5000)
  • BONUS: If we surpass our funding goal, we'd love to be able to use additional funds to provide stipends to our youth and worker-organizers.
We have some amazing perks available for you, our supporters that have been contributed by our amazing community.  Among them:
  • Beautiful baybayin script prints
  • Pasalubong (souvenir) from FAJ Executive Director Lillian Galedo's travels to Mexico.
  • Guided ghost tour of one of the most haunted places in the Tri-City area (Alameda County) from FAJ Youth Counselor Rachel Aceberos.
  • Social Media consultation by FAJ Boardmember and Communications Manager of The Greenlining Institute JC De Vera. 
  • And much more!

The Impact

Having a fully-operational office impacts the smooth functioning of all of our programs, from youth development, to low-wage worker empowerment to civic engagement.

FAJ’s Youth Development work is aimed at inspiring young people to focus their attention away from drug use, violence and other non-constructive behavior to wellness and positive personal development through cultural grounding, leadership andcommunity service. We also seek to develop young people's social justice instincts and a spirit of bayanihan in the community. Annually, we serve approximately 130 youth age 13 - 19 years. 

The Low-Wage Worker Program organizes and supports Filipino caregivers in the East Bay who are most vulnerable to exploitation and economic injustice. We help workers organize and develop leadership through a worker-led group called People’s Association of Workers and Immigrants (PAWIS). Recent victories include working as part of the California Domestic Workers Steering Committee to pass the California Domestic Worker Bill of Rights, and winning over $500,000 in unpaid wages in 2013 alone.

Our Civic Engagement program is aimed at educating and mobilizing Filipino voters and engaging the Filipino community in the development of public policy. We advocate for and educate around immigration reform, organizing undocumented workers that we work with to testify before decision makers about the need for legalization, the preservation of family reunification, and an end to immigrant enforcement programs. 

We also are advocating for Temporary Protected Status (TPS) for Filipinos in the wake of Typhoon Yolanda/Haiyan, phonebanking to get out the vote in elections, and providing immigration legal clinics in partnership with Advancing Justice - Asian Law Caucus, Asian Pacific Islander Legal Outreach and the Filipino American Bar Association of Northern California.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Thank you so much for taking the time to learn about our efforts to fix up our office technology. Even if you are unable to donate at the moment, there are still things you can do to support us!

    • Share this Indiegogo page on social media like Facebook and Twitter (easily done using the share buttons included on this page) or using http://igg.me/at/fajtechnology
    • Spread the word in a personal manner, either face to face or by email with friends and family that you believe would want to support our work.
    • Learn more about our work by visiting http://filipinos4justice.org/ and contact us about volunteering and other forms of support!

story:
This is a difficult time for all of us. We all know that Daniel, aka Tokin, was a truly amazing person with a generous heart who loved so many people so freely, and gave so much. Now we have the opportunity to be of help to him and his family, so that they can see Daniel off, and celebrate him properly.... Any donations will help and would surely be much appreciated. All donations will be sent directly to Daniel's family, and help cover the costs of any memorial services or gatherings they feel called to hold.

Please keep Daniel and his loved ones in your hearts and prayers.

Thank you all.

story:
Rafting 4 Recovery


Addiction is something that at some level, in some way touches us all. Whether it is you that suffers in its grasp or someone close to your heart, its reach is broad, dark and destructive. In an effort to make a grand and stoic stand against it we have created a program called:  “Rafting 4 Recovery”
PLEASE VISIT OUR WEBSITE: http://www.rafting4recovery.com/
  • DATES: August 16th-22nd 2015
  • LOCATION: Moab, Utah
  • COST per Participant: $1,100.00

THE PROGRAM:
http://www.rafting4recovery.com/

We have teamed up with OARS Rafting (an official non-profit) (http://www.oars.com/) one of the most environmentally and socially conscious companies in the outdoor industry to offer this experience.

The goal of this program is to reach out, to empower, to uplift and support those in need. We have seen first hand the power of community, nature and fellowship in allowing people to rise from the bottom and reclaim their lives. The beauty of this is that, once an addict recovers, the effect helps all those close to them recover from the damage as well.

We will be embarking from Moab Utah, upon the Colorado River through Cataract Canyon on August 16th. We will spend 5 days beneath the wild canyons of the southwestern desert, rafting both the calm and wild waters, hiking to ancient Anasazi ruins through giant red rocks, camping on sandy beaches while focusing on recovery, healing, friendships and fun. 

IMPACT:
The power of nature to heal, bring new perspective, cleanse, reconnect and truly feel the beauty of being alive is beyond the ability of words to convey. When an addict recovers, the effect is exponential. Loved ones, relationships, family members….all are given a sense of safety and peace which allows them to heal from wounds and trauma endured by the disease of addiction. 
This is good for the world.

NEEDS AND CHALLENGES:
We are looking for sponsors and participants. 

The obstacles we are facing is that those who need it most are unable to afford the cost of the trip. We are in search of people who are looking to donate to a worthy cause. 
The cost for each participant is $1,100.00
Neither OARS nor Rafting 4 Recovery is making a profit on this at all. 

FUNDING:
ALL PROCEEDS AND RAISED FUNDS GO DIRECTLY TO BRINGING WILLING PEOPLE ON THE RIVER.
Our goal is to raise $15,000 which allows us to bring the minimum number of participants on the trip.

WE ARE AN OFFICIAL NON-PROFIT WHICH ALLOWS ALL DONATIONS TO BE TAX   
DEDUCTIBLE.

OTHER WAYS TO HELP:
Please, "Like" and "Share" our link. 

http://www.rafting4recovery.com/

It really makes a difference.
If you are an addict and would like to come, or if you are able to sponsor someone in need….HELP SPREAD THE WORD and contact us, we can make a difference in so many lives.

rafting4recovery@gmail.com

story:
Short Summary

Sharon Moloney, mother of 3 (Alexis, Blake and Reagan) lost their home to a fire, losing everything but themselves. The children have only the clothes on their back and a few charred items they kept as memories of their childhoods that the firemen could save.

Please give all you can to help them restore what they've lost, including their pride and dignity. We are all children of God and need one another at some point in our lives. This is their time of need. Someday may be your time...

You can help!

 

We've started the goal at $1000, because right now, to them that small amount is equivilent to a pot of gold at the end of a bright and colorful rainbow.

If the drive makes more than that, 100% of everything will still go to the family.

NOTE: The tiny dog in the Christmas photos elonged to Alexis. She has had the dog for a little more than 1 year, adopting it as a rescue animal. She had just trained it to stay in their yard the week of the fire. The dog's name was Cocoa and loved everyone! Sadly, Cocoa parished in the fire. A fireman had gotten him out while he was still alive but he died shortly after due to too much smoke inhalation. Despite their efforts to revive him, including an emergency tracheotomy, Cocoa couldn't hold on. Please restore hope to this loving family with hearts of gold. Someday, one of them just may be the one who is helping you...

What We Need & What You Get

This is a method of those online and on the go or people who don't have time for the post office to help out.

100% of this fund will be donated to the family.

  • Any amount of money will be helpful to this family as they are starting from square one.
  • This is a great way to feel good about yourself by loving thy neighbor.
  • This is the best way to show the internet and the world that there is some humanity left in our race.
  • Pay it forward! You never know when you could be in this situaiton!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Share this on facebook
  • Share this on twitter
  • Share this on google plus
  • Tell your family, your friends, your coworkers
Moloney Fire Recovery Fund
C/O Kevin Moloney
525 Wilbur Street
Bucyrus, OH 44820

Children's sizes for clothing donations:

Alexis (age 19)
Shirt: women's sm or medium
Pants: women's 5/6
Shoe: 7-1/2 or 8

Reagan (age 14)
Shirt: women's sm
Pants: women's 3/4
Shoe: 7

Blake: (age 12)
Shirt: men's sm
Pants: boys 16-18 husky
Shoe: 6-1/2

Also for those who might be local, an immediate need is a local storage area and restoration services to help them salvage items that are of personal importance to the kids and their mother. You may email Kevin at kevinmoloney124@gmail.com or call or text at 419-420-5162 if you have any questions or comments. Thank you all in advance for your charitible gifts and consideration.

May God Bless You!

story:
THIS PROJECT

CELEBRATE MANDELA 95

JOIN IN THE CELEBRATION OF NELSON MANDELA’S 95th BIRTHDAY BY HELPING A CHILD HAVE ACCESS TO A BOOK

There was the world before Nelson Mandela – and the world after Nelson Mandela.

‘He is God’s gift to South Africa and he is our gift to the world’

- Archbishop Desmond Tutu

Hello, I am Anné Mariè du Preez Bezdrob, author of ‘The Nelson Mandela Story’, which forms the basis of this project. It has been reviewed as, inter alia, ‘the best biography’ of Mandela (The Sowetan); ‘a must-read’ (O Magazine); ‘the definitive biography of Nelson Mandela’ (The Citizen); and ‘a fresh new portrait of Mandela’ (Beeld).

On 18 July 2013 this icon of democracy and peace celebrates his 95th birthday. He is in frail health and this is a golden opportunity to honour him while we still have the privilege of sharing his birthday with him.

This project is designed, through the donation of thousands of books and a holiday tour for underprivileged dhildren, to create an extended celebration that will spread Nelson Mandela’s ideals and vision, and touch as many lives as possible.

The first phase of the project is a special 95th birthday edition of ‘The Nelson Mandela Story’ with a new cover and the new title, ‘Nelson Mandela – A Man First’; and the hope is that your contributions will enable the printing of 5,000 copies, and the donation of the book to schools, prisons and libraries, to share Nelson Mandela's philisophies and in honour of his commitment to improving life through education.

The second phase is a historical translation of the book in Mandela’s mother tongue, isiXhosa. As with Phase 1, the hope is that your contributions will make it possible to donate thousands of copies of the translated version to schools, prisons and libraries.

The third phase is an audio version of the book, in both English and isiXhosa, and donations of the CD to schools and organisations for the visually impaired.

The fourth phase is educational tours for groups of underprivileged children to places of interest relating to Nelson Mandela’s life in the history of South Africa: his birthplace Qunu in the Transkei, Robben Island, and his former home in Soweto.

‘Tell me and I forget, teach me and I may remember, involve me and I learn.’ - Benjamin Franklin

During 27 years in prison, and after almost as many years of political banning orders, malicious persecution and cruelty, Mandela often plotted his escape. More importantly, he also plotted - not revenge against those who oppressed, and committed human rights abuses against, him and millions of his people - but reconciliation with the people who denied him and other black South Africans the most basic human rights.

Almost three decades in prison did not make him embittered or vengeful, but convinced him that the wrongs of South Africa’s history could only be remedied by starting on a clean slate. That meant forgiving, if not forgetting, the bitter legacy of apartheid, and incorporating the perpetrators of decades of pain and suffering into a new society.

‘Out of the experience of an extraordinary human disaster that lasted too long, must be born a society of which all humanity will be proud. Our daily deeds as ordinary South Africans must produce an actual South African reality that will reinforce humanity's belief in justice, strengthen its confidence in the nobility of the human soul and sustain all our hopes for a glorious life for all.’ - Nelson Mandela

Nelson Mandela dedicated his life to this ideal and to this architect of a new, democratic South Africa one could say, in his own words: ‘The sun shall never set on so glorious a human achievement!’

THE PURPOSE

To give everyone the world over the opportunity to be part of the celebration of Nelson Mandela’s 95th birthday, his life and his legacy; and to add their personal recognition to the official recognition of Mandela’s contribution to peace and freedom: presentation of the Nobel Peace Prize to him in 1993; and the declaration by the UN General Assembly in 2009 of 18 July as ‘Nelson Mandela International Day’.

‘Nelson Mandela is a living embodiment of the highest values of the United Nations. Through long years in prison, he maintained a steadfast belief in justice and human equality. Upon his release, he reconciled with those who persecuted him most. And he led the way toward a democratic, multi-racial South Africa. To this day, he works tirelessly for peace and human dignity throughout the world. His engagement in the fight against AIDS broke new ground against stigma. He is an exemplary global citizen.’

- UN Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon.

HOW

Join this project to help build on Nelson Mandela’s dream of a society that offers equality and the eradication of poverty through education. www.indiegogo.com/celebratemandela95

 

TEAM MEMBERS

Other team members are John du Preez, an entrepreneur and logistics specialist, who will co-manage the distribution of donations and perks; Sheila Metcalf, a former political party Councillor and community representative, who will be advisor on the identification of schools and individuals to receive the donations and opportunities as set out in the Program of Celebration; and Samuel Monareng, who will liaise with local communities on the campaign.

 

THE IMPACT

Through perseverance and the unshakeable belief in the validity of his cause and the good in others, Nelson Mandela changed the course of history.

The written word is a limitless way of reaching everyone on the planet and sharing the fascinating story of this icon of our time.

Long before becoming the leader of the African National Congress, Nelson Mandela was a young Thembu prince, living a life of pomp and luxury. Before he was the most famous prisoner of the 20th century and an international statesman, he was a son, husband, father, lawyer and rebel, fighting for the liberation of his countrymen. His determination to lead a meaningful life and to make a contribution to his people’s quest for freedom, led him to leave behind a life of luxury and advantage to struggle, penniless and unemployed, fighting for survival against the hardship of racial discrimination, to acquire an education and, ultimately, the freedom of his people.

From a young age Mandela believed in the power of education, not in the narrow sense of the word alone, but as a comprehensive experience. This, combined with his love of children, led him to establish the Nelson Mandela Children’s Fund in 1995.

‘There can be no keener revelation of a society's soul than the way in which it treats its children.’ - Nelson Mandela

While he was a prisoner on Robben Island he petitioned the prison authorities to allow inmates to study, and established an institute of learning in the prison that was called ‘Mandela’s university’. He encouraged young prisoners to use their time in prison to study and many acquired degrees thanks to Mandela’s diligent pursuit of knowledge.

Your contribution will spread Nelson Mandela’s vision.

- ‘Peace is not just the absence of conflict; peace is the creation of an environment where all can flourish, regardless of race, colour, creed, religion, gender, class, caste, or any other social markers of difference.’

- ‘Overcoming poverty is not a gesture of charity. It is an act of justice.’

- ‘As long as poverty, injustice and gross inequality persist in our world, none of us can truly rest.’

- Nelson Mandela

Thank you sincerely for joining this project and your contribution to Nelson Mandela’s vision of a better life for all.

PROGRAM OF CELEBRATION

PHASE 1

Special 95th birthday edition of ‘The Nelson Mandela Story’ with a new cover, the new title ‘Nelson Mandela – A Man First’ and a new introduction on the history of the Xhosa people.

At the time of Nelson Mandela’s 90th birthday I donated more than 400 copies of ‘The Nelson Mandela Story’ to youth organisations, including the Nelson Mandela Children’s Fund; and to other institutions.

For his 95th birthday, and with your help, the hope is to raise this number to at least 4,000. Initially 95 schools across the country will be identified and each will receive a donation of 10 books: 2 copies for the school library and the rest as merit prizes for learners. The more contributions we receive, the more books will be donated.

If contributions exceed the hoped-for target, it will allow for the donation of more books.

In keeping with Nelson Mandela’s example to encourage the upliftment of prisoners, as many books as possible will be donated to prisons across the country.

PHASE 2

As a result of wide-spread poverty and the price of books, combined with the legacy of apartheid, only a small section of the population has a reading culture; and the number of books available in South Africa’s indigenous languages is inadequate. Moreover, hardly any books about Nelson Mandela are available in either isiXhosa, his mother tongue, or in other indigenous South African languages.

Translation of the book in isiXhosa is a gift both to Nelson Mandela and to the people of South Africa.

PHASE 3

In 2012 ‘The Nelson Mandela Story’ was the subject of the daily book reading on the South African Broadcasting Corporation’s English language service. Thousands of people listened every day, and many wrote to express their enthusiasm and gratitude for this book about his life.

'My name is Themba, I am a student at university doing LLB. I just realised the vital role our father of the nation played in our community, most of the youth dont know about his role. I am very intrigued by his story and I would love to get one of his books. I kindly ask for a free copy as I cannot afford one. I am pleading because there are lots of his story that we dont know. Themba

I’m a student at a high school in Cape Town & I have been listening to the radio broadcast of the Mandela story. I would love if I could get the book. Malibongwe

I am elated to confirm receipt of the eagerly awaited book, The Nelson Mandela Story. I can’t over-emphasize the significance of receiving this book, it chronicles and deciphers Mandela, the man himself, from childhood, his nurturing that set a stage for him as an international statesman! It gives a reader a glimpse long before he became an international state man. It is for this reason that I am making a clarion call for those who have or have not heard of the book, to get one by grabbing a copy and/or buy it for someone special, as a present. It is uplifting and MUST HAVE COPY, I highly recommend it! Pat M

There were many requests for an audio version of the book to cater for those who cannot read, either because they are illiterate or visually challenged.

To accommodate people who are unable to read, the book will be released in audio format in both English and isiXhosa, and copies of the CD will be donated to schools and centres for the visually impaired.

PHASE 4

The opportunity of a lifetime for three groups of underprivileged children during the July 2013 school holidays.

One group will visit the Transkei coast, Mandela’s birth place Qunu, and the monument near the town of Howick in KwaZulu Natal, where he was arrested in 1962.

A second group will visit the Cape, Robben Island and, if possible, Pollsmoor prison.

A third group will visit Sun City, Mandela’s former house in Soweto, and the Apartheid museum in Johannesburg.

If contributions exceed the hoped-for target, it will be possible to make these opportunities available to more groups of children

FUNDS NEEDED

The total goal for the four phases of the campaign is $95,000, broken down as stipulated below.

Contributions will go towards Phase 1 till the target is reached, subsequent contributions will start accumulating towards Phase 2, etc.

South Africa has an extremely high unemployment rate and included in the stated goals - but only if contributions permit it - is a temporary job opportunity for a person to assist with the shipment of donations, emailing of PDF copies of the book and other administrative duties.

Included in the goals - again, only if contributions and consequent activity warrant it - is an amount of up to a maximum of $4,000.00 per month for the months of February to July to cover team members' expenditure, as well as postage for Perks.

 

PHASE 1 GOAL = $25,000

Editing, layout, graphic work and printing of new edition titled 'Nelson Mandela - A Man First', distribution of book and donations.

PHASE 2 GOAL = $30,000 

Translation, editing, layout, graphic work and printing of isiXhosa version of  'Nelson Mandela - A Man First', distribution of book and donations.

PHASE 3 Goal = $20,000 

Producer, reader, recording studio and distribution of CD's and donations.

PHASE 4 GOAL = $20,000  

Transport, accommodation, entrance fees and meals for 3 groups of twelve children plus 2 accompanying adults per group (36 children and 6 adults).
story_txt:
THIS PROJECT
CELEBRATE MANDELA 95
JOIN IN THE CELEBRATION OF NELSON MANDELA’S 95th BIRTHDAY BY HELPING A CHILD HAVE ACCESS TO A BOOK
There was the world before Nelson Mandela – and the world after Nelson Mandela.
‘He is God’s gift to South Africa and he is our gift to the world’
- Archbishop Desmond Tutu
Hello, I am Anné Mariè du Preez Bezdrob, author of ‘The Nelson Mandela Story’, which forms the basis of this project. It has been reviewed as, inter alia, ‘the best biography’ of Mandela (The Sowetan); ‘a must-read’ (O Magazine); ‘the definitive biography of Nelson Mandela’ (The Citizen); and ‘a fresh new portrait of Mandela’ (Beeld).
On 18 July 2013 this icon of democracy and peace celebrates his 95th birthday. He is in frail health and this is a golden opportunity to honour him while we still have the privilege of sharing his birthday with him.
This project is designed, through the donation of thousands of books and a holiday tour for underprivileged dhildren, to create an extended celebration that will spread Nelson Mandela’s ideals and vision, and touch as many lives as possible.
The first phase of the project is a special 95th birthday edition of ‘The Nelson Mandela Story’ with a new cover and the new title, ‘Nelson Mandela – A Man First’; and the hope is that your contributions will enable the printing of 5,000 copies, and the donation of the book to schools, prisons and libraries, to share Nelson Mandela's philisophies and in honour of his commitment to improving life through education.
The second phase is a historical translation of the book in Mandela’s mother tongue, isiXhosa. As with Phase 1, the hope is that your contributions will make it possible to donate thousands of copies of the translated version to schools, prisons and libraries.
The third phase is an audio version of the book, in both English and isiXhosa, and donations of the CD to schools and organisations for the visually impaired.
The fourth phase is educational tours for groups of underprivileged children to places of interest relating to Nelson Mandela’s life in the history of South Africa: his birthplace Qunu in the Transkei, Robben Island, and his former home in Soweto.
‘Tell me and I forget, teach me and I may remember, involve me and I learn.’ - Benjamin Franklin
During 27 years in prison, and after almost as many years of political banning orders, malicious persecution and cruelty, Mandela often plotted his escape. More importantly, he also plotted - not revenge against those who oppressed, and committed human rights abuses against, him and millions of his people - but reconciliation with the people who denied him and other black South Africans the most basic human rights.
Almost three decades in prison did not make him embittered or vengeful, but convinced him that the wrongs of South Africa’s history could only be remedied by starting on a clean slate. That meant forgiving, if not forgetting, the bitter legacy of apartheid, and incorporating the perpetrators of decades of pain and suffering into a new society.
‘Out of the experience of an extraordinary human disaster that lasted too long, must be born a society of which all humanity will be proud. Our daily deeds as ordinary South Africans must produce an actual South African reality that will reinforce humanity's belief in justice, strengthen its confidence in the nobility of the human soul and sustain all our hopes for a glorious life for all.’ - Nelson Mandela
Nelson Mandela dedicated his life to this ideal and to this architect of a new, democratic South Africa one could say, in his own words: ‘The sun shall never set on so glorious a human achievement!’
THE PURPOSE
To give everyone the world over the opportunity to be part of the celebration of Nelson Mandela’s 95th birthday, his life and his legacy; and to add their personal recognition to the official recognition of Mandela’s contribution to peace and freedom: presentation of the Nobel Peace Prize to him in 1993; and the declaration by the UN General Assembly in 2009 of 18 July as ‘Nelson Mandela International Day’.
‘Nelson Mandela is a living embodiment of the highest values of the United Nations. Through long years in prison, he maintained a steadfast belief in justice and human equality. Upon his release, he reconciled with those who persecuted him most. And he led the way toward a democratic, multi-racial South Africa. To this day, he works tirelessly for peace and human dignity throughout the world. His engagement in the fight against AIDS broke new ground against stigma. He is an exemplary global citizen.’
- UN Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon.
HOW
Join this project to help build on Nelson Mandela’s dream of a society that offers equality and the eradication of poverty through education. www.indiegogo.com/celebratemandela95
 
TEAM MEMBERS
Other team members are John du Preez, an entrepreneur and logistics specialist, who will co-manage the distribution of donations and perks; Sheila Metcalf, a former political party Councillor and community representative, who will be advisor on the identification of schools and individuals to receive the donations and opportunities as set out in the Program of Celebration; and Samuel Monareng, who will liaise with local communities on the campaign.
 
THE IMPACT
Through perseverance and the unshakeable belief in the validity of his cause and the good in others, Nelson Mandela changed the course of history.
The written word is a limitless way of reaching everyone on the planet and sharing the fascinating story of this icon of our time.
Long before becoming the leader of the African National Congress, Nelson Mandela was a young Thembu prince, living a life of pomp and luxury. Before he was the most famous prisoner of the 20th century and an international statesman, he was a son, husband, father, lawyer and rebel, fighting for the liberation of his countrymen. His determination to lead a meaningful life and to make a contribution to his people’s quest for freedom, led him to leave behind a life of luxury and advantage to struggle, penniless and unemployed, fighting for survival against the hardship of racial discrimination, to acquire an education and, ultimately, the freedom of his people.
From a young age Mandela believed in the power of education, not in the narrow sense of the word alone, but as a comprehensive experience. This, combined with his love of children, led him to establish the Nelson Mandela Children’s Fund in 1995.
‘There can be no keener revelation of a society's soul than the way in which it treats its children.’ - Nelson Mandela
While he was a prisoner on Robben Island he petitioned the prison authorities to allow inmates to study, and established an institute of learning in the prison that was called ‘Mandela’s university’. He encouraged young prisoners to use their time in prison to study and many acquired degrees thanks to Mandela’s diligent pursuit of knowledge.
Your contribution will spread Nelson Mandela’s vision.
- ‘Peace is not just the absence of conflict; peace is the creation of an environment where all can flourish, regardless of race, colour, creed, religion, gender, class, caste, or any other social markers of difference.’
- ‘Overcoming poverty is not a gesture of charity. It is an act of justice.’
- ‘As long as poverty, injustice and gross inequality persist in our world, none of us can truly rest.’
- Nelson Mandela
Thank you sincerely for joining this project and your contribution to Nelson Mandela’s vision of a better life for all.

The more contributions we receive, the more books will be donated.
If contributions exceed the hoped-for target, it will allow for the donation of more books.
In keeping with Nelson Mandela’s example to encourage the upliftment of prisoners, as many books as possible will be donated to prisons across the country.
PHASE 2

Moreover, hardly any books about Nelson Mandela are available in either isiXhosa, his mother tongue, or in other indigenous South African languages.
Translation of the book in isiXhosa is a gift both to Nelson Mandela and to the people of South Africa.
PHASE 3

story: Hi, this is my family and we are trying to get back home to TN. We left Tn. in Jan. of this year to come to Fl. to help some family and with church. We have accomplished that and now need to go back to Tn. which is our home, problem is that work has slowed down here in Fl. and time is running short on when we are in need of being back. I have a job opprtunity and the deadline to be there is close to its end and we would like for the kids to start school at the beggining of the school year. We have some saved for the move but lack about $2500, that is needed for moving us and our belongings. Im a flooring contractor and when work is slow we have no money comming in. Any help would be greatly appriciated. Thank you and God Bless.

story:
Tuscaloosa loves beer right?

We want to give people a local option that is made right here in the throbbing heart of west Alabama.

Druid City Brewing is being started by two long time Tuscaloosans Bo Hicks and Elliott Roberts. We've spent a combined nearly three decades studying beer - a thorough and complete regimen of exhaustive tasting. A few years back, this rigorous study turned to crafting our own beer. We found that we loved the whole process and began working together to produce something that our friends and family could enjoy. Tailgates, dinner parties, beer tastings... more hard work.

Based on the encouragement of those who came out and tried the beer – hard work in and of itself – we decided to start Druid City Brewing Company. Tuscaloosa is our favorite place to be, and aside from bringing back Milo's, a brewery is about the only thing that the city lacks.

Based on the commitments and inquiries we've received from bars and distributors, our biggest worry is to not being able to craft enough beer for Tuscaloosa. We're not worried about our time and work – we know we've got long hours in the brewery ahead of us. The thing we need most next is more room for fermentation.

That's where you come in. We've budgeted to buy 14 barrels of fermentation space on our own. Seven more barrels of space means more delicious cold beer in more bars and restaurants in Tuscaloosa. And you can tell your friends you helped make it happen – and have the swag to prove it!

What We Need & What You Get

  • 100% of money raised here will go to buy a 7 barrel fermentation vessel

This campaign helps get us bolting out of the gate - but do not worry there's also something in it for you. We can't exactly match what you pledge but we've come up with some great ideas of perks that will remind you of how grateful we are.

The Impact

As long time Tuscaloosans, we believe in the importance of supporting local business. We like our veggies from Snows Bend, our BBQ from Archibald's, our movies at the Bama and our favorite teams to wear crimson. We're a a part of the community and are hoping to partner with Kentuck, Black Warrior River Keeper and many other local charities and groups doing good in our area. We hope to be a piece of the city that you will be proud to call your own.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some folks just can’t contribute – we get it - but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

Please share with others. We know we can reach our goal if we can get the word out.

Cheers,

Bo and Elliott
