story:
The Problem: 
For thousands of years the best and brightest among us have tried and failed to stop violence against women.

Enabling a Solution: 
This age-old problem can now be addressed using technology advances. 

Execution: 
The uCaring.com solution needs to be tested and refined until we it right, until we have stopped violence against women. 

What you can do: 
1. Drive the company: donate, use our services, spread the word to users, to investers, to celebrities, to people and companies committed to social good, be an  evangelist everywhere you go.  

2. If not already done, make a written commitment to Social Change.

3. Join our team as a volunteer, evangelist, local advocate, speak out.

Why I need you to pitch in and  help:
First of all, only you can make it happen, so get started today.  But as I approach my 72nd birthday I have personally invested 10 years and more than 2 million in five companies before developing a winning approach to the problem. 

Five companies later, and poorer, I need help to take the company to market and to find the leadership to finish the job.

Thank You, 

Mo 
Mo Bjornestad 
Mo@uCaring.com 

http://www.MoBjornestad.com
http://www.uCaring.com
 Solution: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-AloGy12Ats 

                      uCaring.com goals and services

 

Our best and brightest have not been able to reduce the levels of violence against women; levels that have persisted for thousands of years. 

Prophets, Presidents, and Kings have had no success.  

Celebrities’ voices have had no success. 

But, notice, your favorite celebrities have tried and continue to try to help. They have used their time to stand up to be counted. 

Help them finish the work they support.  – Stand up with them, like them, and help them make a difference?  

Here are a few names of the people, famous people, who are working to make a difference.  The names are in no particular order, and I will add the names I missed if you will leave a comment mentioning your favorite activist - I will add their name for recognition:

Susan Sarandon, Erin Gray, Jamelia, Judi Dench, Monique Coleman, Joan van Ark, Loni Anderson, Sharon Lawrence, Rebecca Lindsey, Kathy Long, Lisa Gaylord, Bruce and Kristi Jenner, Annie Lennox, Charlize Theron, Daniel Craig, Ian Somerhalder, Nicole Kidman, Peter Gabriel, Reese Witherspoon, Kevin Bacon, Andrea Thompson, Kimiko Tanaka, Bonnie Sommerville, Bonnie Raitt, Michael Bolton, David Wilcox, Eve and Faith Evans, Kelly Willis, Ruth Brown, Brett Valet, Liz Solomon, Robin Wright Penn, Salma Hayek, Tim McGraw, Waris Dirie, Will Young, Oprah, Dr. Phil, John Walsh, and Bill and Malinda Gates.

 

We have a solution; A new approach.

NOW WE CAN solve this problem together. We can begin the process of stopping violence against women, children, and people everywhere just by working together.

The solution is a new kind of Reporting by a new kind of Community

Your eyes, ears, and resolve, will succeed where so many before you found so little hope for success.

Watch the video for the details but the basics are this:

– Report Problems: Use our Reporting Services to report Abuse, Bullying, Sexual Assault, Violence, Unusual Activity, Unattended packages and our system will notify nearby people in networks and businesses who care and who will step up to stop violence and protect people.  Together we can stop problems

-Report Good Behavior:  Report Acts of Kindness, Heroism, Good Deeds, Good Service, we want to recognize these people.

-Report News and other worthy items of information and interest to people in your community.  Wherever you are in your neighborhood, school, and community report what you see - sharing information creates community.

Along the way to creating community we will help to stop violence against women that is Abuse, Bullying, and Rape, and we will help to stop the violence and sexual assault going on in our schools.

You can be the eyes and ears in public places and at public events.  Your report might be able to stop a school shooting or a marathon bombing, abduction.

You and your network can do what Kings and Presidents could not do after thousands of years.

So, let’s go to work – Connect with your community using mobile phones and browsers.

Here are the services that will help you make the difference:  You can’t buy these services but they are yours to use for your personal use in building safety networks and using the safety, rescue, reporting, and messaging services. 

_________________Services_____________________________

WatchMe: A Safety Service:  

Touch a button when you feel at risk in a strange place or a dark parking lot; visiting a new client or on a first date; up on the roof or getting into the tub, feeling ill or faint, WatchMe will escalate to Rescue unless you are able to report that you are OK.

RescueMe: A Rescue Service: 

Touch a button if you are threatened with harm, losing control or consciousness.  Ask for rescue help early and the nearby people in your safety network will be instantly notified and one or more people may be only steps away from asking if you are OK or if you need help.

Report Problems: A Problem Report Service w/ Anonymity option: 

Touch a button to report Abuse, Bullying, Crime, Sexual Assault, Violence, Unusual Activity or Unwanted Behavior, and instant notification goes out to nearby people in safety network, business owners, school administrators and other authority positions.  Reports go into local feed.

Report Good Deeds:  Good News Report Service for Good News:

Touch a button to report and document Acts of Kindness, Good Deeds, Civic Good, Good Service, and for publishing news and note worthy items you notice.  Reports go into location-based feeds. 

Report Nearby: How many and how close are your safety network people.

Touch a button to see how many people and places are nearby to keep you safe.

Location-based Feeds:  Stay in Touch with what matters to you: 

Touch a button to select Report feeds from the locations you care about. From anywhere run a location feed for your home, neighborhood, kids’ school, or run a feed for a big game or concert to get reports on problems, good deeds, and news comments from people you know and others.  Filter real time for the kinds of reports you want, from the people you want to hear from.  Feeds are real time but also accessible by time line on a location-based dashboard: don’t miss anything, play later with instant replay of any part of a feed stream.   

Group Services: Most of the people we care about belong to a group.

Touch a button to create or access a group.  Stay in touch by sending a message or a start a live conference IM session. Locate one or all group members, and filter your outgoing messages by location; send only to people who are not nearby you, or who are nearby another location e.g., home, office, school, etc.  Group examples: family, neighborhood, school, work, friends, co-workers, as many as you need to easily talk about or reach out to for informing and or asking.

Managed Group Services:

Touch a button to find or reach members of a managed group. Create managed groups for the roles in your life where you have a responsibility for goals or accomplishments, and where group safety is at least important if not critical.  Running a work group, service or sales team, or coaching your daughter’s soccer team means your performance depends on communicating, sharing information, reporting problems and opportunities, responding to unexpected events, anticipating problems and defining desired outcomes.  Managed group services help you look good and produce good outcomes.

Managed Group Solutions:

Touch a button to select the solution template that best supports the structure, goals and roles of your managed group.  See more specific solutions below for more detail on the benefits of using Solution Templates.

School Campus Safety Solution:

Touch one button to acknowledge that you are on duty when you arrive on campus.  The Campus Safety Report form appears with the report options for your campus.  Once a report is made the system instantly notifies the nearby members who can respond to the reported problem. Any on campus user can report suspicious activity, bad behavior, accidents, hazards, violence.  The Response team verified the problem, handles it, or asks for more help.  A Dashboard keeps officials informed of all issues on campus with the information needed to understand the threat and if needed, to declare and manage a crisis, including mass notification. 

Public Event Safety Solution:

Touch one button services are similar but limited to registered attendees, and reports are directed to people filling the roles defined by the event managers. Fast, simple reporting with a fast trigger for the response teams mean any concern or actual threat is quickly identified, verified, and handled.  Solution template offers fast implementation of roles, reports and responses.   WatchMe services run continuously for response teams on assignment.

Caring Services:

Touch one button for Help or Rescue.  Help calls go to designated/scheduled caregivers wherever they are.  Caring for kids, seniors, or patients that informs remotely or on site has never been easier. A help button, with the option for being specific, informs when help is needed, and can be automatically timed for response or addition calls for help, in order to trigger messages to inform more people, or to further escalate.  Caring services include free video access to the person, and alerts if wanted, all direct and personal or with options for more escalation, including going to Rescue.

Automated Monitoring Services:

You can monitor video and other alerts on our App at no cost. However, when you are sleeping, on an airplane or in a meeting, you need help.  When only some alerts at some times of the day are important enough to interrupt your day, then we offer automation to help.  Alerts directed to us can be filtered, vetted, verified, or evaluated in terms of timing, sequence, how many, how fast, and so on, to determine if your rules and policy want you to be interrupted, you or someone you designate.  Powerful and inexpensive approach to managing alerts for your needs with your rules, schedules, and policy

Live Monitoring Services:

Some alerts in some places need live verification. Monitoring can detect motion, noises or voices, and other sensors report temperature, or the presence of water, smoke etc.  Are these false alarms or real event?  They need to be verified and if real offer assistance or if unwanted offer deterrence, and if not resolved, then dispatch security or local authorities. 

Some alerts are from people asking for help or just moving around during the day or night.  These events may need to be monitored.  Live viewing also supports remote caregivers with scheduled check-ins that report activity and well being as well as gather information requested by the caregiver. Live processes also follow rules and policy that support decisions for escalation.

One Touch Write-Once Messaging:

Write-Once messaging systems provide for sending ad hoc Alerts, Messages, and IM conferencing to one or more people or groups, with the ability to deliver the message or alert in the way the recipient desires – app to app or app to SMS text, email, post to social sites or a blog, and publish to key words, even Text to Voice for phone delivery.  With one message reach everyone you know by address, relationships thru other services, posting to sites and blogs, and to people you can address only by interest.  

More – yes, we do more and I will add it as I have time.

Thank you for your support. 

Mo
story_txt:
The Problem:  For thousands of years the best and brightest among us have tried and failed to stop violence against women.Enabling a Solution:  This age-old problem can now be addressed using technology advances. Execution: The uCaring.com solution needs to be tested and refined until we it right, until we have stopped violence against women. What you can do: 1. Drive the company: donate, use our services, spread the word to users, to investers, to celebrities, to people and companies committed to social good, be an  evangelist everywhere you go.  
2. If not already done, make a written commitment to Social Change.
3. Join our team as a volunteer, evangelist, local advocate, speak out.
Why I need you to pitch in and  help:First of all, only you can make it happen, so get started today.  But as I approach my 72nd birthday I have personally invested 10 years and more than 2 million in five companies before developing a winning approach to the problem. 
Five companies later, and poorer, I need help to take the company to market and to find the leadership to finish the job. Thank You,  Mo  Mo Bjornestad  Mo@uCaring.com 
http://www.MoBjornestad.comhttp://www.uCaring.com  Solution: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-AloGy12Ats 
                      uCaring.com goals and services
 
Our best and brightest have not been able to reduce the levels of violence against women; levels that have persisted for thousands of years. 
Prophets, Presidents, and Kings have had no success.  
Celebrities’ voices have had no success.  
But, notice, your favorite celebrities have tried and continue to try to help. They have used their time to stand up to be counted. 
Help them finish the work they support.  – Stand up with them, like them, and help them make a difference?  
Here are a few names of the people, famous people, who are working to make a difference.  The names are in no particular order, and I will add the names I missed if you will leave a comment mentioning your favorite activist - I will add their name for recognition:
Susan Sarandon, Erin Gray, Jamelia, Judi Dench, Monique Coleman, Joan van Ark, Loni Anderson, Sharon Lawrence, Rebecca Lindsey, Kathy Long, Lisa Gaylord, Bruce and Kristi Jenner, Annie Lennox, Charlize Theron, Daniel Craig, Ian Somerhalder, Nicole Kidman, Peter Gabriel, Reese Witherspoon, Kevin Bacon, Andrea Thompson, Kimiko Tanaka, Bonnie Sommerville, Bonnie Raitt, Michael Bolton, David Wilcox, Eve and Faith Evans, Kelly Willis, Ruth Brown, Brett Valet, Liz Solomon, Robin Wright Penn, Salma Hayek, Tim McGraw, Waris Dirie, Will Young, Oprah, Dr. Phil, John Walsh, and Bill and Malinda Gates.
 
We have a solution; A new approach. 
NOW WE CAN solve this problem together. We can begin the process of stopping violence against women, children, and people everywhere just by working together.
The solution is a new kind of Reporting by a new kind of Community
Your eyes, ears, and resolve, will succeed where so many before you found so little hope for success.
Watch the video for the details but the basics are this:
– Report Problems: Use our Reporting Services to report Abuse, Bullying, Sexual Assault, Violence, Unusual Activity, Unattended packages and our system will notify nearby people in networks and businesses who care and who will step up to stop violence and protect people.  Together we can stop problems
-Report Good Behavior:  Report Acts of Kindness, Heroism, Good Deeds, Good Service, we want to recognize these people.
-Report News and other worthy items of information and interest to people in your community.  Wherever you are in your neighborhood, school, and community report what you see - sharing information creates community.
Along the way to creating community we will help to stop violence against women that is Abuse, Bullying, and Rape, and we will help to stop the violence and sexual assault going on in our schools.
You can be the eyes and ears in public places and at public events.  Your report might be able to stop a school shooting or a marathon bombing, abduction.
You and your network can do what Kings and Presidents could not do after thousands of years.
So, let’s go to work – Connect with your community using mobile phones and browsers.
Here are the services that will help you make the difference:  You can’t buy these services but they are yours to use for your personal use in building safety networks and using the safety, rescue, reporting, and messaging services. 
_________________Services_____________________________
WatchMe: A Safety Service:  
Touch a button when you feel at risk in a strange place or a dark parking lot; visiting a new client or on a first date; up on the roof or getting into the tub, feeling ill or faint, WatchMe will escalate to Rescue unless you are able to report that you are OK.
RescueMe: A Rescue Service: 
Touch a button if you are threatened with harm, losing control or consciousness.  Ask for rescue help early and the nearby people in your safety network will be instantly notified and one or more people may be only steps away from asking if you are OK or if you need help.
Report Problems: A Problem Report Service w/ Anonymity option: 
Touch a button to report Abuse, Bullying, Crime, Sexual Assault, Violence, Unusual Activity or Unwanted Behavior, and instant notification goes out to nearby people in safety network, business owners, school administrators and other authority positions.  Reports go into local feed.
Report Good Deeds:  Good News Report Service for Good News:
Touch a button to report and document Acts of Kindness, Good Deeds, Civic Good, Good Service, and for publishing news and note worthy items you notice.  Reports go into location-based feeds. 
Report Nearby: How many and how close are your safety network people.
Touch a button to see how many people and places are nearby to keep you safe.
Location-based Feeds:  Stay in Touch with what matters to you: 
Touch a button to select Report feeds from the locations you care about. From anywhere run a location feed for your home, neighborhood, kids’ school, or run a feed for a big game or concert to get reports on problems, good deeds, and news comments from people you know and others.  Filter real time for the kinds of reports you want, from the people you want to hear from.  Feeds are real time but also accessible by time line on a location-based dashboard: don’t miss anything, play later with instant replay of any part of a feed stream.   
Group Services: Most of the people we care about belong to a group.
Touch a button to create or access a group.  Stay in touch by sending a message or a start a live conference IM session. Locate one or all group members, and filter your outgoing messages by location; send only to people who are not nearby you, or who are nearby another location e.g., home, office, school, etc.  Group examples: family, neighborhood, school, work, friends, co-workers, as many as you need to easily talk about or reach out to for informing and or asking.
Managed Group Services:
Touch a button to find or reach members of a managed group. Create managed groups for the roles in your life where you have a responsibility for goals or accomplishments, and where group safety is at least important if not critical.  Running a work group, service or sales team, or coaching your daughter’s soccer team means your performance depends on communicating, sharing information, reporting problems and opportunities, responding to unexpected events, anticipating problems and defining desired outcomes.  Managed group services help you look good and produce good outcomes.
Managed Group Solutions:
Touch a button to select the solution template that best supports the structure, goals and roles of your managed group.  See more specific solutions below for more detail on the benefits of using Solution Templates.
School Campus Safety Solution:

story:
This summer, I am embarking on a mission trip to Guatemala, an opportunity that I will never forget. I will be staying at Hope of Life Ministries in Zacapa, Guatemala with my mission team from the First Congregational Church of Litchfield. The compound serves as a church, food pantry, orphanage, school, hospital and home for the elderly. We will provide support to the people of Hope of Life and neighboring villages.

One of my professional goals is to become a teacher and teach English in a Spanish-speaking country. Being a part of the Zacapa community will help me to connect to my goals. I'm looking forward to offering love and support to the community there. This is such an incredible opportunity for me, and I would greatly appreciate your support. Thank you for helping to make this trip possible.

story:
Nine years into a crippling blockade, with poverty levels rising, unemployment at 30%, and little relief on the horizon, Gaza needs our help. This Ramadan we are joining hands with the partners to help support Gazans in need through our 2015 Ramadan Campaign, to raise funds for emergency food aid. This program provides a lifeline for many of poor families. During this Holy Month, please help us to draw the smile on face of those families.

What we will do ?

Distribute food packets to poor families to provide relief during Ramadan. Each food packet is designed to help a family of five to seven people.

 Each basket contains 

- Cheese 

- Legumes ( rice, lentils, etc... ) 

- Canned food - date - Sweets 

- macaroni 

- oil 

- canned fish and meat

-sugar

-jam

What we need ? Each basket costs 25$, we need to to distribute of food baskets to 150 poor families each food basket for each poor family, so we need to 3750$.

This project will help poor people in providing them with food and foodstuffs on Ramadan month, and draw a laugh on the faces of these poor families.

story:
Food Justice and Tomatoes

Thank you for stopping by to look at the Great Tomato Woman's project – part II.  A proponent of Food Justice, my goal is to combine education, accessibility and basic research in tomato growing to help people with minimal space, minimal resources, and physical constraints to grow their own healthy food.  

My name is Victoria Ferguson, although most people call me Fergie.  I have been described as a tomato fanatic --  I have been raising tomatoes for over 40 years and am currently pursuing my doctoral degree in tomato pathology in sustainable agriculture/horticulture.  Tomatoes are one of the world's most important food crop.  They are also one of the easiest to grow.  I believe that a sustainable, organic system in a high raised bed structure may provide some solutions to the problems of community food deserts and increase the ability of people to grow their own food.   This project is being done in collaboration with the Cornell Cooperative Extension of Nassau County's teaching farm in East Meadow.  The purpose of this project is three fold:

1) to demonstrate the ease of growing good, healthy food in this high raised bed system, for people who may be physically challenged, time constrained, or space constrained; 

2) to examine the impact of using crop rotation in raised beds as far as creating a sustainable system; 

and 

3) to characterize microbial communities of various cultivars of tomatoes in an effort to understand the relationship between individual cultivars and their susceptibility to disease.

This system has been piloted in several settings with great social results: one 80 year old cancer survivor was inspired to spend more time outside with his little raised bed.  Another participant, a workaholic with limited time, was able to grow tomatoes, corn, peppers, cucumbers and more with reasonable time input.  Our own nine-plot research field in another location provided over 10 bushels of fresh tomatillos to a local food pantry, as well as edible marigold plants and basil for cooking.  We were able to preserve over 20 bushels of tomatoes as sauce, chutneys, and sliced tomatoes with no chiropractic visits!

Your contribution to this  part of the campaign will help us to meet the financial constraints of "doing science"- the third part of the goals listed above.  The data collected from the root microbial community study will help us to determine which tomatoes are best for growing in various systems, environments, and geological areas. This then will be passed on to the agricultural, horticultural communities at large via teaching, blogging, research papers, talks, and conferences.

 We believe that anyone can grow their own healthy food if given an appropriate system and support, and this research is one way to provide support for the best possible growing outcomes.

The basic research component of this project will encompass crop rotation over three to four years: one set of boxes will contain nitrogen fixing crops (beans, etc) to put nutrients (Nitrogen) back into the soil; the other set contains tomato and marigold plants.  A lone center box contains flowers and plants which attract beneficial insects and pollinators. 

At the end of the growing season, the tomato plants will be pulled and their root microbial communities will be examined to characterize each cultivar.  The next year, the tomatoes will be planted in the bean boxes and vice versa.  These root communities will be compared from year to year along with any plant diseases that may occur.

What We Need & What You Get

Your generous contribution will be used to help pay for the science portion of the project: DNA extraction kits, growing chambers/racks suitable for a non laboratory facility, storage of extracted DNA for up to four years, and basic horticultural needs: soil testing, either by reference lab or in-house using state of the art tests such as Solvita, pens, test tubes, racks, etc.

The bulk of the expense is in DNA extraction and in storage. DNA long term storage is best done at -80C or below. The cost of storing this limited set of samples for 36 months is about $12,000, however this cost may not be fixed and if the study continues for another year, storage costs will approximate the cost of a capital expenditure in the form of a freezer. The cost of a -80C freezer is approximately $16,000. The benefit of having our own freezer is that more samples may be stored as research grows; we may be able to provide a resource with storage and garner some revenue with the expenditure. This campaign is based on the cost of the freezer and a 'best case guesstimate' of electrical costs for the Long Island area to power additional equipment.

 We do have some perks associated with your generous donation -- all of these are created by folks associated with the project.  We welcome visitors to the site once we are up and running!

The Impact

The social impact of this work is tremendous: people who have begun to use this system find their workload is manageable.  Weed pressure is lower, the boxes are warmer earlier, water is retained fairly well, and picking the produce is effortless.  Many garden pests, such as rabbits, don't climb the two foot walls.

The basic research aspects of the study, characterization and sustainability, also add to the social justice impact of community food sovereignty.  The characterization will allow for selection of tomatoes that are best for a geographical area, as we will be characterizing these heirlooms and impacts the crop rotation may have on each cultivar's root microbial community and the relationship between that community and the ability of the plant to resist or tolerate common tomato diseases.  This characterization may define breeding goals for new tomato cultivars and breeds in organic systems, as well as providing data on heirlooms for use.   The sustainability aspect will allow for a system to be economically and environmentally self sufficient.  Together, then, these components will give us information which will allow for a less frustrating gardening experience by those who are growing these delectable fruits for their own nourishment.

At the end of the research study, these boxes will be donated for educational gardening demonstrations to the Extension

story:
Allow us to introduce ourselves:

Stephen and I met in New York City in June of 2000.  For the past 13 years, we have worked together on and off, but mostly on.  Our restaurant On the Square in downtown Tarboro is our love child, a thriving business that continues to keep us busy and bring us pleasure and adventure.  

 

We bought the existing building on 526 North Main Street (home of the future Tarboro Brewing Company) because we fell in love with the property and the location.  It has been a longtime dream to begin a brewery, but it has been an even longer dream to make Tarboro a destination town for people of all ages and backgrounds.  We feel that TBC could be yet another business to synergize downtown Tarboro and attract more people and businesses. 

 

 

THE FUN STUFF

 

It is too important in this day and age to not give back to the community and the people who ultimately make your business successful.  In Tarboro, we are ever grateful for the feedback, the support and the patronage of so many residents.  Because our appreciation for the small town we live in is ever growing, we want to make sure we are continually giving back to different areas that may need the most financial assistance.

 

Edgecombe County Public Schools (ECPS)

 

As a graduate of Tarboro High School, I am a proud alumni who will continue to support the public school system that helped make me who I am today.  It is constantly facing challenges in all areas, and a large one is the financial support of its community.  Modeled after Communities in Schools (CIS), one night a month will be dedicated to raising money for Edgecombe County Public Schools.  TBC will donate a portion of its sales to the school system in hopes of creating better opportunities for the students and their teachers.  These monthly events will incorporate Bingo, Ping Pong tournaments, shuffleboard and other kid-friendly games to attract a wide audience from all over the county.

 

Tarboro Community Outreach (TCO)

Tarboro is extremely fortunate to have one of the best shelters in the eastern part of the state run by an extremely competent nun named Sister Mary Anne Czaja.  Our homeless community has benefited from the ongoing support of personal and professional entities.  TBC will continue to fund our shelter with a monthly benefit where 10% of our sales will be given to Tarboro Community Outreach.  These events will incorporate local musicians and artists who are a big part of our county.  With the help of live entertainment and creativity, we feel we will be able to attract a broad audience from all over the eastern part of the state.

Tarboro is extremely fortunate to have one of the best shelters in the eastern part of the state run by an extremely competent nun named Sister Mary Anne Czaja.  Our homeless community has benefited from the ongoing support of personal and professional entities.  TBC will continue to fund our shelter with a monthly benefit where 10% of our sales will be given to Tarboro Community Outreach.  These events will incorporate local musicians and artists who are a big part of our county.  With the help of live entertainment and creativity, we feel we will be able to attract a broad audience from all over the eastern part of the state.

story:
Our Project

Guerilla Beekeepers has an outstanding reputation for safe and gentle honeybee removal and relocation from residential, commercial, and municipal properties. We are a fully-insured, California state licensed business. So what makes us different?

  • We keep every colony that we rescue.
  • We practice sustainable methods of beekeeping.
  • We only place our honeybees on horticulturally diverse properties and farmlands in Southern California.
  • We place our hives permanently in one location.

Even though we do all this, we know we can do more. So, after the annual pollination event in Central California, we rescued our first set of 100 commercial hives.

Our project is to rehabilitate the
100 hives we rescued so the bees make
delicious, pure, sustainably-produced wildflower honey for you.


We have already proven on a small scale that using sustainable beekeeping practices allow the bees to flourish, the honey to flow, and our business to grow. Now it’s time to prove it again on a larger scale!

Click here to learn more about the depth of our project
and our overall mission

Project Essentials

To successfully rehabilitate these 100 colonies our project requires new hive boxes (woodenware), beekeeping tools,
and a vehicle.

Woodenware & Tools:  $13,000

Our newly rescued honeybees need to be transferred from their old woodenware, which have been exposed to the chemicals used in farming, to new, clean hive boxes. Each hive consists of 3 boxes (2 deeps and 1 super), 10 frames per box, a top cover, and a bottom board. Five hives are placed together on a stand made of lumber and bricks. In total, we need 300 hives boxes, 3000 frames, 100 tops, 100 bottoms, and material for stands. We also need more beekeeper's tools like bee suits, gloves, smokers, hive tools, and equipment for raising our own queens.

Vehicle:  $17,000

Although our Honda Element (with over 200,000 miles) has served us faithfully and well, a second company vehicle is essential to our success. When we are called to remove a honeybee colony or swarm we must be able to respond immediately, and visiting our apiaries ties up our vehicle. A second company vehicle will allow us to more efficiently manage our apiaries while leaving our first vehicle available for honeybee rescue calls. We don't need anything new or fancy, just functional and reliable. We're also interested in converting our vehicles to cleaner-burning propane. If we exceed our goal we can do this, too!

If we exceed our goals we can expand our efforts even further!

Beekeeper:  $Priceless (But make us an offer!)

We would *love* the opportunity to train a new beekeeper! Any funding beyond our goal isn't expected to pay a salary, but rather to be assistance in covering our costs during the initial months needed to mentor a new beekeeper in beekeeping and bee rescue.

Where are your donations going?

Our Project Essentials webpage details the tools and equipment necessary to successfully complete our project. There you can see exactly how we will utilize your greatly appreciated donations.


To say thank you...

Every donation counts and we sincerely thank you for each and every one. We would like to show our appreciation for all of you who are helping us out by thanking you in our social media channels as well as on our Contributors page on the Guerilla Beekeepers website. We would also like to offer premiums for donations at the $25 level and above.


Just the Beginning…

Guerilla Beekeepers is already making a difference by educating the public about the option of live rescue as an alternative to extermination, and how practicing sustainable beekeeping methods enables honeybees, currently at risk, to thrive. By demonstrating financial success producing honey from 100 rehabilitated hives using sustainable methods will make it possible for others to understand that there is an alternate and commercially viable beekeeping business model that can help restore the health and vitality of our global honeybee populations.

Risks and Challenges

After each year's pollination runs in California's Central Valley, many migratory beekeepers sell off portions of their stock before heading home. It was at this time we made the decision to move forward and purchase our first 100 commercial hives to rescue and rehabilitate. We took the risk in buying these hives, now we need your partnership in nurturing them to become providers of sustainably-produced honey.

Our first step in rehabilitating these colonies is to provide them with fresh, clean hive boxes and frames as quickly as possible. Lingering contaminants inside the old hive boxes not only continue to adversely affect the health of the honeybees, these chemicals ultimately find their way into the honey and wax. By providing these colonies with brand-new, pristine homes we can be assured that their health is no longer compromised, and that the propolis, beeswax, and honey we harvest from them is as pure as possible.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Order honey and hive products from our website

  • Visit us at our farmers markets, Orange Home Grown  and Dana Point

  • Call or refer us for a hive rescue, toll-free 855.LUV.BEES

  • Have Bill bring his observation hive and speak to your group


This project needs your support, so please contribute today. 

Every dollar helps us in our mission to Save the Bees!

Thank you!

-Bill

Guerilla Beekeepers, LLC 1508 S Grand Ave. Santa Ana, CA 92705 855.LUV.BEES (588.2337)

story:
We thank you for your interest in supporting The Center’s Opening New Doors campaign!

Every year, tens of thousands of Nevadans and visitors seek out The Center as a hub for the LGBTQ community. We offer programs and services not provided elsewhere in the community including social, educational and support groups. In 2012, at our Commercial Center facility, we provided services to over 36,000 LGBTQ youth, adults, seniors and allies, and we anticipate this number to grow.

To meet the needs of our growing and expanding community, The Center embarked on an ambitious project to build a new home and become an anchor in the revitalization of Downtown Las Vegas.

This new Robert L. Forbuss Building will offer a café, enhanced Youth Center, and an event center with flexible walls so we can host events such as seminars, meetings, performances and workshops.

Also, for the first time, we will have a dedicated Health & Wellness Center to serve the unique needs of the community, offering a level of dignity and privacy previously unavailable to the low-to-middle income residents of the city.

As we head toward completing the Opening New Doors campaign and ensure The Center’s continued success, we look to you: our allies, the LGBTQ population, and the greater Las Vegas community. Your investment is essential to us here at The Center.  But more importantly, your investment is vital to countless individuals across Southern Nevada and will send a message to the larger national public. Progress is being made, community by community. We have not yet arrived, but together we will.     

Donate today and join us as we create our history by building our future. 

Thank you!  Be sure to join us Saturday, April 6, 2013 at 10:00 a.m. for the Grand Opening Celebration and see what you've helped bring to life!

story:
This is who we are.

Grand St. Community Arts is a 501(c)3 non-profit organization in Albany’s South End. Our building was constructed in 1907 as St. Anthony’s church, when our community was largely an Italian immigrant neighborhood. The church not only filled the needs of parishioners, but also helped immigrants adjust to American life by offering English classes, performances, weddings and operas, enhancing St. Anthony’s reputation as a center for the arts. But in 1972, following the construction of the Empire State Plaza and the demolition of many homes in the South End, St. Anthony’s had lost its congregation and closed its doors.

In 2003, Grand Street Community Arts was purchased from the Catholic diocese, and reopened as community hub, offering programs for teens such as award winning teen film program Youth FX and Youth Organics, as well as classes, after-school programs for kids and even performances by artists like Kimya Dawson, Taina Asili y la Banda Rebelde, Climbing Poetree, and The Sierra Leone All Stars.

So what’s the problem?

Following the economic downturn, diminishing resources, and long untended issues with our infrastructure, we’ve had to move our programs off-site, cut other programs, and keep our building closed during the fall and winter due to a broken HVAC system. Unable to occupy our building legally, we can’t run programs, performances, or therefore sustain ourselves financially. With the building as it stands, we actually run the risk of folding all together.

This is where you come in.

In order for us to operate and provide programs in our building, we need to install a heating system, fix our roof, floors and walls, plumbing, and update our stage equipment. For all of that, we'd need approximately $150,000 total. In this first phase, though, we're asking for $45,000 to get our doors open. This will cover the cost of installing our HVAC system, repairing the walls, and fixing the roof. Then we can operate legally, year-round and begin to provide programs that will give us sustainable income. Your support is integral to this process, and you will be thanked appropriately! Depending on your level of support, your generosity will be thanked publicly, ranging from small gifts like a DVD set from our Youth FX program, to limited edition artwork, a VIP party in your honor, or even naming a room after you! Remember, every gift counts, no matter the size.

Real impact for our neighborhood.

While rich in diversity, beautiful historic architecture, and community, the South End struggles with severe poverty and crime. Grand Street Community Arts has enormous potential to become a safe haven for children and families, as well as a cultural landmark for the entire city.  

Anyone can help.

We’re no stranger to financial woes, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help. If you can't donate at this time, please consider the following:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.

  • Share our campaign on Facebook, Twitter and email

  • Stop by and say hello if you’re in the neighborhood!


THANK YOU!

story:
Did you know that Lubbock has the highest rate of child abuse in Texas? Kappa Delta’s annual Shamrock 48-hour See-Saw-A-Thon is an event held to raise money for the South Plains Children’s Advocacy Center and Prevent Child Abuse America. 

80% of the funds raised will stay in Lubbock, helping the Children’s Advocacy Center of the South Plains and 20% of the funds raised will go nationally to Prevent Child Abuse America to provide education on the prevention of child abuse. 

The Children’s Advocacy Center of the South Plains provides children a safe place where specialized forensic interviewers talk to children in a child-friendly, non-threatening environment to listen to their abuse/trauma story. The Children’s Advocacy Center is also a place where law enforcement, medical personnel, and child protective services collaborate on child abuse/trauma cases to best meet the needs of children and provide children and families free therapeutic services to promote healing and recovery. 

In the past 3 years we have donated more than $50,000 to the Children’s Advocacy Center of the South Plains and we hope that you can help us donate today!

 

·         $80.00 Donation (cash or an item to be auctioned off)

o   Your name/company name will be on our T-shirt that is worn by Kappa Delta members and the Texas Tech Greek community

 ·         $150.00 Donation (cash or an item to be auctioned off)

o   Your name/company name will be on our T-shirt that is worn by Kappa Delta members and the Texas Tech Greek community

o   Your name will be printed on the banner at the event, seen by thousands!

story:
Its been a long day at work.  Nothing seemed to go as planned.  Deadlines are looming and there's still work to be done.... but first, FOOD.

Where to go?  What's close enough to run out and grab without losing too much time?  There's that one place with the amazing Mac N Hot Dogs but there's always a line.  It's soooo good though!  Will it be worth the drive and the wait?  Think one of the interns might run and get it if they can get a meal out of it?  Maybe there's an unclaimed lunch in the refrigerator that won't be missed, but food needs to happen ASAP!

What's more important, time or money or hunger?  This is the cornerstone question of the Accelerated Market Place and with our suite of apps we intend to solve the dilemma.

The origin story of AMP begins with two hungry guys stuck in a drive thru wishing there were some way to bypass the line and quiet their stomachs.  In the grueling minutes that followed before reaching the pickup window, the pair of starving office grunts had come up with a plan to completely change the rules of meal time. 

Two years, four prototypes, one pending patent, and countless hours studying the delivery landscape later, the AMP Network is ready to come to life!  The small but determined team of founders have dedicated long hours to developing a new business model for delivery services and prototypes illustrating the concept.    Enlisting the services of Razur Agency, LLC to develop our four prototypes (one each for Consumer, Delivery Agent, Routing Supervisor, and Restaurant) we have taken the concept as far as we can fueled by personal finances, investing nearly $50,000 into the business thus far.  However, the Network cannot exist without the infrastructure provided by the fully functional applications and Content Management System.  However AMP is built by the hungry, for the hungry, and hopefully will be supported by the hungry to get it off the ground (and to get at that Mac N Hot Dogs)  

The future of ordering is knocking at the door... are you ready to answer?




At AMP, we focus on efficiency above all else.  It is our goal to continually evolve our business practices to ensure that we are making the most of what we have available. 

 

The basis of our system is to deliver to customers for as little as $2.75 on single orders.  This Base Delivery Fee will cover delivery of any order $25 or less from a restaurant within 3.5 miles of the delivery address.  Each delivery order earns 1 Medal of Order.

Delivery orders may also be "left open" as a Group Order where hungry neighbors may join the Group Order delivery schedule, each one dropping the delivery fee for all participants.  Each additional participant in a Group Order earns the leader an extra Medal of Order as well as one for themselves.


Delivery Agents are assigned to delivery orders by Routing Supervisors and can carry as many as three individual orders or one Group Order.  Delivery Agents are paid per delivery plus gratuity, added through the app from a stored credit card.

Customers collect Medals of Order to be shared with other AMP users or traded in for delivery credit.

5 Medals = $1 credit

10 Medals = $2.75 credit

50 Medals = $20 Delivery Credit

The AMP family of apps is what makes this order method possible.

  • AMP Consumer App allows for easy ordering, delivery scheduling, saving favorites, getting recommendations, and providing feedback on goods and services
  • AMP Delivery Agent App provides a simple interface for receiving delivery stops, in-app navigation, emergency alerts, and communication with Routing Supervisors
  • AMP Routing Supervisor App provides an overview of the local delivery area, the active Delivery Agents therein, pending and confirmed Consumer orders, and emergency alerts
  • AMP Restaurant App is designed to manage all incoming order needs, tallying sales, menu updates, customer feedback, and delivery efficiency
  • Order Pooling gives power to the population to join forces and save on delivery fees
  • AMP Community Engagement Board helps guide the charitable donations generated by the Network so that they are used to the betterment of the areas we serve.


Save the Prototype links to your Home Screen to launch directly from your tablet or phone

Routing Supervisor Prototype - http://invis.io/KTBHFMWP

 

Restaurant Prototype - http://invis.io/BXBZMVM9

***Consumer and Delivery Agent prototypes available upon request***


Not only does the AMP suite of applications make delivery easier for Customers, it's more cost efficient for Restaurants who will no longer need to worry about scheduling of delivery drivers to meet often unpredictable demand.  Delivery Services are provided on demand with consistent communication and visibility to the Mobile Delivery Force which can flow from hot dog stand to fast-casual restaurant to food truck with ease.  The cost of delivery services is dependent on order value and capped at $2.75 so that there is no need to enforce minimums on customer delivery orders.  

Delivery Drivers also win in the AMP Network.  Because AMP Delivery Agents operate across the entire network of Restaurants in their area, they have many more opportunities to earn tips than a driver serving a single location.  Customers win with consistent delivery every time they order, never being forced to wait while a lone delivery driver makes rounds back and forth.

The key contributors to AMP Network efficiency are the Routing Supervisors who monitor all delivery order traffic and assign the pending orders to the Delivery Agent in best position to rapidly get it to its destination.  This position will be challenging and require excellent spatial, logistical and critical thinking skills.  Additionally, Supervisors will be the point of contact for local delivery order issues.  

The final component to the AMP Network operation is the Community Engagement Board.  We at AMP are all too familiar with the news of violence and misfortune that plague cities across the United States and the globe.  We want to become agents of positive change, incorporating Community Engagement into our financial model and capping managerial earnings to allow exponential increases in the Community Engagement Budget.  The Board will guide the use of the budget to help maximize the return on investment for the communities that support us with their business.  Whether it be collections for food/coat drives, donations to soup kitchens and shelters, support of local community centers, or even sponsoring fun events rewarding scholastic achievement, the AMP Network is committed to serving the public.

Above all else, we at AMP want you to know that we are about quality service and efficiency.  Between the three members of the AMP Managerial Team, we bring professional experience in Supply Chain Management, Database Management, Systems Engineering, Equity Research on Wall Street, and Direction of Mergers and Acquisitions, all for major industry players in Health Care, Market Research, and Banking.  This in addition to countless hours in community service through church, fraternity, and collegiate organizations in and around Chicago, Philadelphia, New York, and Florida.  As we continue to put forth our best efforts to support our current employers and organizations, we put just as much effort and even more care into building the model for the future of Delivery Services and civic leadership.



We at AMP believe that if you want to do something, you do it to the best of your ability.  Since first spawning the idea for a simple takeout ordering app two years ago, the concept has evolved into a family of interconnected mobile apps that will not only give life to the business model, but also provide all users with a fluid and enjoyable experience.  "Take your time and do it right" as the saying goes.  However, quality comes at a cost.  We are seeking funding of $700,000 to help cover the following expenses:

$657,000 - Product Development (Project Estimate)

  • Consumer App (Android and iOS)
  • Restaurant App (Android and iOS)
  • Delivery Agent App (Android and iOS)
  • Routing Supervisor App (Android and iOS)
  • Content Management System
  • 6 Month estimated duration with standard allocation of resources

$21,691 - Tablet Devices

  • $199 estimated cost per Tablet (cost variable depending on bulk rate and market at time of purchase)
  • One Tablet for all Routing Supervisors
  • One Tablet for each Restaurant (assuming they do not already have one)
  • Estimate based on Network launch in North Suburban Chicago with 107 participating Restaurants projected out of a pool of 238 takeout establishments
  • Projected count of Routing Supervisors is dependent on order volume, but we are planning to need 2 at launch and add more as participation increases

$1,232 - Thermal Delivery Bags

  • Approx $28 each (latest price for the preferred bag, down from $32 with the same vendor earlier in 2013)
  • 20 x 20 Insulated Thermal Top-loading bag
  •  Estimate based on projected need for 44 Delivery Agents at time of launch in North Suburban Chicago


Following costs based upon projected launch with 107 Restaurants and 44 Delivery Agents

$2,000 - AMP Plastic Bags to supply Restaurants for delivery orders (bulk rate)

$635 - AMP Vehicle Magnets for Delivery Agents

$600 - Brochures, Mailers, and Signage

$320 - AMP Window Clings for Restaurants

$300 - AMP T-Shirts for Delivery Agents

$16,857 - Besides rounding our funding goal to an even 700k, this amount is included in the event we run into the (fortunate) problem of having more restaurants wanting to join the launch network than projected. That will require a greater investment in tablets for Restaurants and supplies for Delivery Agents.  Also, additional funding will allow more human resources to be dedicated to developing the AMP Applications and Content Management System, shortening the time between funding and launch.

If our campaign falls short of the target, all funds collected will be put toward the development of the Content Management System through which the AMP Apps will be connected.  The CMS will facilitate the menu management, route assignment guidelines, performance racking, data collection, payment processing, and many other vital aspects of the business model.  In essense, the CMS is the meat of the layered sandwich that is the Accelerated Market Place.  The apps are the bread, cheese, mayo and chips.  The CMS is the most critical component to the operational success of the Network and is our top developmental priority.  If the funds raised are not sufficient to begin work on the CMS, then we will assess our financial leverage and determine what alternatives would be most beneficial to move us forward given the situation.    

It is our desire to keep AMP a privately owned operation not subject to the governance of an array of outside investment entities.  Our Community Engagement Budget is a significant portion of the financial model and is not typical of a standard commercial organization as it takes away from the pool of money that would usually be absorbed by executives in the form of bonuses and pay raises.  We do not want to lose the ability to fund community projects as a result of aligning ourselves with financiers that do not share our philanthropic aspirations.  We want to grow to become the big business that acts like a mom n pop shop, never losing sight of the needs of the people that make it a success.



The birth of the AMP Network will bring more than just hot food at low prices.  The expansion of the Network will bring with it more opportunities and greater earning potential for Deliver Drivers as well as career opportunities for Routing Supervisors.  As an employer, Accelerated Market Place LLC is built with the needs of the employee in mind.  The entire business model is designed to maximize the earning potential of the drivers and their ability to earn tips by seeing more customers during their shifts.  Under minimum efficiency, Delivery Agents would earn approximately $8.80 per hour before tips (4 deliveries per hour).  However, increased usage and increased deliveries plays to the strength of the Network and could allow upwards of 10 individual order deliveries in an hour ($22.00 before tips) and more with the Order Pooling system.  The ability to create opportunities for consistent and financially rewarding part time work in any city or suburb is a large part of what keeps us pushing toward making this dream a reality.  

Aside from the individual benefits of job creation, we know that the addition of a mobile app and delivery to smaller restaurants can be a big help in surviving the competition with larger chain restaurants.  The failure rate among restaurants is one of the highest for new businesses and often its lack of exposure and awareness in the surrounding community.  With the AMP Consumer App, it will be easier to find new favorites since the obstacle of travel is removed the patron's decision making process.  The search and discover process will always be at fingers' reach.  Also, with Order Pooling, customers can try out the new place at the same time as their neighbors, creating an opportunity for a convergence of local opinions that there's a new place with great food!

Another benefit to Restaurants is that the AMP Consumer App will provide a consistent forum for feedback on their meals.  Restaurants no longer have to wonder why their new menu item isn't popular because customers can tell them while they eat at home.  In no other industry is personal taste as important as with food service.  Furthermore, if AMP is able to expand to serving grocery orders, customers can provide feedback on items they purchase routinely and participate in the Research and Development process by informing manufacturers what is and is not needed of their products.  The easier it is for suppliers to communicate with the consumers, the easier it is to provide a product that meets the consumer needs.

The greatest potential impact of the AMP Network will be delivered through the Community Engagement Board.  As we developed the structure of this business model, it became clear that the current technological environment would make it possible to achieve significant revenue generation at relatively high profit margins.  However, we firmly believe in the concept of making "enough profit" and want to set a new example for corporate giving where transparency and philanthropy are standard characteristics.  Sometimes all it takes to get people to do positive things is to see someone else do it first.  We know we won't be the first civic-minded business, but we would like to become the biggest.  Everyone needs to eat, and AMP wants to see to it that everyone does.



First, we would like to thank you for having read this far.  The AMP Network has many layers and we could fill three more campaigns explaining the beneficial doors it may open, so thank you thank you thank you for the time you've taken thus far to learn about what we are trying to do.

If you believe in our mission and want to see AMP delivering meals in your neighborhood, please tell a friend about us and our campaign!  Thankfully Indiegogo makes it really easy to tweet/mention/like/share us on the interweb.

Follow us on Twitter @AMPDelivers or check out our Facebook Page for updates and if you have ideas for how we could provide more value, feel free to let us know!  

Please take our Short Prelaunch Survey to give us a better idea of how to tailor the Network to your needs.  The Network will only be as strong as the people in it, and the strength of our business is in its focus on serving those people efficiently.

If you want to learn more, we have a lot more to tell you!  Please visit our website, AMPDelivers.com, for our Customer FAQ and Restaurant FAQ or send us an email at Info@AMPDelivers.com for more info about the business model, prototypes, and Order Pooling (patent pending).

If you have some loose change and are able to invest in the creation of our business model, please check out our perks.  Once AMP is launched in your area, you will enjoy delivery services at a discount or for free!  If you're more of the adventurous type, take our Super Bowl Challenge to see if you can score some extra free deliveries with your sports knowledge.  The Super Bowl-based perks will be updated and limited as we get closer to the big game, so the earlier you enter your prediction, the bigger you win!  Next year you could have your party catered with the help of the AMP Network!


Thanks SO much for checking us out.  We hope to see you soon with food in hand!

Don't forget to add your favorites restaurants to our Network Map!  Just search, "Add Pin", and Save it to the map.  Add your Twitter @ or FB Name to the pin so AMP can follow you and your taste buds!
story_txt:
Its been a long day at work.  Nothing seemed to go as planned.  Deadlines are looming and there's still work to be done.... but first, FOOD.Where to go?  What's close enough to run out and grab without losing too much time?  There's that one place with the amazing Mac N Hot Dogs but there's always a line.  It's soooo good though!  Will it be worth the drive and the wait?  Think one of the interns might run and get it if they can get a meal out of it?  Maybe there's an unclaimed lunch in the refrigerator that won't be missed, but food needs to happen ASAP!What's more important, time or money or hunger?  This is the cornerstone question of the Accelerated Market Place and with our suite of apps we intend to solve the dilemma.The origin story of AMP begins with two hungry guys stuck in a drive thru wishing there were some way to bypass the line and quiet their stomachs.  In the grueling minutes that followed before reaching the pickup window, the pair of starving office grunts had come up with a plan to completely change the rules of meal time. Two years, four prototypes, one pending patent, and countless hours studying the delivery landscape later, the AMP Network is ready to come to life!  The small but determined team of founders have dedicated long hours to developing a new business model for delivery services and prototypes illustrating the concept.    Enlisting the services of Razur Agency, LLC to develop our four prototypes (one each for Consumer, Delivery Agent, Routing Supervisor, and Restaurant) we have taken the concept as far as we can fueled by personal finances, investing nearly $50,000 into the business thus far.  However, the Network cannot exist without the infrastructure provided by the fully functional applications and Content Management System.  However AMP is built by the hungry, for the hungry, and hopefully will be supported by the hungry to get it off the ground (and to get at that Mac N Hot Dogs)  The future of ordering is knocking at the door... are you ready to answer?
At AMP, we focus on efficiency above all else.  It is our goal to continually evolve our business practices to ensure that we are making the most of what we have available.  The basis of our system is to deliver to customers for as little as $2.75 on single orders.  This Base Delivery Fee will cover delivery of any order $25 or less from a restaurant within 3.5 miles of the delivery address.  Each delivery order earns 1 Medal of Order.Delivery orders may also be "left open" as a Group Order where hungry neighbors may join the Group Order delivery schedule, each one dropping the delivery fee for all participants.  Each additional participant in a Group Order earns the leader an extra Medal of Order as well as one for themselves.Delivery Agents are assigned to delivery orders by Routing Supervisors and can carry as many as three individual orders or one Group Order.  Delivery Agents are paid per delivery plus gratuity, added through the app from a stored credit card.Customers collect Medals of Order to be shared with other AMP users or traded in for delivery credit.5 Medals = $1 credit10 Medals = $2.75 credit50 Medals = $20 Delivery CreditThe AMP family of apps is what makes this order method possible.

AMP Consumer App allows for easy ordering, delivery scheduling, saving favorites, getting recommendations, and providing feedback on goods and services

AMP Delivery Agent App provides a simple interface for receiving delivery stops, in-app navigation, emergency alerts, and communication with Routing Supervisors

AMP Routing Supervisor App provides an overview of the local delivery area, the active Delivery Agents therein, pending and confirmed Consumer orders, and emergency alerts

AMP Restaurant App is designed to manage all incoming order needs, tallying sales, menu updates, customer feedback, and delivery efficiency

Order Pooling gives power to the population to join forces and save on delivery fees

AMP Community Engagement Board helps guide the charitable donations generated by the Network so that they are used to the betterment of the areas we serve.
Save the Prototype links to your Home Screen to launch directly from your tablet or phoneRouting Supervisor Prototype - http://invis.io/KTBHFMWP

 Restaurant Prototype - http://invis.io/BXBZMVM9
***Consumer and Delivery Agent prototypes available upon request***Not only does the AMP suite of applications make delivery easier for Customers, it's more cost efficient for Restaurants who will no longer need to worry about scheduling of delivery drivers to meet often unpredictable demand.  Delivery Services are provided on demand with consistent communication and visibility to the Mobile Delivery Force which can flow from hot dog stand to fast-casual restaurant to food truck with ease.  The cost of delivery services is dependent on order value and capped at $2.75 so that there is no need to enforce minimums on customer delivery orders.  Delivery Drivers also win in the AMP Network.  Because AMP Delivery Agents operate across the entire network of Restaurants in their area, they have many more opportunities to earn tips than a driver serving a single location.  Customers win with consistent delivery every time they order, never being forced to wait while a lone delivery driver makes rounds back and forth.The key contributors to AMP Network efficiency are the Routing Supervisors who monitor all delivery order traffic and assign the pending orders to the Delivery Agent in best position to rapidly get it to its destination.  This position will be challenging and require excellent spatial, logistical and critical thinking skills.  Additionally, Supervisors will be the point of contact for local delivery order issues.  The final component to the AMP Network operation is the Community Engagement Board.  We at AMP are all too familiar with the news of violence and misfortune that plague cities across the United States and the globe.  We want to become agents of positive change, incorporating Community Engagement into our financial model and capping managerial earnings to allow exponential increases in the Community Engagement Budget.  The Board will guide the use of the budget to help maximize the return on investment for the communities that support us with their business.  Whether it be collections for food/coat drives, donations to soup kitchens and shelters, support of local community centers, or even sponsoring fun events rewarding scholastic achievement, the AMP Network is committed to serving the public.Above all else, we at AMP want you to know that we are about quality service and efficiency.  Between the three members of the AMP Managerial Team, we bring professional experience in Supply Chain Management, Database Management, Systems Engineering, Equity Research on Wall Street, and Direction of Mergers and Acquisitions, all for major industry players in Health Care, Market Research, and Banking.  This in addition to countless hours in community service through church, fraternity, and collegiate organizations in and around Chicago, Philadelphia, New York, and Florida.  As we continue to put forth our best efforts to support our current employers and organizations, we put just as much effort and even more care into building the model for the future of Delivery Services and civic leadership.We at AMP believe that if you want to do something, you do it to the best of your ability.  Since first spawning the idea for a simple takeout ordering app two years ago, the concept has evolved into a family of interconnected mobile apps that will not only give life to the business model, but also provide all users with a fluid and enjoyable experience.  "Take your time and do it right" as the saying goes.  However, quality comes at a cost.  We are seeking funding of $700,000 to help cover the following expenses:$657,000 - Product Development (Project Estimate)
Consumer App (Android and iOS)
Restaurant App (Android and iOS)
Delivery Agent App (Android and iOS)
Routing Supervisor App (Android and iOS)
Content Management System
6 Month estimated duration with standard allocation of resources
$21,691 - Tablet Devices
$199 estimated cost per Tablet (cost variable depending on bulk rate and market at time of purchase)
One Tablet for all Routing Supervisors
One Tablet for each Restaurant (assuming they do not already have one)
Estimate based on Network launch in North Suburban Chicago with 107 participating Restaurants projected out of a pool of 238 takeout establishments
Projected count of Routing Supervisors is dependent on order volume, but we are planning to need 2 at launch and add more as participation increases
$1,232 - Thermal Delivery Bags
Approx $28 each (latest price for the preferred bag, down from $32 with the same vendor earlier in 2013)
20 x 20 Insulated Thermal Top-loading bag
 Estimate based on projected need for 44 Delivery Agents at time of launch in North Suburban Chicago
Following costs based upon projected launch with 107 Restaurants and 44 Delivery Agents$2,000 - AMP Plastic Bags to supply Restaurants for delivery orders (bulk rate)$635 - AMP Vehicle Magnets for Delivery Agents$600 - Brochures, Mailers, and Signage$320 - AMP Window Clings for Restaurants$300 - AMP T-Shirts for Delivery Agents$16,857 - Besides rounding our funding goal to an even 700k, this amount is included in the event we run into the (fortunate) problem of having more restaurants wanting to join the launch network than projected. chips.  The CMS is the most critical component to the operational success of the Network and is our top developmental priority.  If the funds raised are not sufficient to begin work on the CMS, then we will assess our financial leverage and determine what alternatives would be most beneficial to move us forward given the situation.    It is our desire to keep AMP a privately owned operation not subject to the governance of an array of outside investment entities.  Our Community Engagement Budget is a significant portion of the financial model and is not typical of a standard commercial organization as it takes away from the pool of money that would usually be absorbed by executives in the form of bonuses and pay raises.  We do not want to lose the ability to fund community projects story:
START ME UP

We’re launching the West Coast’s first ever all concert-poster gallery right in the heart of the art-entrenched Midtown District of Reno, Nevada.

This fist-in-the-air, turned-to-11, rock-n-roll gig-poster gallery will display authentic original flyers, posters and concert photography from worldwide bands, venues and concerts—all for sale year-round to the screaming public.

IMAGINE...

Just imagine all the people living in and visiting the Reno-Tahoe area attending an all ages, free-admission gallery to gawk at and purchase artful concert posters from local, regional, national, and worldwide-dominating bands and performers. This year-round outlet will live in the bustling and shopper-friendly Midtown Distric in Reno, Nevada—which is THE location for Rock City Posters. Every winter, thrill seekers flock to the Reno-Tahoe area to glide down snowy mountain faces unlike anywhere else on the planet. Every summer, visitors vacation here to hike, bike, swim, boat, game and play. While here, they round out their trips with shopping binges in the eclectic shops of the Midtown District. Introducing an eyeball-pleasing, interest-piquing gallery with hundreds of colorful, imaginative, iconic concert posters on display that will give shoppers another must-visit destination while vacationing in Reno-Tahoe. Also, let’s not forget the droves of art-hungry locals who live in Reno-Tahoe year-round. Residents of the area are among the most art-minded people up and down the west coast—and our research shows they will become front-row, standing- ovation supporters of Rock City Posters.

IT'S ONLY ROCK & ROLL (BUT WE LIKE IT)

Never before has our area seen a gallery like this—one that’s on par with Miles Davis-level coolness. We’re determined to create a sanctuary that’s appealing to posterheads, newbies, up-and-coming artists and those looking to relive their days of road-tripping hundreds of miles to see their vinyl heroes shred on the live stage.

HELP! I NEED SOMEBODY

In return for not only backing this electrifying new retail art experience with your hard earned money but your valuable word of mouth advertising and networking, I'm bringing on the rewards baby! I'm giving away Rock City Posters t-shirts, limited edition gig posters, art prints, concert tickets, I'm taking you and a friend to lunch, Aces baseball games (and we're not sitting in the grass either), one-on-one photoshop design lessons, I'm doing custom Christmas cards for your family, custom commissioned paintings and are you ready for this.....one lucky backer is going with a friend of theirs and me to Disneyland ! No joke. I'm picking up your two tickets and buying your food for the day. All you have to do is get there and find a place to stay. One full day of rides, shows and churros! Who wouldn't want that?

So let's talk turkey (not turkey legs, we'll do that at Disneyland). IF I am unable to raise the goal I've set on here, I can still keep what I've raised. This isn't an all or nothing campaign. The funds raised here go directly to buying posters and inventory to stock in the gallery for you. Even though they're affordable, it's still not cheap when you're buying hundreds of posters. It adds up. I've set the goal amount at $15,000 after figuring out how much it would take to fully stock this store at a level that everyone find a wide selection. The other part of this money goes to the licensing, and actual hard costs of setting up a business. After all said and done, thousands are spent on getting a business set up. It's not cheap and it's not easy. This is why I'm reaching out to you!

YOU REALLY GOT ME

The Midtown District in Reno is growing. It's already great with new shops opening, bars and nightlife, great new restaurants and so on. What I want to do with Rock City Posters is give the growing neighborhood a jolt of electricity. A boost. Bringing music based art as the subject of the retail shop, the gallery experience and on top of that regular special events, signings, meet & greets, parties. I want to bring something to the neighborhood. Something big that everyone will love. 

I've got a track record in Reno that proves I'm just the guy to do it. I continue to run a successful design studio that not only does gig posters for scores of big name bands, but I've done a large chunk of the logos for businesses in Midtown. I've been in one of the most popular bands since 1998. When we signed our record deal in 2004, we brought the label up to Reno to sign it with us in a Reno landmark, The Liberty Belle restaurant. We even recorded our first album for them in Reno. When we did that it made the newspapers, the evening news and beyond. I'll bring this same intensity and passion to Rock City Posters and making it not only a gallery and store but an experience. A place that EVERYONE will not only feel welcomed in, but will want to stay in. I'm not taking someone else's path with this, I'm creating a new one. Reno wants and needs new, and this is the chance to have it. Let's make this happen together.

MAKE SOME NOISE!

So you can’t contribute with money? That doesn’t mean I can’t use your help:

If you're dollar shy you can still help me and Rock City Posters out by telling everyone you know about this great place that's about to open in OUR CITY!!! Share the Indiegogo link or even www.rockcityposters.com link with your friends on Twitter, Facebook and Instagram. Do it daily. Talk about it at the bar. Maybe one of your friends has a couple extra bucks they'd be able to throw at the fundraising. You can single handedly bombard all the social media sites with this link and the video. Indiegogo has several share tools that make it easy.

And that’s all there is to it. Thank you for helping to make this great idea a reality. One person can't do it alone, that's why I ask you for help. This is our town, our music and art scene, and this gallery is built by us for us. Just like 7Seconds wrote it..."If we can walk together, why can't we rock together?"
