We’ll send you a wholehearted "thank you" email and you'll also receive a '5' brick added in your name to our digital model of the Open Clinic.
$10 You'll receive a '10' brick added in your name to our digital model of the Open Clinic. Plus, you'll receive a high-quality digital poster of the final rendering of Open Clinic as built by all of our backers' bricks. 
$25You'll receive a '25' brick added in your name to our digital model of the Open Clinic and also a high-quality digital poster of the final rendering of Open Clinic as built by all of our backers' bricks. Plus, we'll send you a unique, double-ended red pen and custom Open Clinic notebook, each page beautifully designed as a checklist to help you to transform your thoughts into action, one to-do at a time. 
 
$50You'll receive a '50' brick added in your name to our digital model of the Open Clinic and also a high-quality digital poster of the final rendering of Open Clinic as built by all of our backer’ bricks. Plus, we'll mail you a physical version of any one of the four transformative works that have inspired Open Clinic along the way, in hopes that it may inspire you as well:





Self Renewlal by John W. Gardner


The Once and Future King by T.H. White


Seven Samurai by Akira Kurosawa


Better by Atul Gawande, MD



$100With this gift, you'll help us to launch Open Clinic for all patients of the following major cardiovascular surgeries:



Coronary artery bypass grafting

Coronary stenting and angioplasty

Mitral valve repair/replacement

Aortic valve repair/replacement

Aortic aneurysm surgery

Atrial fibrillation surgery



We also want to publicly thank you on the Open Clinic website, where our entire community will find your name in a dedicated “Special Supporters” section for any one of the heart surgeries you may choose above.  You'll get a '100' brick that we'll add in your name to our digital model of the Open Clinic, and of course, feel free to pick any one of the gifts above.
$500 With this gift, you’ll help us to launch Spanish and Mandarin Chinese versions of Open Clinic for a global audience. We'll list your name on the Open Clinic website in a dedicated "Special Ambassadors" section and do a feature profile of you for our Spanish or Mandarin users. And yes, you'll get the biggest '500' brick added in your name to our digital model of the Open Clinic along with any one of the gifts above.
 

 
$1,000 (12 spots) With this gift, we’ll present you as the sole sponsor for an entire month of the Open Clinic for Heart Surgery. There are only 12 spots available for organizations interested in integrating your brand into our site in an elegant way. (Sorry, but we can’t accept any medical companies.)  
If you're an individual, we'll do a special profile of you for our entire cardiovascular community, publicly announce you as one of the “Founding Patrons” of the Open Clinic for Heart Surgery, and of course, feel free to pick any one of the gifts above.

 
WHO ARE WE, EXACTLY?
Kenneth Chu is the founder and Executive Director of Open Clinic. As a former ABC News producer of the Peabody Award-winning medical documentary series Hopkins, he is currently a producer for NBC News Digital.
Chad Ellimoottil, MD is the Deputy Director of Open Clinic. As a surgical resident at Loyola University Medical Center in Chicago, Illinois, his research interests include the cost-effectiveness of healthcare and the quality of patient education online.
Alexandra Lee is the Development Director of Open Clinic. She currently works in communications for the humanitarian organization Doctors Without Borders, and has previously managed fundraising campaigns for the arts.
John Doty, MD is the Medical Director of Open Clinic and a cardiovascular surgeon at Intermountain Medical Center in Salt Lake City, Utah. He did all of his training at Johns Hopkins Hospital. 
Torin Fitton, MD is a Founding Surgeon of Open Clinic and a cardiovascular surgeon at The Lahey Clinic in Burlington, Massachusetts. He did all of his training at Johns Hopkins Hospital. 
Richard Lee, MD is a Founding Surgeon of Open Clinic and a cardiovascular surgeon at St.Louis University Hospital in St. Louis, Missouri. He trained at Rush University, Washington University, and the Cleveland Clinic.
Leora Balsam, MD is a Founding Surgeon of Open Clinic and a cardiovascular surgeon at New York University Medical Center in New York City. She did all of her training at Stanford University.
Cullen Morris, MD is a Founding Surgeon of Open Clinic and a cardiovascular surgeon at The Emory Clinic in Athens, Georgia. He trained at Emory University and the Texas Heart Institute. 
Chris Malaisrie, MD is a Founding Surgeon of Open Clinic and a cardiovascular surgeon at Northwestern Memorial Hospital in Chicago, Illinois. He trained at Loyola University, Baylor College, and Stanford University. 
Fardad Esmailian, MD is a Founding Surgeon of Open Clinic and a cardiovascular surgeon at Cedars-Sinai Medical Institute in Los Angeles, California. He trained at UC-San Diego and UCLA. 
The current Open Clinic website was generously built by PJ Kelly and Joe Steele (software development); Lisa Maya (site design) and Michael Yuan (logo design); Tanya Northfield (medical transcriptions), Lucero Diaz (Spanish translations) and Sharon Chen (Mandarin Chinese translations).
 
WHAT HAVE WE ALREADY DONE?
We’ve launched the "Lite" version of Open Clinic to focus on coronary artery bypass grafting (CABG) – the most commonly performed heart surgery in America, affecting men and women equally. CABG patients who enter the Open Clinic website can currently:

Find every answer as a video of a surgeon giving a very clear explanation

Browse an organized, easy-to-navigate library of 23 surgeon video answers, totaling to over 30 minutes of personal education coming straight from multiple heart surgeons

Read text transcripts of all surgeon video answers

Discover new questions to ask, as submitted by other real patients

Submit your own question for an Open Clinic surgeon video answer

Watch a video animation that walks through each procedure step-by-step

Reference easy-to-understand medical definitions and diagrams

Experience iPad-friendly versions of all surgeon video answers

 
In addition, we’ve also achieved a lot as a non-profit organization:

Partnered with a public library in a low-income Chicago neighborhood

Received a 501(c)(3) tax-exempt status from the IRS

Engaged by Gibson, Dunn, & Crutcher for pro-bono corporate legal work

Engaged by Manatt, Phelps, & Phillips for pro-bono healthcare legal work

Translated all CABG patient questions and surgeon video answers into Spanish and Mandarin Chinese for their underserved communities



 
WHAT MAJOR IMPACT CAN WE MAKE? 
As our population ages and becomes more culturally diverse, imagine a day in the future when all patients about to undergo surgery can have the Open Clinic always by their side.
As medicine advances, imagine how many new patient questions there will be to ask, filter through, and truly understand. But also imagine new generations of young surgeons inspired to continue in their own way what the Founding Surgeons of Open Clinic have begun.
One specialty at a time…
One language at a time…

HOW ELSE CAN YOU HELP?
We’re actively seeking other individuals, organizations, and brands who would like to forge some very creative and impactful relationships. Let’s talk about how we can work together and really improve publishing of health information online: alexandra.lee@openclinic.com
Also, feel free to check out our special updates and content on Twitter, Facebook, or our Open Clinic Notes newsletter.
And without a doubt, we understand that people's attention is hard to come by, so even if you can share this with someone who might be interested in what we're up to, then we'd truly appreciate it.

story:
Short Summary

The Compassion in Action Center is a family run, Christian ministry with the goal of providing food; clothing; household items such as toiletries, kitchenware, personal hygene products, etc; toys, and other donated items to those who are unable to afford them. We also provide community support and individual support for those who are looking for a sense of belonging and people they can lean on. Compassion in Action helps over 100 families and individuals every month.

Compassion in Action is run completely on donations and has absolutely no paid employees, which means every cent you contribute goes directly to the center!

At the beginning of the year, several of our biggest contributers decided they were no longer financially able to support the center as they had been. Since then our doors have closed due to a lack of utilities. But that's okay, because we have a plan! Here's how you can help:

Your contribution will help us to install wind turbines and solar panels, which will help us lower our electric bill by up to 70%! We will also be able to replace drafty windows with newer and more energy efficient ones which will lower our heating and cooling costs by an additional 20 - 25%! On top of all of this, you will help us get current with our bills so we can open our doors to the people who depend on us to help their families every month.

If we don't reach our goal, the contributions made will go toward paying off bills and getting as much updating done as possible.

Miracles happen around us all the time, most of them going unnoticed. You can help us make our dream a reality, and what could be more miraculous than that?

Read about a miracle of Compassion!

The Impact

Every day we have kids come in on their way home from school asking if we have any bread that day, or to play in our community play room.

Every day parents come in looking for winter coats or the next size in clothing for their children.

Every day teenagers stop by, looking for clothes to interview in or for advice on how to handle tough situations. Some of them are looking for ways to help their parents, some are living on their own, trying to make their way in the world. 

Every day people come in looking for someone to connect with, seeking solace and prayer, or looking for a safe and non-judgemental environment where problems can be sorted out.

Every day we help someone. Every day we show the compassion and love for our fellow man as Christ taught us to do. Every day at CIAC makes a difference to someone.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Sending money isn't the only way to help!

  • Tell your friends and family about our campaign and what we're doing!
  • Send your thoughts and prayers for us and those we help!
  • Don't forget to put you compassion into action every day!

story:
Buddy's Australian Rescue Rehabilitation Retirement K9 

                                            Psychology Centre 

 

Get on board so we can obtain our goal, and one lucky supporter can win $5000......                  

                                 

The $5000 has been donated by a generous supporter who will give this amount to our winning referrer, as well as making a contribution of the same amount to our campaign, but only if it is fully funded. Our benefactor will also give a further cash amount to the 2nd, 3rd, 4th & 5th highest referrers, if our campaign is over funded.

What is bARRRk?

A sanctuary for dogs and a place to help people reconnect with the world. The Rehabilitation part of the sanctuary will house several separate training facilities, including a psychiatric service dog training area where dogs will be trained to help people suffering from psychiatric conditions.

                                                 

It will also include a rehabilitation area for rescue dogs who are the ones at risk of euthanasia because they suffer from behavioural issues which prevent them from being rehomed elsewhere. 

As well as a third training area where low income dog owners can access valued education, training and information.

And last but not least, we will have areas set up around the facilities where we will be conducting Canine Crime Scene Investigation Weekends (CCSI). Where you can train your dog to be a super sleuth at bARRRk's exciting Murder Mystery Canine Crime Scene Investigation Weekends.

There will also be a retirement area at the sanctuary for elderly dogs or those who cannot be fully rehabilitated.

bARRRk won't be just like every other K9 facility out there as your contributions will help us to create an safe environment where we can rehabilitate, educate and provide a forever home when required.

The dogs that come to bARRRk will have access to a hydro pool, a water splash zone, and indoor climate controlled kennels and runs. This sanctuary will be unlike any dog centre you've ever seen before, with a huge indoor dog park and activities such as agility, fly-ball and even doggie painting.

The entire bARRRk facility will be dedicated to maintaining the mental and physical health of the dogs that come through our doors. 

                                       

PLEASE READ TO THE BOTTOM OF OUR PAGE, TO DISCOVER SPECIAL PERKS WE ARE OFFERING TO OUR SUPPORTERS (INCLUDING OUR REFERRAL CONTEST: THESE ARE NOT LISTED ELSEWHERE!

My commitment to you, the Supporter and the Dogs

I D.J. Silva, K9 behaviourist needs your help to benefit bARRRk, I need the funds to help provide a sanctuary for the dogs that I rehabilitate.

At bARRRk I will establish a psychiatric service dog training facility. This cause is very important to me as my sister suffers from PTSD and I want to provide her and other mental health sufferers a place of sanctuary, where they can work with a service dog and gain the confidence to re-engage with the community. My aim is to train dogs to work as psychiatric service dogs to help people with mental health issues.

This is an area that is seriously lacking in Australia, so I aim to train rescue dogs to become service dogs for people with mental health issues. This will offer rescue dogs a second chance in life and also provide benefits to the community, and the person whom the dog is assigned to.

Any dogs that do not have the temperament to train as a service dog will be offered for adoption, once they have been fully trained and assessed as adoptable. Training will focus on rehabilitating dogs that have been in the hands of inexperienced owners and in need of someone to change their bad habits.

      

Any dogs that do not qualify for adoption, due to whatever reason will then become a part of the family at our retirement sanctuary, and any dogs that are displaced due to their elderly owners passing away will be giving high priority to live out their years at our retirement facilities, where they can receive medical care and live in a loving and caring environment. Siberian Huskies at risk of euthanasia will also be high priority to give them a forever home, due to my extensive experience with this breed.

I am asking for financial donations from whoever is capable and willing to assist with making this dream a reality and will keep those who donate updated on the progress of the sanctuary as it becomes a reality. 

I am running this crowd funding campaign to fund the cost of buying a property near Perth Western Australia and making it our training centre.

DJ SILVA

Goals for Crowd Funding

We're asking for a minimum of 500,000(AUD) which will guarantee a successful start to the bARRRk psychology centre and the full production of a feature-length documentary. This covers the purchase of a property to develop and over 12 months of full-time production. Everything other than the purchase of the property, such as building materials, etc, will be sourced for free, with the ultimate goal being a home entirely re-built/ renovated without spending a single cent on the project. 

                                      

Additional funds will be committed to making the sanctuary even better. All other resources will come from breaking the NILIF fallacy. If this works it will help break the NILIF fallacy and allow others to follow the same pathway and know that huge things can be done with a little bit of ingenuity. (more information on the NILIF fallacy is provided further down this page).

Our Personal Goals

Our goal is to provide a unique and enriching environment for dogs at risk of euthanasia; to establish a training facility for people who normally cannot afford training; and to train dogs to work as Psychiatric service dogs.

Our lives changed forever when the movie "Antarctica" introduced Siberian Huskies to the world. We learned a lot about the capabilities and inner strength of dogs and have since dedicated our lives to making life better for dogs everywhere, and educating others about how amazing any dog can be giving the right opportunity in life.

                                       

We plan to use our online social media platforms to spread awareness about the need for a rehabilitation/retirement facility, driving donations to our crowd funding campaign to fund the purchase and start up of the dog sanctuary. These donations will be supplemented by further fund raising in the form of the sale of products, such as, dog art once the facility is in operation. This 'dog art' will be paintings that are actually painted by the dogs themselves during therapy sessions where dogs learn to be calm and focused.

The ultimate goal is to have a self-funded facility which can help as many dogs as possible. We will also film a documentary in the process of setting up the 'bARRRk' sanctuary.

Short-term Objectives:

Immediately upon receiving the amount of funds we need we will begin filming the bARRRk dogumentary while we purchase the property out of the several properties we will have short listed. We will begin any repairs and building that is needed to make this the perfect dog sanctuary. Fencing and housing will be given high priority as safety for the animals who come to the sanctuary is of utmost importance. 

Large dog runs will be made ready and divided into sections for use by different sized and temperament dogs. A training area will also be constructed with indoor and outdoor training area. The indoor training area will incorporate the 'dog art studio' where dogs will create their own masterpieces to be offered for sale. Part of the indoor facility will also be dedicated to service dog training, to train suitable rescue dogs to become psychiatric service dogs. A kitchen facility and cool room will be established as we plan to produce our own dog food which will be the staple for the resident dogs.

                                       

Walking trails will be marked out and established for nature pack walks, and a dog water splash zone and pool will be added to the facility. Trees will also be planted for added shade in the summer and an orchard which will produce fruit that could act as a future revenue source by allowing the making and selling of baked goods.

A parking area will be designated and marked out on suitable ground so that visitors will have adequate access to our training centre. We will also establish and on-site laundry and pet wash area, so that our facility has all things necessary for the canine residents.

Long-term Objectives:

Following the completion of the renovations and filming of the dogumentary, we will have a premiere of the dogumentary on site and launch it on DVD and You Tube. We will open the training facility to the public so that low income dog owners have access to quality dog training. We will also continue to rescue dogs in need and continue updating our efforts on social media. 

We will endeavour to begin running bARRRk with the help of volunteers, and the prospect of offering paid employment to staff in the future. We also hope to offer people the opportunity to learn to become trainers in the future, and also to learn to train service dogs.

                                              

Education and Training

Our primary focus is education and training. We will provide an opportunity for dogs to be rehabilitated and saved from euthanasia. We will rescue dogs to train them as Psychiatric Service dogs to work with people suffering from mental conditions, such as post traumatic stress disorder, and agoraphobia. We will also provide education to low income owners who attend our training sessions, which will run on a gold-coin donation basis for people who hold a health care, seniors or pension card. Our other products include 'dog art' , and in future bARRRk merchandise to be sold online.

Competitive Advantage: Our competitive advantage is our solid background in animal behaviour and also our experience in renovating. We are not afraid of hard work and will always complete tasks that we begin. We will devote all our time and resources to making bARRRk a success and a sanctuary for dogs.

                                      

We are seeking a property in a location along one of the main highways/freeways running from Perth. we will try to remain within a distance that is accessible to the Airport making it possible for us to work with not only dogs within Western Australia, but also dogs from other states, when required. We will develop associations with other dog groups from around Australia in order to help as many dogs as we can.

The Sanctuary

Training Access:

Many people cannot afford to go to dog training due to having a low incomes and that leads to many dogs and owners not having the opportunity to enjoy their relationship to the fullest. It is therefore important that there are facilities available to cater for this large group of dog owners so that they can have access to quality training at a low cost, such as a gold coin donation, which we intend to offer. To think about how many untrained dogs end up tied up in the backyard, never to experience all that the world has to offer is one of the reason this is important, as those dogs are missing out on the best quality of life and that needs to change.          

                                        

Psychiatric Service Dog Training:Psychiatric service dog (PSD) training involves training dogs to assist poeple with psychiatric conditions such as post traumatic stress disorder, agoraphobia, etc, to be able to participate in and access the community. PSD training is an area that needs to grow in Australia because there are not many places which offer this type of training. We hope to help this area expand and work together with existing organisations both here in Australia, and overseas to make it easier for Australians to have access to well-trained dogs.

Canine Crime Scene Investigation (CCSI):

We will run CCSI courses where you get to train your dog to be a super sleuth and solve a heinous crime on one of bARRRk's exciting Canine Crime Scene Investigation Weekends.

Participants will work in small teams of handlers and dogs, attempting to solve a fun murder mystery. Canine detectives will acquire skills in retrieving, advanced control exercises, scent detection and tracking. They may be looking for explosives, lost articles, or other clues to help their handlers solve the case.

CCSI will not be a boring lecture series. It is a hands on adventure with your dog. You will use your powers of observation and your problem solving skills to sniff out clues that will sort out the crime. Expect the unexpected! One of your team mates may accidentally get padlocked to a chair...and only your dog will be able to find the key to set them free! Your dog may have to lead you blindfolded through a maze, to retrieve a clue from an area covered with distractions. But beware, someone could be lurking in the shadows... Will you solve the crime, or be the next victim?

CCSI will not take place at a real crime scene. Real weapons, accelerants, explosives and drugs will NOT be used. This will be a fun weekend.

The documentary in two parts:

Our intension is to make two documentaries, one focus on the renovations and setting up of the sanctuary and one focused on the running of the sanctuary and the way our training facilities work.

                                          

The Making of bARRRk the dogumentary:

It's a movie!!! The making of a dog sanctuary is a feature-length dogumentary starring D.J Silva and Trax.

This Dogumentary will show the setting up of a dog sanctuary from the very beginning, when the property is purchased, to the renovation and building of facilities and everything that goes into getting a dog sanctuary up and running. We want to tell the  story of how a dog rehabilitation/retirement sanctuary can be brought into fruition and a dream of an amazing place for dogs  can come true by breaking the NILIF fallacy!

What is Breaking the NILIF Fallacy?

This documentary aims to break the fallacy that 'nothing in life is free' by taking this idea to the very extreme of purchasing a  derelict property and turning it into an amazing place that any dog would be proud to call home. It will begin when the property  is purchased using funds donated to the campaign, then follow the renovations and re-building of the home and facilities as we  source all material for free from various places, and also endeavour to secure the help of trades' people for free when needed. 

We want to show that it is possible to do anything that you want without spending a cent.  This concept is not new as people  frequently acquire different things for free, by use of barter system, or from advertisements placed in papers, or on websites.   We just want to set out to see if this system can be taken as far as possible to deliver something amazing in the end: A beautiful  Dog Sanctuary.

                                                                                                 

Opportunities & Challenges

The combination of psychiatric service dog training, low income training, dog retirement facility and a diverse environment at the sanctuary, is how we will set ourselves apart when compared to other rescues. We plan to create a place where people and dogs feel safe and secure, a place where we can educate and connect with the public and other canine professionals. We also plan to sell dog art and other product; all aimed to help make the sanctuary financially sustainable even if  the kind donations were to stop tomorrow. This will allow us to run without the financial restraints faced by many other rescues and to precede with our expansion plans further increasing the security of our sanctuary for years to come. 

                                

There are other organisations that offer some type of training for sufferers of conditions such as autism, PTSD, and anxiety related issues, however these are not their primary focus. all of the organisations in Australia are also mainly located on the east coast of Australia, which is why a facility is needed on the west coast to make training more accessible to people in Western Australia.

The area (Western Australia) that we have decided to base our sanctuary provides an exceptional opportunity for us to take advantage of a missing and much needed service dog sector in the west. There are no comparable facilities that offer service dog training, as well as elderly dog retirement facilities. We are in a prime position to fill a gap in the Australian service dog sector, meaning we will be a unique facility not only in the west, but also in the whole of Australia.

                   

Supporters

Training Supporters

We will attract our supporters with extensive online marketing through our social media platforms, and by contacting numerous businesses and .contacts via email. We will offer various perks to our supporters so that they not only get to help bARRRk but they also feel appreciated. Access to the sanctuary will also be made available to our Australian supporters and to overseas supporters by our website, special events, and videos. We will try to make our supporters feel as much a part of the journey as we can. The bARRRk facility will be like no other, all aimed at showing that animals have incredible qualities which allow them to change our lives as well as their own.  

It is going to be a paradise that dogs never want to leave.

                                 

Operations

The Team:

We, D.J and Trax, will be the primary people behind daily operations of bARRRk. We will have volunteer staff of kennel attendants and trainee dog behaviourist, like Kayla Maree, Daniel Dylan and Cathy Lee, who are already part of our team. As time goes on, our team will expand accordingly. We will have a veterinarian on hand.

Please donate if you can and be sure to share of campaign with your friends, family and associates so that we can make bARRRk a success story. Our pack thanks you in advance. (Below is are special perks including one exclusive for Western Australian Residents).

                                    

Special Perks

Future store/course discounts;

Every person who donates to our sanctuary campaign will be eligible to receive discounts off any products we sell in our future online store, as well as discounts on any courses we run at the sanctuary: such as the CCSI weekends.

Referral Contests:

Promotional Pack Referral Reward;

Refer as many friends as you can to our campaign, and when their contributions total at least $1000 (and our campaign receives it's full funding amount), you will receive a bARRRk promotional pack; which will include a tote bag filled with goodies, such as a lanyard, keyring, t-shirt, etc...

$5000 Referral Reward;

The supporter whose referrals bring the highest amount of overall contributions to our campaign by the campaign end date  (and our campaign receives it's full funding amount), will win $5000 AUD, So get referring via social media and ask your friends, family, colleagues to contribute  and support our campaign. So get bARRRKing!

Please Note: In order for your referrals to count in this contest you must sign up or into your indiegogo account, donate at least $1 and then promote our campaign using the share tools (facebook, twitter, etc) while logged into your account: This is very important as your referral has a unique ID which helps to track when your friends etc, contribute by clicking your referral link. Follow the rules below.

Referral Contest Rules:

  1. Sign Up/Login to indiegogo
  2. Donate $1 or more to bARRRk
  3. While logged into your indiegogo account use the facebook, twitter share tools at the top of this page, to share our campaign with your friends, family, etc...
  4. Get your friends to click your shared link and donate to bARRRk.
  5. Your referral will automatically be registered for the contest.
  6. The more people who contribute by clicking your link, the better your chance to win.
  7. If we are fully funded and you have the highest amount of people contribute via your referrals you win the $5000. Simple!

Special Draw for any donation of $1 or more from a Western Australian resident to go to the premiere of "bARRRk: The dogumentary";

Every Western Australian resident who donates $1 or more to our sanctuary campaign will receive one ticket for every dollar donated into a special draw where they can win 1 of 20 passes to attend an exclusive special screening/premiere of the dogumentary to be held at the sanctuary on a date and location to still be determined. This day will include some special extras and surprises, such as, a tour of the dog sanctuary facilities, a bbq lunch for all who attend, possible door prizes, training demonstrations and many other goodies. (You must be a resident of Western Australia to be eligible for this perk, and you must supply an email address to be contacted should your name be drawn out; Even if you donate more and select another perk you are still entered into the draw for every dollar amount - you just need to let us know you are a WA resident and give us an email address and we'll enter you in the draw).

Please Note: This special day will only include attendance to the sanctuary - it does not include any other expenses, such as travel or accommodation costs. This event and all other perks mentioned above or within our perk section, beside our thank you messages, will only occur if we receive our full funding and once the documentary is completed.
story_txt:
Buddy's Australian Rescue Rehabilitation Retirement K9 
                                            Psychology Centre  Get on board so we can obtain our goal, and one lucky supporter can win $5000......                  
                                 
The $5000 has been donated by a generous supporter who will give this amount to our winning referrer, as well as making a contribution of the same amount to our campaign, but only if it is fully funded. Our benefactor will also give a further cash amount to the 2nd, 3rd, 4th & 5th highest referrers, if our campaign is over funded.
What is bARRRk?
A sanctuary for dogs and a place to help people reconnect with the world. The Rehabilitation part of the sanctuary will house several separate training facilities, including a psychiatric service dog training area where dogs will be trained to help people suffering from psychiatric conditions.
                                                 
It will also include a rehabilitation area for rescue dogs who are the ones at risk of euthanasia because they suffer from behavioural issues which prevent them from being rehomed elsewhere. 
As well as a third training area where low income dog owners can access valued education, training and information.
And last but not least, we will have areas set up around the facilities where we will be conducting Canine Crime Scene Investigation Weekends (CCSI). Where you can train your dog to be a super sleuth at bARRRk's exciting Murder Mystery Canine Crime Scene Investigation Weekends.
There will also be a retirement area at the sanctuary for elderly dogs or those who cannot be fully rehabilitated.
bARRRk won't be just like every other K9 facility out there as your contributions will help us to create an safe environment where we can rehabilitate, educate and provide a forever home when required.
The dogs that come to bARRRk will have access to a hydro pool, a water splash zone, and indoor climate controlled kennels and runs. This sanctuary will be unlike any dog centre you've ever seen before, with a huge indoor dog park and activities such as agility, fly-ball and even doggie painting.
The entire bARRRk facility will be dedicated to maintaining the mental and physical health of the dogs that come through our doors. 
                                        
PLEASE READ TO THE BOTTOM OF OUR PAGE, TO DISCOVER SPECIAL PERKS WE ARE OFFERING TO OUR SUPPORTERS (INCLUDING OUR REFERRAL CONTEST: THESE ARE NOT LISTED ELSEWHERE!

My commitment to you, the Supporter and the Dogs
I D.J. Silva, K9 behaviourist needs your help to benefit bARRRk, I need the funds to help provide a sanctuary for the dogs that I rehabilitate.
At bARRRk I will establish a psychiatric service dog training facility. This cause is very important to me as my sister suffers from PTSD and I want to provide her and other mental health sufferers a place of sanctuary, where they can work with a service dog and gain the confidence to re-engage with the community. My aim is to train dogs to work as psychiatric service dogs to help people with mental health issues.
This is an area that is seriously lacking in Australia, so I aim to train rescue dogs to become service dogs for people with mental health issues. This will offer rescue dogs a second chance in life and also provide benefits to the community, and the person whom the dog is assigned to.
Any dogs that do not have the temperament to train as a service dog will be offered for adoption, once they have been fully trained and assessed as adoptable. Training will focus on rehabilitating dogs that have been in the hands of inexperienced owners and in need of someone to change their bad habits.
      
Any dogs that do not qualify for adoption, due to whatever reason will then become a part of the family at our retirement sanctuary, and any dogs that are displaced due to their elderly owners passing away will be giving high priority to live out their years at our retirement facilities, where they can receive medical care and live in a loving and caring environment. Siberian Huskies at risk of euthanasia will also be high priority to give them a forever home, due to my extensive experience with this breed.
I am asking for financial donations from whoever is capable and willing to assist with making this dream a reality and will keep those who donate updated on the progress of the sanctuary as it becomes a reality. 
I am running this crowd funding campaign to fund the cost of buying a property near Perth Western Australia and making it our training centre.
DJ SILVA
Goals for Crowd Funding
We're asking for a minimum of 500,000(AUD) which will guarantee a successful start to the bARRRk psychology centre and the full production of a feature-length documentary. This covers the purchase of a property to develop and over 12 months of full-time production. Everything other than the purchase of the property, such as building materials, etc, will be sourced for free, with the ultimate goal being a home entirely re-built/ renovated without spending a single cent on the project. 
                                      
Additional funds will be committed to making the sanctuary even better. All other resources will come from breaking the NILIF fallacy. If this works it will help break the NILIF fallacy and allow others to follow the same pathway and know that huge things can be done with a little bit of ingenuity. (more information on the NILIF fallacy is provided further down this page).

Our Personal Goals
Our goal is to provide a unique and enriching environment for dogs at risk of euthanasia; to establish a training facility for people who normally cannot afford training; and to train dogs to work as Psychiatric service dogs.
Our lives changed forever when the movie "Antarctica" introduced Siberian Huskies to the world. We learned a lot about the capabilities and inner strength of dogs and have since dedicated our lives to making life better for dogs everywhere, and educating others about how amazing any dog can be giving the right opportunity in life.
                                        
We plan to use our online social media platforms to spread awareness about the need for a rehabilitation/retirement facility, driving donations to our crowd funding campaign to fund the purchase and start up of the dog sanctuary. These donations will be supplemented by further fund raising in the form of the sale of products, such as, dog art once the facility is in operation. This 'dog art' will be paintings that are actually painted by the dogs themselves during therapy sessions where dogs learn to be calm and focused.
The ultimate goal is to have a self-funded facility which can help as many dogs as possible. We will also film a documentary in the process of setting up the 'bARRRk' sanctuary.
Short-term Objectives:
Immediately upon receiving the amount of funds we need we will begin filming the bARRRk dogumentary while we purchase the property out of the several properties we will have short listed. We will begin any repairs and building that is needed to make this the perfect dog sanctuary. Fencing and housing will be given high priority as safety for the animals who come to the sanctuary is of utmost importance. 
Large dog runs will be made ready and divided into sections for use by different sized and temperament dogs. A training area will also be constructed with indoor and outdoor training area. The indoor training area will incorporate the 'dog art studio' where dogs will create their own masterpieces to be offered for sale. Part of the indoor facility will also be dedicated to service dog training, to train suitable rescue dogs to become psychiatric service dogs. A kitchen facility and cool room will be established as we plan to produce our own dog food which will be the staple for the resident dogs.
                                       
Walking trails will be marked out and established for nature pack walks, and a dog water splash zone and pool will be added to the facility. Trees will also be planted for added shade in the summer and an orchard which will produce fruit that could act as a future revenue source by allowing the making and selling of baked goods.
A parking area will be designated and marked out on suitable ground so that visitors will have adequate access to our training centre. We will also establish and on-site laundry and pet wash area, so that our facility has all things necessary for the canine residents.
Long-term Objectives:
Following the completion of the renovations and filming of the dogumentary, we will have a premiere of the dogumentary on site and launch it on DVD and You Tube. We will open the training facility to the public so that low income dog owners have access to quality dog training. We will also continue to rescue dogs in need and continue updating our efforts on social media. 
We will endeavour to begin running bARRRk with the help of volunteers, and the prospect of offering paid employment to staff in the future. We also hope to offer people the opportunity to learn to become trainers in the future, and also to learn to train service dogs.
                                              

Education and TrainingOur primary focus is education and training. We will provide an opportunity for dogs to be rehabilitated and saved from euthanasia. We will rescue dogs to train them as Psychiatric Service dogs to work with people suffering from mental conditions, such as post traumatic stress disorder, and agoraphobia. We will also provide education to low income owners who attend our training sessions, which will run on a gold-coin donation basis for people who hold a health care, seniors or pension card. Our other products include 'dog art' , and in future bARRRk merchandise to be sold online.Competitive Advantage: Our
competitive advantage is our solid background in animal behaviour and also our
experience in renovating. We are not afraid of hard work and will always
complete tasks that we begin. We will devote all our time and resources to making
bARRRk a success and a sanctuary for dogs.                                      We are seeking a property in a location
along one of the main highways/freeways running from Perth. we will try to
remain within a distance that is accessible to the Airport making it possible
for us to work with not only dogs within Western Australia, but also dogs from
other states, when required. We will develop associations with other dog groups
from around Australia in order to help as many dogs as we can.
The Sanctuary
Training Access:
Many people
cannot afford to go to dog training due to having a low incomes and that leads
to many dogs and owners not having the opportunity to enjoy their relationship
to the fullest. It is therefore important that there are facilities available
to cater for this large group of dog owners so that they can have access to
quality training at a low cost, such as a gold coin donation, which we intend
to offer. To think about how many untrained dogs end up tied up in the
backyard, never to experience all that the world has to offer is one of the
reason this is important, as those dogs are missing out on the best quality of
life and that needs to change.                                                  
Psychiatric Service Dog Training:Psychiatric service
dog (PSD) training involves training dogs to assist poeple with psychiatric
conditions such as post traumatic stress disorder, agoraphobia, etc, to be able
to participate in and access the community. PSD training is an area that needs
to grow in Australia because there are not many places which offer this type of
training. We hope to help this area expand and work together with existing
organisations both here in Australia, and overseas to make it easier for
Australians to have access to well-trained dogs.
Canine
Crime Scene Investigation (CCSI):
We
will run CCSI courses where you get to train your dog to be a super sleuth and
solve a heinous crime on one of bARRRk's exciting Canine Crime Scene
Investigation Weekends.
Participants
will work in small teams of handlers and dogs, attempting to solve a fun murder
mystery. Canine detectives will acquire skills in retrieving, advanced control
exercises, scent detection and tracking. They may be looking for explosives,
lost articles, or other clues to help their handlers solve the case.
CCSI
will not be a boring lecture series. It is a hands on adventure with your dog.
You will use your powers of observation and your problem solving skills to
sniff out clues that will sort out the crime. Expect the unexpected! One of
your team mates may accidentally get padlocked to a chair...and only your dog
will be able to find the key to set them free! Your dog may have to lead you
blindfolded through a maze, to retrieve a clue from an area covered with
distractions. But beware, someone could be lurking in the shadows... Will you
solve the crime, or be the next victim?
CCSI
will not take place at a real crime scene. Real weapons, accelerants,
explosives and drugs will NOT be used. This will be a fun weekend.



The
documentary in two parts:
Our
intension is to make two documentaries, one focus on the renovations and
setting up of the sanctuary and one focused on the running of the sanctuary and
the way our training facilities work.
                                          The
Making of bARRRk the dogumentary:
It's
a movie!!! The making of a dog sanctuary is a feature-length dogumentary
starring D.J Silva and Trax.
This
Dogumentary will show the setting up of a dog sanctuary from the very
beginning, when the property is purchased, to the renovation and building of
facilities and everything that goes into getting a dog sanctuary up and
running. We want to tell the  story of how a dog
rehabilitation/retirement sanctuary can be brought into fruition and a dream of
an amazing place for dogs  can come true by breaking the NILIF fallacy!
What
is Breaking the NILIF Fallacy?
This
documentary aims to break the fallacy that 'nothing in life is free' by taking
this idea to the very extreme of purchasing a  derelict property and
turning it into an amazing place that any dog would be proud to call home. It
will begin when the property  is purchased using funds donated to the
campaign, then follow the renovations and re-building of the home and
facilities as we  source all material for free from various places, and
also endeavour to secure the help of trades' people for free when needed. 
We
want to show that it is possible to do anything that you want without spending
a cent.  This concept is not new as people  frequently acquire
different things for free, by use of barter system, or from advertisements
placed in papers, or on websites.   We just want to set out to see if this
system can be taken as far as possible to deliver something amazing in the end:
A beautiful  Dog Sanctuary.
                                                                                                 
Opportunities & Challenges
The
combination of psychiatric service dog training, low income training, dog
retirement facility and a diverse environment at the sanctuary, is how we will
set ourselves apart when compared to other rescues. We plan to create a place
where people and dogs feel safe and secure, a place where we can educate and
connect with the public and other canine professionals. We also plan to sell
dog art and other product; all aimed to help make the sanctuary financially
sustainable even if  the kind donations were to stop tomorrow. This will
allow us to run without the financial restraints faced by many other rescues
and to precede with our expansion plans further increasing the security of our
sanctuary for years to come. 
                                There
are other organisations that offer some type of training for sufferers of
conditions such as autism, PTSD, and anxiety related issues, however these are
not their primary focus. all of the organisations in Australia are also mainly
located on the east coast of Australia, which is why a facility is needed on
the west coast to make training more accessible to people in Western Australia.
The
area (Western Australia) that we have decided to base our sanctuary provides an
exceptional opportunity for us to take advantage of a missing and much needed
service dog sector in the west. There are no comparable facilities that offer
service dog training, as well as elderly dog retirement facilities. We are in a
prime position to fill a gap in the Australian service dog sector, meaning we
will be a unique facility not only in the west, but also in the whole of
Australia.
                   Supporters
Training
Supporters
We
will attract our supporters with extensive online marketing through our social
media platforms, and by contacting numerous businesses and .contacts via email.
We will offer various perks to our supporters so that they not only get to help
bARRRk but they also feel appreciated. Access to the sanctuary will also be
made available to our Australian supporters and to overseas supporters by our
website, special events, and videos. We will try to make our supporters feel as
much a part of the journey as we can. The bARRRk facility will be like no
other, all aimed at showing that animals have incredible qualities which allow
them to change our lives as well as their own.  
It
is going to be a paradise that dogs never want to leave.
                                 Operations
The
Team:
We,
D.J and Trax, will be the primary people behind daily operations of bARRRk. We
will have volunteer staff of kennel attendants and trainee dog behaviourist,
like Kayla Maree, Daniel Dylan and Cathy Lee, who are already part of our team.
As time goes on, our team will expand accordingly. We will have a veterinarian
on hand.
Please
donate if you can and be sure to share of campaign with your friends, family
and associates so that we can make bARRRk a success story. Our pack thanks you
in advance. (Below is are special perks including one exclusive for Western
Australian Residents).
                                    Special
Perks
Future store/course discounts;
Every person who donates to our sanctuary
campaign will be eligible to receive discounts off any products we sell in our
future online store, as well as discounts on any courses we run at the
sanctuary: such as the CCSI weekends.
Referral Contests:
Promotional Pack Referral Reward;
Refer
as many friends as you can to our campaign, and when their contributions total
at least $1000 (and our campaign receives it's full funding amount), you will
receive a bARRRk promotional pack; which will include a tote bag filled with
goodies, such as a lanyard, keyring, t-shirt, etc...
$5000 Referral Reward;
The
supporter whose referrals bring the highest amount of overall contributions to
our campaign by the campaign end date  (and our campaign receives it's
full funding amount), will win $5000 AUD, So get referring via social media and
ask your friends, family, colleagues to contribute  and support our
campaign. So get bARRRKing!
Please Note: In
order for your referrals to count in this contest you must sign up or into your
indiegogo account, donate at least $1 and then promote our campaign using the
share tools (facebook, twitter, etc) while logged into your account: This is
very important as your referral has a unique ID which helps to track when your
friends etc, contribute by clicking your referral link. Follow the rules below.
Referral Contest Rules:

Sign Up/Login to indiegogo
Donate $1 or more to bARRRk
While logged into your
     indiegogo account use the facebook, twitter share tools at the top of this
     page, to share our campaign with your friends, family, etc...
Get your friends to click
     your shared link and donate to bARRRk.
Your referral will
     automatically be registered for the contest.
The more people who
     contribute by clicking your link, the better your chance to win.
If we are fully funded and
     you have the highest amount of people contribute via your referrals you
     win the $5000. Simple!

Special
Draw for any donation of $1 or more from a Western Australian resident to go to
the premiere of "bARRRk: The dogumentary";
Every Western Australian resident who donates
$1 or more to our sanctuary campaign will receive one ticket for every dollar
donated into a special draw where they can win 1 of 20 passes to attend an
exclusive special screening/premiere of the dogumentary to be held at the
sanctuary on a date and location to still be determined. This day will include
some special extras and surprises, such as, a tour of the dog sanctuary
facilities, a bbq lunch for all who attend, possible door prizes, training
demonstrations and many other goodies. (You must be a resident of Western
Australia to be eligible for this perk, and you must supply an email address to
be contacted should your name be drawn out; Even if you donate more and select
another perk you are still entered into the draw for every dollar amount - you
just need to let us know you are a WA resident and give us an email address and
we'll enter you in the draw).
Please
Note: This special day will only include
attendance to the sanctuary - it does not include any other expenses, such as
travel or accommodation costs. This event and all other perks mentioned above
or within our perk section, beside our thank you messages, will only occur if
we receive our full funding and once the documentary is completed.

story:
Topock66 is a Historic Outpost located on the Colorado River and Route 66 at the Western edge of Arizona. From The Grapes of Wrath to Easy Rider, our little town has been synonymous with Route 66 and the Colorado River for over fifty years.

Chet Hitt purchased the old Topock Marina more than ten years ago when his vacation home was threatened by developers. From the beginning, he had big plans for the place which included a beautiful hotel and restaurant / bar. He tore the old ramshackle building down a couple of years ago and immediately ran into red tape and permitting issues with the Federal Government. He was only able to begin construction of the project if he put the Hotel portion on hold while we re-engineered the property. The NEW Topock66 Restaurant / Bar / Entertainment Complex was opened just over a year ago, and we are now ready to proceed on the rest of the project.

By reinvesting profits from the first phase, we have increased our equity and decreased the amount that our bank needs to fund the project from six million to one million dollars. This is where we need your help.

We thought about bringing in more investors, but when Chet came across this “Crowdfunding” thing, he got really excited. What better way to raise the funds than to give our customers the opportunity to get a real value and some cool perks for helping us with their contributions?

We are breaking our one million dollar ($1,000,000) goal down into three campaigns to make our goals more attainable, as well as to provide for more participation from our guests and friends.

This first Campaign's goal is to raise two hundred thousand dollars ($200,000) which will pay for plans, permits and fees and get us closer to the amount the bank needs to fund the rest of the project.

We have a super cool place that is the perfect vacation spot for families or groups of friends. We would like to offer you a terrific deal on rooms in the New Hotel in exchange for your contribution (Hotel estimated completion date/grand opening is 2016).

On this page, you see offers for single room nights that can be combined to create a nice little vacation. We also have some super packages for those among you who want to bring a group out and party in our fabulous bars and pool! Many of our regular customers have expressed an interest in being a part of our new VIP Founders Club, and that opportunity is available as well. 

Founders Club Membership begins January 1, 2015 and expires One Year after Opening of Hotel.

  • RiverClub Membership for One
  • Founders Club Membership Card good for: 
  •  15% Discount on merchandise in the RiverStore
  •  10 Free Breakfasts per year in the River Restaurant
  • Name engraved on Founders Club Wall (Temporary Wall to begin construction Jan. 1, 2015. Will be moved into RiverClub upon completion of the Hotel)
  • Founders Club T-Shirt
  • Founders Club Baseball Hat
  • 4 Boat Launches per season
  • Invitation to exclusive Founders Party each summer

If for some reason we don't reach or goal of one million dollars ($1,000,000) We will allow outside investors to make up the difference ensuring that the Hotel project will reach completion.  

With any project of this size, there are always challenges. However, in the three years since we began construction of the restaurant and bar we have encountered our fair share of them (Arizona's crazy weather, over-zealous State and Federal agencies, the list goes on) and worked our way through each and every one. Our team can do anything they set their minds to!

We would really appreciate your support in spreading the word among your friends. Indiegogo has some great sharing tools and we are very active on Facebook. If you could make some noise on our behalf we would love to send you a token of our appreciation, so... if 5 of your friends contribute to our cause at any level, we're going to send you a VERY limited edition Topock66 VIP Button-Up Shirt. It's going to look bad-ass on you!! Be sure to be logged in to Indiegogo before you share so you will be credited for your referrals.

As you can see, we have some really nice perks for your contribution. Once this campaign ends, you will hear from us with details about redeeming your gifts once the hotel is completed.

All of the Lodging Perks are based upon availability (of course) and are not available on holiday weekends (Laughlin River Run, Memorial Day, 4th of July, Labor Day). In addition, the usual taxes and other fees will apply.

story:
About Amor Fitness & Nutrition

Amor Fitness & Nutrition is family-owned and operated in Austell, Georgia. Since our company opened its doors in 2011, we’ve treated every customer like family. Other companies may offer similar services, but our services are the best, and come with a personal touch. 

Our slogan is "Love Your Body" and our goal is to teach our clients how to achieve their goals through fitness & nutrition.  We offer the services to help guide you in achieving those goals--whether your goal is to lose a few pounds, gain muscle tone, have better health, or compete in fitness or body building competitions.

About Adele

My passion is to help others achieve their fitness goals by improving their overall health and confidence. My specialties are weight loss, lean muscle building, improving client endurance and coaching competitive athletes. My love for weight lifting and nutrition started in high school, which sparked my interest for competing as a natural bodybuilder and I continue to compete now well into my 40’s.  Proving that age is just a number, I hope to serve as motivation for my clients. I encourage them that they can go after their dreams and goals. And with my assistance, they can achieve and exceed them.

About the Campaign

Perhaps my first love was hair. Since 1992, I have worked in the most prestigious salons in Atlanta (Carter Barnes, Don Shaw, Van Michaels), behind the scenes at fashion shoots, and was an owner of my own salon for five years. Pursuing my other dream of being a personal trainer and coach has been beyond rewarding, but I've realized that I can combine my two talents.  With your support, I can offer my awesome clients a total package. While they have come to rely on the best training and nutrition coaching, I would be able to provide clients, both current and future, with fabulous hair. As a licensed cosmetologist, I specialize in precision cuts, single-process color, and foil highlights. If the campaign is funded, I will be able to begin and complete renovations to our facility, purchase the needed equipment (styling chair, shampoo bowl chair, and dryer chair), tools (hairdryer, irons, brushes, shears, and apron), and supplies (color, bleach, foils, shampoos, conditioners, and styling products).

After working with so many dedicated and driven clients who achieved their goals, I noticed a surge in their confidences and a real desire to change up their look (hair and fashion).  I thought adding a salon would be such a needed service and one that is quite unique from other fitness centers and personal training facilities. Including a salon at Amor Fitness and Nutrition will, no doubt, cause these confidences to soar. I very much appreciate your support in my next endeavor.

Funding  

2 Styling Chairs--$1,000 total

1 Shampoo Chair Bowl--$800

1 Dryer Chair--$250

1 Mobile Dryer--$250

Tools (hairdryer, irons, brushes, shears, mobile tray, apron) --$1,500

Supplies (color, bleach, foils, shampoos, conditioners, styling products)—$1,500

Renovations (including plumbing)--$2,000

Business License for Salon--$200

Total: $7,500

 

 


 


Perks

    • Skull Buster Supporter ($10)

      To show our gratitude we will write your name & hometown on our custom designed skull & barbell mural prominently featured in our garage training gym.

      Beast Mode ($25)

      Recognition on our skull & barbell mural prominently featured in our garage training gym, one week membership of our Garage Training sessions (group training) valid for one year, and a 30 min. consult/assessment. * Expires 12/15/15 *Transferable

      Beast & Beastly Beauty ($50)

      Recognition on our skull & barbell mural, a haircut, and a blow out. *Expires 12/15/15 *Transferable

      Sweat ($75)

      Recognition on our skull & barbell mural and a one month membership of Garage Training (group training). *Expires 12/15/15 *Transferable

      Scissors & Dumbbells ($100)

      Everything at the $25 level, a haircut, and a blow out. *Expires 12/15/15 *Transferable

      Pink Kettle Bell ($100)

      Everything at the $25 level, a one process hair color, and a blow out. *Expires 12/15/15 *Transferable

      Fat Loss Meal Plan ($150)

      Recognition on our skull & barbells mural and a customized 12 week meal plan designed for fat loss. *Expires 12/15/15 *Transferable

      Beastly Beauty Highlights ($150)

      Everything at the $25 level and a full head of foil highlights. *Expires 12/15/15 *Transferable

      Barbells & Beautiful Hair ($250)

      Recognition on our skull & barbell mural, 4 personal training sessions, one process color, a haircut, and a blow out. *Expires 12/15/15 *Transferable

      Love Your Body ($500)

      Recognition on our skull & barbell mural, 12 weeks membership of Garage Training (group training), 12 weeks customized meal plan designed to lose body fat, bi-weekly assessments for 12 weeks, a haircut, and a blow out. *Expires 12/15/15 *Transferable

      Platinum Beauty ($1,000)

      Everything at the $500 level, one process hair color, foil highlights, and a deep conditioning treatment. *Expires 12/15/15 *Transferable

      Crystal Trophy ($2,500)

      Recognition on our skull & barbells mural, one year membership of Garage Training (group training), a 12 week customized meal plan designed for fat loss, one year access to our Facebook private group Garage Training daily workouts, bi-weekly assessments for 12 weeks, 6 haircuts with blow out, and 3 foil highlights & toner. *Expires 12/15/15 *Transferable

      Pro Card Status ($5,000)

      Recognition on our skull & barbell mural, one year Garage Training (group training), a 12 week customized meal plan designed for fat loss, one year of assessments/nutrition consult (30 min. sessions), 24 personal training sessions (30 min. sessions), 12 Haircuts with blow out, 12 one process hair color, 6 foil highlights or low-lites & toner, and 6 deep conditioning treatments. *Expires 12/15/15 *Transferable

      Angel ($7,500)

      Recognition on our skull & barbell mural, one year membership of Garage Training (group training), 72 personal training sessions (30 min.), 12 week customized meal plan designed for fat loss, one year assessments/nutrition consults, 24 haircuts with blow out, 12 one process hair color, 6 foil highlights/low-lites & toner, and 12 deep conditioning treatments. *Expires 12/15/16 *Transferable

The Impact

As a small business owner, it can be challenging to receive funding for starting up. While getting my business started, I was also working another full-time job along with the financial support of my husband. We used all of our personal cash and credit to purchase everything and maintain the business expenses. The business grew very quickly. We started in a 450 sq. foot space and moved into a 2,000 sq. foot space after the first five months. After another year we had so many clients that we needed more space for have private offices for consults, a lobby, a second bathroom and the opportunity to add more services. Our facility is now 3,000 sq. feet. We continue to be successful, but since we have tripled our rent and expenses, the business is just able to pay for itself. I am certain that adding a salon will help bring in more revenue so that I may be able to pay myself and make a profit, allowing the business to continue to grow. With the help of your donations I will be able to make this happen while also gaining new clients.

 Risks & Challenges
Our goal is to have the salon ready for operation by December 2014. If we are not able to reach our goal of raising $7,500, we will use the donations that we do make to purchase as much equipment for the salon as possible. It may take us up to a year or more to get the salon equipped and operating. This can be challenging since we have slow seasons throughout the year with the fitness business, and the revenue that is made now is only able to pay for the business itself.

 Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to make a donation, we would very much appreciate your help by spreading the word and sharing our campaign online by using the Indiegogo share tools.
story_txt:
About Amor Fitness & Nutrition
Amor Fitness & Nutrition is family-owned and operated in
Austell, Georgia. Since our company opened its doors in 2011, we’ve treated
every customer like family. Other companies may offer similar services, but our
services are the best, and come with a personal touch.  
Our slogan is "Love Your Body" and our goal is to
teach our clients how to achieve their goals through fitness &
nutrition.  We offer the services to help
guide you in achieving those goals--whether your goal is to lose a few pounds,
gain muscle tone, have better health, or compete in fitness or body building
competitions.
About Adele
My passion is to help others achieve their fitness goals by
improving their overall health and confidence. My specialties are weight loss,
lean muscle building, improving client endurance and coaching competitive
athletes. My love for weight lifting and nutrition started in high school,
which sparked my interest for competing as a natural bodybuilder and I continue
to compete now well into my 40’s. 
Proving that age is just a number, I hope to serve as motivation for my
clients. I encourage them that they can go after their dreams and goals. And
with my assistance, they can achieve and exceed them.
About the Campaign
Perhaps my first love was hair. Since 1992, I have worked in
the most prestigious salons in Atlanta (Carter Barnes, Don Shaw, Van Michaels),
behind the scenes at fashion shoots, and was an owner of my own salon for five
years. Pursuing my other dream of being a personal trainer and coach has been
beyond rewarding, but I've realized that I can combine my two talents.  With your support, I can offer my awesome
clients a total package. While they have come to rely on the best training and nutrition
coaching, I would be able to provide clients, both current and future, with
fabulous hair. As a licensed cosmetologist, I specialize in precision cuts,
single-process color, and foil highlights. If the campaign is funded, I will be
able to begin and complete renovations to our facility, purchase the needed
equipment (styling chair, shampoo bowl chair, and dryer chair), tools
(hairdryer, irons, brushes, shears, and apron), and supplies (color, bleach,

story:
In April 2005, Bruno and his mother, Caterina, visited the Boys and Girls Club of Anaheim, where his mother noticed that there was a 6-year old boy eating potato chips for dinner. They soon learned that his family could not afford a proper meal and Caterina insisted that Bruno make some pasta for the child. That night, Bruno and his chefs cooked 75 pasta meals in the kitchen of the Anaheim White House and delivered them to the Boys and Girls Club. 


Please help the SHARE THE TABLE & WELCOME HOME programs thrive by pledging for our INDIEGOGO campaign now! 

For just $1 a day, you can help feed a child who would have otherwise gone hungry. 


The SHARE THE TABLE program is dedicated to filling the hearts and stomachs of the underprivileged, while encouraging family values and camaraderie amongst the table. Today, SHARE THE TABLE has expanded to feeding over 1,000 children a night at 10 different locations in 5 cities throughout Southern California. 


Upon learning the severity of living situations that many of the children that attend the Boys and Girls Clubs, Bruno and his team started the WELCOME HOME program to assist struggling families in moving out of motels and into the stable living conditions of an apartment or condo. 

These families, by living week to week in these cramped quarters, stay just one step ahead of homelessness because they cannot scrape together enough money for a deposit on a decent apartment. The WELCOME HOME program is the catalyst for assisting qualified families, currently living in motels throughout Orange County, into safer environments. To date, 55 families have been successfully relocated. 


Internationally recognized and multi award winning philanthropist Bruno Serato was named a top 20 Hero of the World by CNN in March of 2011. This recognition brought international attention to Caterina’s Club and as of today, Caterina’s Club has been mentioned in European, Asian, & South American magazines, newspapers, websites, and television shows. This chef has made it his life’s mission not just to feed his beloved “motel kids,” but to help others…help others. 


Please visit us at www.thecaterinasclub.org for more information & ways to contribute. Thank You!

IN LOVING MEMORY OF MAMMA CATERINA
1924-2014

story:
Who We Are

Quarter for Your Crisis, co-founded by Jordan Dansky and Pete Jones, was created with a mission to encourage those of us going through a quarter-life crisis to pursue our true passions. What makes this difficult for many of us?

Life.

It tells us we’re not ready, we’re too young, that’s not what we’re supposed to do. At QFYC, we believe at some point or another we all run into the same problem: Our vision gets a little blurry. Just call us the modern-day fog-lifters! Working toward our vision of inspiring others to turn their passions into a purpose and lead more authentic and purposeful lives, we share online content and stories of Degenerates – those who have taken the plunge and are actually going after their dreams.

Want to take a look at some of our work? Check out some of our featured stories below:

  • We Are All Lonely Together
  • Do You Want to Be Cool?
  • Why You Should Live Tiny: Our Interview with Gabriella and Andrew Morrison of Tiny House Build
  • 9 Reasons You Won't Pursue Your Dreams

Our work has been featured in Huffington Post and Thought Catalog, but that is only the beginning. While our company is mainly an online community at the moment, our dreams for this movement are much bigger. Keep reading to find out more!

Why We Need a Quarter for Our Crisis

We've got BIG news! One of our co-founders, Jordan, was accepted as one of 50 entrepreneurs to attend the Do Cool Sh*t Bootcamp in NYC this December. This week-long startup boot camp will allow Jordan & Pete to take QFYC to the next level:

  • Gain tangible skills to grow and advance our business
  • Connect with inspiring social entrepreneurs and VCs
  • Learn basic startup logistics and organizational tools
  • Develop marketing/advertising including press and sponsorship
  • Explore funding options and network with investors and the DCS community
  • Make QFYC the go-to resource for any Millennial going through the quarter-life crisis
  • Inspire and empower millions around the world to live more purposeful and authentic lives!
So what's the catch?
This boot camp comes with a challenge to kick us into gear: Crowd funding our tuition. That's where you come in! We are asking all of the Degenerates out there to help us raise $2500. Let's break it down:
  • $2000 is the cost of tuition
  • $500 will cover the cost of the perks offered, the fees for crowd funding, and any remainder will kick start our marketing and advertising, so that we can start reaching more Millennials!

The Impact

At QFYC, we believe that anyone can live happy, fulfilling lives doing what he/she loves. It comes down to belief, commitment, passion, and purpose. We're here to be your cheerleaders and your coach! We'll be there on the sidelines, helping you along the way, telling you that you can pursue your passions and you should ask for more out of life. So how do we plan on growing our business to do this?

  • Inspiring and insightful content filled with advice, tools, and resources to shift your mindset and help you realize your full potential
  • Interview Degenerates across different cultures and countries to highlight the similarities and differences in the challenge we face when going after our dreams
  • Build our collection of stories and interviews into a tangible book, chock-full of Degenerates who will show you that anyone, anywhere can start living a life they love
  • Partner with colleges and universities to create Degenerate boot camps where students can connect with like-minded individuals and explore topics on how they can live their best lives
  • Develop Degenerate retreats for students and young professionals to gain first-hand knowledge and experience that will help them realize and actualize their full potential and passions
And that's just the beginning!

    Risks & Challenges

    There are risks involved in every endeavor, and we're big believers that taking risks is necessary when building a business. It's even more important when taking the first steps to start living your best life. It involves trusting yourself and knowing you will do whatever it takes to make your dreams a reality. This cause is no different! So how will we mediate these risks?

    • Pete and Jordan have both committed 100% to building this community. This is their dream and passion, and they've already overcome fears like leaving jobs and bootstrapping while always making it work.
    • We've already begun conversations with universities and organizations in regards to developing the boot camps and retreats. We know the need is out there, the market is huge, but more importantly the market is essentially void of what we are going to offer.
    • We've built relationships with publishers and discussed the necessary steps to be proactive in the book writing process.
    • Our current financial risks are small, as the community is mainly online and involves extremely small overhead costs to sustain.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Not everyone is in the position to contribute to our campaign, and we totally understand that - but there's still a HUGE way you can help us! Share, share, and share some more! Follow us on Twitter @LeadDegenerate and on our Facebook page. Send some articles to your friends, post them to your Facebook or Twitter, and spread the word about QFYC's mission and purpose.

    If you feel the same drive as we do to redefine our society's definition of success and empower others to take control of their lives and happiness, then we'd love for you to share our campaign page to help us fundraise. Anything and everything helps. Thank you for taking the time to learn more about our cause. Welcome to the community of Degenerates!

Anything and everything helps. Thank you for taking the time to learn more about our cause. Welcome to the community of Degenerates!

story:
Short Summary

The project started though the volunteering work I do with The Big Issue office in Edinburgh. I was asked to organise a Friday afternoon soup kitchen for Big Issue vendors (Biggish Soup). However this never really took off (the vendors didn't want to leave their work to eat soup!) and when the Big Issue decided to stop this service St John's (the rather impressive church on the corner of Princes Street and Lothian Road) asked me if I would be interested in using the kitchen space for anything else and Souper Saturday was born (I like corny names I do!) into the world.

The food is a minor part of what we do. The social interaction is the part that's most appreciated: visitors are treated as people rather than "homeless people"; we drink tea from proper mugs and not polystyrene; we all sit round a big table together; we chat as equals.

What We Need & What You Get

We currently have enough money to purchase ingredients for meals until the end of February.

However we hope that in the future we will be able to provide warm clean clothing, laundry vouchers, Thermos flasks, mobile telephones and ID for people who need them. The latter two of which mightn't seem like essentials, but in this day and age they are extremely useful in helping to support people off of the streets and back into mainstream society.
 
We have no overheads coming out of the donated funds (these are all paid by me personally) so every penny that is donated will go directly to helping the homeless and other similarly vulnerable people in Edinburgh.

We can offer you the greatest reward of all: that warm glow that you have helped those in need. We can also provide proof that you've acquired this glow so that you can have a wee brag about it without seeming to ;)

The Impact

Homelessness and rough sleeping are, sadly, on the increase and it can be devastating; leaving people vulnerable and isolated.

We seek to provide a friendly informal environment where people can engage in social interaction like normal human beings and can, for a few hours, relax.

We also provide basic advice and, in more complex situations, referrals to other agencies who can offer more specialist advice.

Other Ways You Can Help

We are always keen to welcome volunteers who are willing to make tea, wash up or simply sit and chat. Free tea and coffee is also available to volunteers!

Donations of non-perishable food items are also gratefully received.

Comment here, on Twitter or email soupersaturday@talktalk.net for more information on these.

Thank you!
