          world.
          The food is a minor part of what we do. The social interaction
          is the part that's most appreciated: visitors are treated as
          people rather than "homeless people"; we drink tea from proper
          mugs and not polystyrene; we all sit round a big table
          together; we chat as equals.What We Need & What You GetWe currently have enough money to purchase ingredients for meals until the end of February.However we hope that in the future we will be able to provide warm clean clothing, laundry vouchers, Thermos flasks, mobile telephones and ID for people who need them. The latter two of which mightn't seem like essentials, but in this day and age they are extremely useful in helping to support people off of the streets and back into mainstream society.  We have no overheads coming out of the donated funds (these are all paid by me personally) so every penny that is donated will go directly to helping the homeless and other similarly vulnerable people in Edinburgh.We can offer you the greatest reward of all: that warm glow that you have helped those in need. We can also provide proof that you've acquired this glow so that you can have a wee brag about it without seeming to ;)The ImpactHomelessness and rough sleeping are, sadly, on the increase and it can be devastating; leaving people vulnerable and isolated.We seek to provide a friendly informal environment where people can engage in social interaction like normal human beings and can, for a few hours, relax.We also provide basic advice and, in more complex situations, referrals to other agencies who can offer more specialist advice.Other Ways You Can HelpWe are always keen to welcome volunteers who are willing to make tea, wash up or simply sit and chat. Free tea and coffee is also available to volunteers!Donations of non-perishable food items are also gratefully received. Comment here, on Twitter or email soupersaturday@talktalk.net for more information on these.Thank you!

story:
Did you grow up wearing glasses, never finding a suitable option for sun-protection?  Did you always wish that you could just walk into Wal-mart & buy a pair of fun, age-appropriate, detachable sunglasses? Or maybe you're a parent of a child that wears glasses, and you've always struggled, trying to find a way to protect your child's eyes from the harmful glare of the sun's rays?

The Sunbudz Story

My name is Candice Berube, founder and creator of Sunbudz, a detachable sunglass product for children.  Two years ago, my daughter was diagnosed with a genetic disorder that left her legally blind and wearing glasses for the rest of her life.  Being a normal, precocious, school-age girl, she loves everything pink, purple and sparkly!  And, in the summer months, the glittery sunglasses in the department stores call her name!

So, we have bought the sunglasses and she has proceeded to wear both her glasses AND sunglasses at the same time.  Not a very practical solution, I felt that there REALLY must be another option for her. I searched the Internet and was shocked to find that the only alternatives were expensive prescription sunglasses, transition lenses, or adult clip-ons.  

Upon further research, I found that 25% of children, from grades K through 6, wear glasses!  Additionally, ophthalmologists struggle with how to help their young patients with sun protection!  At this point, my mission became clear: to create a detachable, FUN, sunglass option for all children who wear glasses, so that they can be just like every other child out there! And, so, Sunbudz was born!

What ARE Sunbudz???

Sunbudz is patent-pending and, thus far, has been designed by me.  I literally conceptualized how they should look & function and then just made them! However, we have now hired an amazing design firm (who has designed for Crayola, Fisher Price, Creativity, and many other brands) and have a stellar executive team.

We are looking to raise $6,000 in order to contract the design firm, continue enhancing the prototype, and fund initial operational and legal fees.  Should we raise more funds, then we would begin building the website and manufacturing our initial inventory.

Now, the fun stuff: what's in it for you?

1.  Continue $1 - Donate $1.00+ and help us bring Sunbudz to market! Thank you for your support because every little bit helps!

2.  Contribute $25 - Thank you for your support!  You will be publicly thanked on our Sunbudz Facebook page.

3.  Contribute $50 -  Receive your own pair of Sunbudz (delivery contingent upon inventory completion). You will be publicly thanked on our Facebook page!

4.  Contribute $100 - You will be publicly thanked on our Facebook page AND you will receive a personal thank you note from Delainey & our family.

5.  Contribute $500 - You will be publicly thanked on our Facebook page, receive a personal thank you note from Delainey, and earn exclusive naming rights on an early Sunbudz design!

6.  Contribute $1000 -  You will be publicly thanked on our Facebook page, receive a personal thank you note from Delainey, earn exclusive naming rights on an early Sunbudz design, and receive an exclusive, in-person (or Skype) tour of our CT design facility and preview of our prototype!

My vision is to have Sunbudz in every major department store and optician's office across the United States.  I feel strongly that we design the product of the highest quality material  - we will not stop until we have it right!

I'm excited and I hope you are, too!  If we are successful in raising the necessary funds, then all children who wear glasses WILL be like every other child, with amazingly fun sunglasses.  No one will even be able to tell that they are wearing glasses!  I see a very sparkly & colorful sunglass future for all our glasses-wearing friends!

story:
Don't understand my language project?? Contact me by mail and I will send it in English.

Fanpage en Facebook de Carmensita's Bakery. Donde podréis ver más imágenes y seguir nuestra actividad.

Instagram, ojea fotos de las delicias y cositas dulces que hago...

Puedo enviar el Plan de Empresa por mail, puedes solicitarlo por mail Carmensitasbakery@gmail.com


(1) La actividad de la empresa será la de reposteria creativa / tea-coffee room, la empresa se dedicará a todo tipo de repostería creativa (cupcakes, muffins, galletas decoradas y de diferentes sabores y formas, brownies, blondies, tartas de todo tipo: decoradas con fondant, red velvet, tarta de zanahorias, etc..), realizará también su propio pan, mermeladas, así como la especialización en tés y cafes. Se realizaran desayunos, meriendas, party teas, brunch los domingos, y encargos. A la vez intentaremos facilitar y disponer de repostería sin gluten, vegetariana y todo tipo de repostería para gente con todo tipo de intolerancias, también contará con leches vegetales y bebidas especiales.

(2) La empresa apuesta por la fuerte demanda y poca o ninguna oferta que hay de este sector en la ciudad, como intolerante a cierto número de alimentos, conozco la dificultad de poder ir a una cafeteria y pedir un simple café con leche, con leche vegetal, por ejemplo, desconozco de alguna cafetería que tenga pan o especialidades para celíacos o intolerantes a la lactosa. También apostamos por una repostería de calidad, totalmente casera; por un lugar donde relajarse con un buen té o café. La empresa ofrecerá a su vez amplia selección de tés, cafés y batidos, tanto fríos como calientes. Dispondrá de panes recíen hechos, hay algo mejor que desayunar o merendar una tostada con un pan recién hecho y de diferentes sabores (con semillas, con nueces, con soja, pan para celíacos)??? Hay que tener en cuenta, la gran demanda de productos de pastelería creativa en la ciudad, siendo Alcoy Ciudad Universitaria, con una Escuela de Arte, etc.. hay que pensar que la gente jovén está buscando estos servicios fuera de la ciudad, y gran número de jovenes acuden a Valencia (Cupcake Republik) o Alicante (Las 3 cucharitas o Las Manolitas) a buscar estos servicios. También apostamos fuerte por promover el "TAKE AWAY" o las "BREAKFAST BOX", cuanta gente le urge llegar a su trabajo y empezar el día con un buen café?? y no depender de esas horrorosas máquinas con mini cafes?, cuanta gente apuesta por un buen desayuno, recien hecho y calentito y no puede salir de su centro de trabajo? Carmensita's Bakery proporcionará todos estos servicios y muchos más....nuestro lema: CÓMETE LA FELICIDAD!!

story:
Hello and thanks for your interest in my campaign. My name is Steve Cosimano and I am a native Washingtonian now living in Silver Spring,MD. I am an alumnus of the University of Maryland and father of two children. After working in the food/beverage industry for the past twenty years i became burned out and decided to start my own business.

I have always felt that transportation options from the Washington DC  metropolitan area to BWI Airport are overpriced and the quality of service is average at best. I would like to change that.

By contributing to this campaign you will help bring about a lower cost, well run airport shuttle service between Bethesda MD and BWI that will provide future riders with an alternative to what is currently available. 

The  funding I am seeking will go toward the purchase of a 12-14 passenger shuttle bus.This bus will be equipped with free WIFI as well as multiple charging devices to accommodate today's busy traveler. In addition, it will be much more spacious and comfortable than a typical 12 passenger van. Most people will be able to stand up easily. And best of all the cost will be significantly less than the competition.

Perks will be offered at five different levels. All will offer either a discount or a free ride on the shuttle.

If you're wondering about the dolphin logo it represents "fast,friendly service," which I aim to provide.

If you are unable or don't want to contribute monetarily please help spread the word any way you can about this new service. Any and all suggestions are welcome!

If goal is not met funds will still be invested in starting up the business. All vouchers will be honored.

Thanks again and hope to see you on "THE DOLPHIN" soon!

story:
This campaign and our #ChampionForCharity Makeover Contest will allow you to vote for your cause to be the winner of a $75,000 prize. If you care about making the world a better place, please read on!

Click Me to Vote on Twitter


We all know how important a strong online footprint and great communication is to any brand of organization. For a nonprofit or charity, it is how they get found, build trust and showcase their impact to volunteers, donors and supporters.

Too often, though, financial constraints mean that the online footprint and communication they long for is out of reach.

Today you can support your favourite charity without burning a hole in your wallet. Give them a gift of a complete digital makeover and we’ll take care of the rest!

One charity selected via voting will receive the following $75,000 makeover:

●  Help your favourite cause make a strong first impression, and get found online; showcase their story, their vision and their mission. We will re-design the website to revamp their digital presence and grab people’s attention!

●  A brand new Givestant™ Mobile App, so they can connect with the sponsors, donors and volunteers on the go. Know in real time where your donations are going and how they’re helping.

●  We’ll help the charity keep their audience and community in the loop and connect directly to their supporters through Twitter, Facebook and just about any other social media site you can name!

●  We make it easier to donate to your favourite cause through online donations! That means everyone can donate easily without the hassle of banks, cheques and postage.

●  As the saying goes we won’t just fish for your cause, we’ll teach them how to fish for themselves. We’ll work with them to create a comprehensive Communication and Marketing Strategy tailored to their challenges and needs that will carry them well into the future.

And for the big reveal we will host a launch party and fundraiser for the winning cause at our offices!

Vote for FREE for a charity or nonprofit of your choice by tweeting.

If it’s free to vote, what exactly are you crowdfunding?

We all have at least one cause we’re passionate about. Some of us work tirelessly to save the rainforest, some to ensure that girls who have been abducted are returned. No one cause is better than another, but some are more popular.

By crowdfunding, we can level the playing field and accomplish more goals as a social purpose business. As you’ve noticed, every perk comes with bonus votes, allowing you to boost your cause up the rankings chart to the top – no matter how big or small their following is.

Your gift today, whether $10 or $100 helps ensure that we can provide the best makeover possible to a cause, and continue to grow our own social purpose business at the same time - making a bigger impact in the world with our expertise and technology.

But perhaps most importantly, your $10 or $100 gift today makes it more likely that the cause that you care about is the one wins and can focus more on their mission and worry less about funding their communication.

I’m a skeptic, does this actually matter?

Do you recall the last time you went to a charity website and you thought to yourself ‘Wow, this is horrible. It looks like something from the early days of the World Wide Web. Are we back on the Information Superhighway?”

Or perhaps after a few minutes of searching their site, you managed to find the donate link only to click on it and receive a ‘401 Page Not Found’ or even worse, being taken to a web page with a zillion fields and thinking to yourself, ‘My kids are screaming in the next room, there’s no way I’m spending 10 minutes on this form to give them money!’

Transforming that charity’s future, and making your life better, is one free vote away.

And if you really care about a cause, buy a perk and boost their chances of winning.

How Can I Vote?

Voting is simple AND FREE:

Tweet once a day to vote! A qualifying tweet must contain:·
These hashtags:

- #ChampionForCharity

- #voted

The following link to this page: http://bit.ly/charitymakeover

The name of your charity, and preferably their twitter handle.

Click the example below to tweet it out and VOTE RIGHT NOW!

I #voted for <YOUR CHARITY NAME HERE>  to win the $75,000 #ChampionForCharity Charity Makeover at http://bit.ly/charitymakeover

Don’t have Twitter?

There are other ways to vote. Check out our website for full contest details and other free ways to support your cause.

I voted, but my charity isn’t #1. Tell me more about boosting them to the top with the perks!

For each perk you buy on this site, not only will you get the gift mentioned in the perk, but we’ll also give you bonus votes based on how expensive your perk was!

For example if you give the $10 perk for the special shout out on Twitter, we will also give you 10 bonus votes to use towards your charity!

Want More Details?

Check out our page dedicated to the contest at: http://www.inotforprofit.com/charitymakeover

Check back here daily for the current standings! Or follow us on Twitter :)

Who is iNotForProfit?

We are a social purpose business and B certified corporation and you can be assured that your funds are in good hands. We have all been involved in charities and nonprofits to some degree in the past. These organizations are doing critical work in the local communities and we want to enable them through technology.

As a company we use our expertise in technology, digital media and communications to help charitable organizations make a bigger impact in the world!

story:
So What Are We All About?

The Lamont Street Collective (LSC) has devoted 40 years to supporting art, activism, and intentional living in the Mount Pleasant community of Washington, DC. We provide affordable housing to artists, activists, and people passionate about transforming our society for the better. Further, we use the talents & networks of the people we house to make our home a community space, with regular programming and events, because we believe in mutual aid.

We're not just a group house. We're a community.

The LSC is a dynamic, nurturing environment where YOU have the space and support to create, discuss, learn, and exhibit your work and your passions. We're a place to express yourself and challenge the status quo.

We’re excited to tell you that after a decade of legal wrangling, WE ARE BUYING THIS HOUSE - but we need your help.

With your donation, we can preserve the historical legacy of the LSC and keep it a permanent space for free expression and creative work that builds alternatives to the status quo.

A number of local publications have covered the LSC's story, including City Paper, DC Mic Check, DC Music Download, and BYT.


What We Need

A little bit goes a long way - this initial $5000 pays for necessary pre-development costs to buy the house:

(1)  An architectural firm

(2) Assessment of necessary house repairs

(3) Support from a development consultant

(4) Fiscal sponsorship

**For more details, scroll to the FAQ at the bottom of this page.

The Stretch Goal

An extra $2000 would provide us with the FIRST financial push we need to start raising money for our down payment.

What happens if we fall short of our $5,000 goal?

100% of the money raised will still go towards preparing for house renovations that will bring us up to code. But more importantly, it will relieve some of the financial pressure around renovations so we can put our focus on developing our community-facing programs as we determine next steps.


The Impact

Your contribution will help preserve our historical legacy, and establish the LSC as a permanent community space for creative resistance.

Since it was established by John Acher & friends in 1974, literally hundreds of people have called the LSC home.  As gentrification in DC has accelerated, the LSC remains one of the last cooperative homes in Mount Pleasant.

Through it all, LSC has served as a creative construction space to create freshly iconic protest art that you may have seen splashed across front pages, like:

The School of the Americas (SOA) Watch Dragon


“Stop the Frack Attack!” Oil Rigs

From demonstrations against the IMF in 2011 to the efforts associated with OccupyDC, local housing justice, and more, the LSC still remains an important institution in local activist art. 

The LSC regularly hosts events and programs that celebrate the visual and performing arts, and issues relating to social justice and activism.

  • Our biannual Salon de Libertad celebrates the work of local artists, performers, and musicians through an all-day art house open to the enter District.
  • Our weekly figure drawing classes give old pros, amateurs, and beginners an opportunity to hone their skills by practicing with live model and joining the communal discussion afterwards.
  • Our support for the Anti-Deportation Hunger Strike on the White House lead to the creation of a video documenting a discussion between the AFL-CIO President and workers fighting for the right to remain in this country.
  • From the house basement, we host the production of a radio interview and discussion program called Voices of the 99%, which aims to cover resistance worldwide and raise public consciousness of ongoing news debates.
  • We strive to support healthy and diverse discussion around a variety of topics: labor rights with the injured Volkswagen workers from Chattanooga, the future activism with Barbara Ehrenreich, and psychology of the Act of Killing.


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help. Tell your friends and fellow artists & activists about our campaign through Twitter, Facebook, and E-mail. 

  • Post photos of your time at the LSC, or enjoying the protest art we’ve helped build here.

  • Contact us about events you’d like to host at the LSC.

  • Reach out to us via Facebook, Twitter, or our website, and share your stories.


FAQ

(1) You need an architectural firm? What does this mean exactly?

Before any lender is willing to invest in a house, he/she needs to make sure it's sound from the inside out. After all, the LSC is over 100 years old!

This is why we're working with Nick, an architect from Stoiber & Associates, to assess what kind of repairs we need and make sure that we don't miss any major infrastructural hiccups.

We're paying a retainer fee, or upfront cost, to the firm to do a "capital needs assessment" aka an inspection + report of repairs needed.

(2) Assessment of necessary house repairs...I still don't follow. What is this?

This "capital needs assessment" will essentially be an estimate of how much it would cost to do the most important and necessary repairs for the house's long term health, which are important to any lender we'd want a mortgage from (whether private, government, or nonprofit). We're paying the initial fee to the architect to get started on this process.

(3) What then? What does "support from a development consultant" actually mean?

Sigh. We've also learned that the housing/real estate realm tends to get a bit jargony. Once get the initial assessment report from the architect, we need the development consultant to help us make sense of it and dig deep into which repairs are most important to lenders.

We're basically bringing on board an organization like NASCO (who we're talking to) or another one, whose role would involve being out in front with lenders, filling out the stacks of paperwork & guiding us through the necessary steps to get us the mortgage loan. As always, the initial steps cost "out of pocket" $$$.

(4) Where does the fiscal sponsorship come in? Is it for the whole house?

The fiscal sponsorship is a separate issue from these other three--it's about finding an organization (the Washington Peace Center was our first choice, but that's fallen through, so we're looking for others) that can take donations 'on behalf of' the LSC, so that donations to the LSC can be tax-deductible (like a 501c3).

(5) Do you have more questions?

We're happy to answer them! Just leave a comment on our Indiegogo campaign page or shoot us an email at lamontstreetcollective@gmail.com.
story_txt:
So What Are We All About?The Lamont Street Collective (LSC) has devoted 40 years to supporting art, activism, and intentional living in the Mount Pleasant community of Washington, DC. We provide affordable housing to artists, activists, and people passionate about transforming our society for the better. Further, we use the talents & networks of the people we house to make our home a community space, with regular programming and events, because we believe in mutual aid.We're not just a group house. We're a community.The LSC is a dynamic, nurturing environment where YOU have the space and support to create, discuss, learn, and exhibit your work and your passions. We're a place to express yourself and challenge the status quo.We’re excited to tell you that after a decade of legal wrangling, WE ARE BUYING THIS HOUSE - but we need your help.With your donation, we can preserve the historical legacy of the LSC and keep it a permanent space for free expression and creative work that builds alternatives to the status quo.A number of local publications have covered the LSC's story, including City Paper, DC Mic Check, DC Music Download, and BYT.What We NeedA little bit goes a long way - this initial $5000 pays for necessary pre-development costs to buy the house:(1)  An architectural firm(2) Assessment of necessary house repairs(3) Support from a development consultant(4) Fiscal sponsorship**For more details, scroll to the FAQ at the bottom of this page.The Stretch GoalAn extra $2000 would provide us with the FIRST financial push we need to start raising money for our down payment.What happens if we fall short of our $5,000 goal?100% of the money raised will still go towards preparing for house renovations that will bring us up to code. But more importantly, it will relieve some of the financial pressure around renovations so we can put our focus on developing our community-facing programs as we determine next steps. The ImpactYour contribution will help preserve our historical legacy, and establish the LSC as a permanent community space for creative resistance.Since it was established by John Acher & friends in 1974, literally hundreds of people have called the LSC home.  As gentrification in DC has accelerated, the LSC remains one of the last cooperative homes in Mount Pleasant.Through it all, LSC has served as a creative construction space to create freshly iconic protest art that you may have seen splashed across front pages, like:The School of the Americas (SOA) Watch Dragon“Stop the Frack Attack!” Oil RigsFrom demonstrations against the IMF in 2011 to the efforts associated with OccupyDC, local housing justice, and more, the LSC still remains an important institution in local activist art. The LSC regularly hosts events and programs that celebrate the visual and performing arts, and issues relating to social justice and activism.

story:
Hi there folks and thanks for taking the time to have a look at my fundraising campaign, my name is Zach Brady and in 2012 my father was diagnosed with stage 2 left lung carcinoma which within three months stepped up to stage 3 and had also moved into his right lung and in December of the same year he was diagnosed stage 4 and given 4 to 6 weeks to live. I along with my mother cared for my father and palliated him at home until he lost his battle in 2013 on the 21st of January. I decided to go back to Uni and study nursing in memory of my dad so that gets me to where I am today at school and starting a palliative support service to give back to people like my dad and their families.

I sincerely thank all for any support


Zach C Brady

I along with my mother cared for my father and palliated him at home until he lost his battle in 2013 on the 21st of January. I decided to go back to Uni and study nursing in memory of my dad so that gets me to where I am today at school and starting a palliative support service to give back to people like my dad and their families.I sincerely thank all for any supportZach C Brady

story:
Who We Are

Hello, our names are Janice and Julia! We are two college aged young women who are challenging societal norms and removing ourselves from modern comforts. We met in 2010 at the Putney School and have been friends ever since. Our strong work ethic motivates us to take on this challenge.


Julia, a premed student at the University of Vermont, is fascinated by the scientific aspects of survival. It is an opportunity to observe the physical and emotional changes to our minds and bodies that living off the land will result in.


Janice is a graphic designer living in Burlington, Vermont. In addition to her interest in the environment, her passion for nature photography compliments her desire to live off the land.


Both Julia and Janice have been training for upwards of a year for their expedition into the wild.



Why Is This Important?

Humans are able to survive on this planet without modern technology, but with the advancements many of us have lost touch with our natural roots in the world. What happens when we remove ourselves from developed communities to forage and survive? In this social experiment we are going on a survival expedition to Southwestern Oregon to live off the land with minimal survival tools or food, and no outside contact for 6 weeks, while documenting the process.


We need to question how reliant we are on modern technology by putting to the test our ability to live off the land without outside help. We want to prove through our experience that it is possible for two young women who have been raised in a highly technological society to survive alone in the wilderness. Through this we hope to share the necessity and beauty of understanding and appreciating the natural world.


Upon return we are going publish a short documentary and book, along with photographs from the journey.



What We Need

We need your help to make this dream a reality!

Julia and Janice are traveling to survive together in the wilderness of Southwestern Oregon. They will have no outside contact for 6 weeks, and will be completely reliant on each other for community, food and safety. They are not survival experts, and recognize the danger and risk involved in living in the backcountry wilderness.


Dangers

  • Bears
  • Mountain Lions/Cougars/Catamounts
  • Coyote's
  • Rattlesnakes
  • River Crossings
  • Wildfires
  • Hypothermia/Hyperthermia
  • Starvation
  • Dehydration
  • Weather
  • Accidents
  • Illness



For this expedition we need:

  1. Electronics to capture our everyday experience

  2. Medical supplies

  3. Tools (including a sturdy knife and a pot for boiling water)

story:
(Note to friends and/or contributors: Please read through entire, brief presentation. We ask that you forgive any errors, reserve judgement or criticism until thoroughly reviewed as this is a DIY project. Return often to this site as there will be updates and more visuals added to the gallery regularly, as well as a short, annoying video. No professionals or animals were used in the making of this presentation)!  

Why Us?

For more than twenty years, through the non-profit social service community, Cheryl Alexander and her colleagues, have been providing families in San Diego supportive and enlivening ways to enhance family relationships or mend broken ties.  By offering classes, workshops and individual counseling parents gained confidence while learning valuable skills to support their children's well-being.  With backgrounds in adult and teen education, counseling and communications their combined knowledge of healthy family dynamics makes them experts in this field.  Family Court of San Diego has acknowledged this expertise by recommending their services to families going through the reunification process after recovery or difficult custody issues.  

What are the services?

* Supervised Visitation for parents with their children

* Parent Education for better understanding of child development and family dynamics

* Individual and Family Counseling 

* Mediation

* Workshops for Teen Parents 

* English and Spanish speaking facilitators


Why This Project & Why It Matters

These services are court sanctioned.  Cheryl and her colleagues receive many calls from families who are in the process of reunification (when children have been moved into foster care for reasons of health and safety there is a process the court requires them to follow, that may take a year or more to regain custody of their children; sometimes there is just a tough custody case that needs court intervention).  Many of the parents who request services are struggling with recovery or divorce issues and are unable to pay the fees associated with the process.  Unfortunately, Family Court is mandating a process without funding it, so parents who are unable to pay for the process to put their family back together again struggle even more.  Families belong together and sometimes the stresses of modern day living create challenges larger than parents are capable of managing.   Your generous contributions to this campaign can provide support or reunification for 40-60 families!

This project matters because every year in San Diego County alone, there are more than 3700 children living in "out of home care" (Foster or Kindred care). And everyone is aware that the divorce/separation rate in America is well above 50%.

FAMILIES ARE VITAL TO A HEALTHY COMMUNITY!

FAMILIES NEED TO BE TOGETHER!

FAMILIES OFTEN NEED HELP LEARNING HOW TO BE TOGETHER!


What We Need & What You Get!

We need $25,000 to serve 40-60 families.  You get to feel good about helping parents and children reunite.  And you get to be acknowledged for your participation. You get a healthier, stronger community.

Check out our perks!

Here's how you can help:

* Give us your money! (Give as much or as little as you like.  We only made suggestions). Save up your Starbucks coffee dollars for a week; skip that trip to the wine bar tonight; eat dinner in for a change; cancel your European vacation (OK, that may be a little extreme)!

* Sell your prized record collection from the '60's and be our only contributor (we don't mind having just one contributor, REALLY!.

* Don't' want to give us your money??? That's fine, too. Instead, you can tell all your friends, acquaintances, neighbors, besties, colleagues, relatives and social media buddies to give us their money!  Don't be shy.  This is important for creating and maintaining a healthy community.  This important project for increasing the health of families reduces child abuse and domestic violence. REALLY!

*Share, share, share this project in all venues....Facebook, twitter, Instagram, Pinterest, church, synagogue, mosque, meet-ups, book clubs.

* Have a bake sale!

Where's The Money Go?

* $12,000 - Office Space/expenses such as telephone, etc.  (For approximately one year)

*    2,000 - Office Supplies (Copies, file folders, pens, paper, etc.)

*   21,000 - Professional Staff to facilitate classes, counseling, supervision, mediation (Estimate of $500-700 cost per family)

*     5,000 - Marketing (Cost of printing; ads and & around the courts; relevant venues such as family law attorneys)

       

We realize this is a $40,000 budget for a $25,000 campaign however, the shortfall will be covered by the work we do on a volunteer basis as well as a moderate $10 fee from families. This $10 fee gives the parents a sense of ownership in the process, rather than just being on the receiving end of charity.

Some images courtesy of photostock / FreeDigitalPhotos.net

story:
Hi, it's Nancy and Andy. We are living on a small island in the Dodekanese/Southern Greece. Most of the year we spent here with family, friends and work. Now there is a big change happening. Soon we will share our life with a new arrival. Nancy is pregnant and our babys' birth date is set for mid august. 


Nancy and me decided that this should happen in our own home rather than in a hospital. Of course we want a experienced and professional midwife to assist us during birth. It was rather hard to find any close to our island so we thought we may go to Italy, my birth place, and Nancy can give birth there.

We found a midwife there, a place to stay and soon we will travel there.

With this campaign we are trying to cover the cost for travel and midwife.

 

We have to raise 1500 Euros to pay our midwife. She is great and the most experienced we could find.

An extra 700 Euros we will need to cover expenses for travel and for rent until I can find work there.

Every surplus raised through this campaign will be invested in diapers :)


Our dream is to hold the baby in our hands before others reach out for it. But especially it is important that Nancy feels at ease where she is going to give birth, not being pressed by the rushing world out there, machines or sophisticated technologies. She should have the time she needs and deserves and the aid of a midwife that gives her support. This is all we wish and hope we may achieve thanks to your help!

story:
ORDER YOUR HOLIDAY TREATS NOW FOR A DISCOUNT!

Ordering your Thanksgiving/Christmas/Holiday treats early allows us to plan ahead! So, of course, we offer you a little rebate as a thank you! 

9" Pies are $20 or $24 for gluten-free crust/vegan (when possible) 

Flavors:

Choose from any of the following holiday favorites! All are available w/a gluten-free crust. They are marked (v) if vegan is also a possibility. We acquire all the pumpkins locally and bake them fresh for the pies!

  • pumpkin
  • pumpkin w/ a layer of sea salted ganache on the bottom
  • pumpkin w/ a layer of pecans
  • pecan
  • ginger pecan
  • walnut
  • dutch apple (v)
  • coconut cream
  • banana cream
  • chocolate cream
  • lemon custard
  • lemon cranberry chess (v)
  • quince butternut (v)
  • pear w/ candied walnuts (v)

Other items available:

Feeling like something sweet other than pie?

  • Lemon Bars  $12 per half dozen
  • Fudge Oat Bars $12 per half dozen
  • Pumpkin Bars $12 per half dozen
  • Cran Orange Bread  $12 per loaf
  • Vegan Banana Bread  $12 per loaf
  • Apple Spice Bread  $12 per loaf
  • Pumpkin Bread  $12 per loaf  
  • Cran Zucchini w/ Quinoa Bread  $12 per loaf
  • Scones (flavors vary ~ savory or sweet available)  $30 for 10 
  • Baked Oatmeal  $30 for a 9x11 dish of 12 servings (perfect breakfast for the family before any big meal later). 

Any of the above are available in a gift basket with a locally handmade cutting board by Gwen Gunheim (see perks)!

Pick-up details:

Our Thanksgiving pick-up window is on either Wednesday, 11/26 during regular hours (7:30am-3pm) or on Thursday, 11/27 between 7:30am-10am. Coffee and scones will be available during pick-up on Thanksgiving as well!

Our Christmas pick-up will be on Tuesday, 12/23 during regular hours or 12/24 between 7:30am-10am.

When you select your perk, please specify whether your order is for Thanksgiving, Christmas, or another day! Please bring your own heat-proof pie dish (will or borrow one of ours for a $7 refundable deposit (while supplies last).

Cheers!

More:

Connect with us for other holiday catering (vegetable platters, quiches, casseroles, etc), special requests, events and more!

  Pick-up details:
Our Thanksgiving pick-up window is on either Wednesday, 11/26 during regular hours (7:30am-3pm) or on Thursday, 11/27 between 7:30am-10am. Coffee and scones will be available during pick-up on Thanksgiving as well!
Our Christmas pick-up will be on Tuesday, 12/23 during regular hours or 12/24 between 7:30am-10am.
When you select your perk, please specify whether your order is for Thanksgiving, Christmas, or another day! Please bring your own heat-proof pie dish (will or borrow one of ours for a $7 refundable deposit (while supplies last).
Cheers!

More:
Connect with us for other holiday catering (vegetable platters, quiches, casseroles, etc), special requests, events and more!

story:
Short Summary

Devido aos vários anos de experiência no atendimento ao cliente e no suporte backoffice, apercebi-me das lacunas do ambiente empresarial e da motivação individual do trabalhador.
Acrescentando as competências de gestão que adquiri ao longo dos anos, resolvi criar uma solução para essas lacunas.
Os problemas para mim são soluções, por esse motivo surgiu o Quick Gourmet.

Este projecto trata-se de alimentação saudável no formato de máquinas de vending.

Os nosso produtos são muito variados e permitem soluções para todas as refeições do dia, desde o pequeno-almoço ao jantar.

Sopas típicas portuguesas, sandes variadas com pão de cereais, pastelaria sortida sem cremes, sumos,bolachas simples e integrais, iogurtes, frutas fatiadas, leites e águas, fazem parte do leque de escolha.

Due to several years of experience in customer service and back office support, I realized the shortcomings of the business environment and the individual employee motivation.
Adding the management skills I have acquired over the years, I decided to create a solution to these shortcomings.
The problems for me are solutions for that reason emerged Quick Gourmet.

This project is in healthy food in vending machine format.

Our products are varied and allow solutions for all meals of the day, from breakfast to dinner.

Portuguese typical soups, assorted sandwiches with bread cereals, assorted pastries without creams, juices, simple and whole grain crackers, yogurt, sliced ​​fruit, milk and water are part of the range of choice.

What We Need & What You Get

 

Estamos a tentar angariar 3000 euros, a fim de obter os primeiros contratos de prestação de serviços, adquirir equipamento de conservação e de transporte e por fim as reposições das máquinas.
Se conseguir obter um valor excedente, irei aplicar no software para criar uma aplicação móvel no website a fim de dinamizar encomendas online.

Senão conseguirmos angariar o valor de 3000 euros, iremos aplicar o valor que conseguirmos no software e no marketing, afim de conseguirmos elaborar uma campanha de degustação num projecto piloto, que poderá ajudar a lançar a empresa com outra dinâmica.

We are trying to raise 3000 euros in order to obtain the first contracts for services, acquire conservation and transport equipment and finally the replacement of vending machines.

If we can get a surplus value, will apply the software to create a mobile application on the website to boost online ordersI

If we don’t reach our entire goal we will apply the value we get on the software and marketing material in order to succeed in preparing a campaign tasting a pilot project that will help launch the company with another dynamic.

The Impact

Acreditamos que conseguimos melhorar a motivação individual do trabalhador, se o mesmo se sentir confortável e cómodo no seu local de trabalho, por esse motivo, pensamos na alternativa Quick Gourmet, visto que, desta forma, o trabalhador poderá obter de forma rápida, acessivel e muito económica, refeições saudáveis.
Em tempos de crise, temos de fazer escolhas inteligentes, desta forma, acreditamos que podemos melhorar a qualidade de vida de cada um.

We believe we can improve individual employee motivation, whether it be comfortable in your workplace, therefore, think of the alternative Quick Gourmet, since in this way, the worker can obtain quick, affordable and very economic , healthy meals.
In times of crisis, we must make smart choices, this way we believe we can improve the quality of life of each.

Other Ways You Can Help

Se não puder contribuir, poderá ajudar a nossa campanha com ideias de marketing, criação de ferramentas informáticas, por exemplo.
 Por favor usem as ferramentas de compartilhamento IndieGoGo a fim de fazer passar a palavra sobre a campanha.
Agradecemos todo o vosso apoio e desejem-nos Boa Sorte!

If you can not contribute, you can help our campaign with marketing ideas, creating computer tools, for example.
  Please use the IndieGoGo sharing tools in order to get the word out about the campaign.
We appreciate all your support and wish us good luck!

story:
What is the Outdoor Exchange?

The OX is a new company with a bold mission: we want to enable you to get outdoors. We will provide you with amazing gear for your next adventure, without the cost of maintaining and purchasing expensive equipment:
  - go fly-fishing on a Tuesday morning
  - kayak with the family on a lazy Sunday afternoon
  - backpack on the Appalachian Trail with your best friends

We provide you with the gear, whatever the adventure, to make amazing memories. Our memberships, currently sold exclusively through IndieGoGo, start at just $100 per year for access to all our amazing gear!

The OX has heard You, Loud & Clear - Free Shipping Program!

After numerous questions about shipping, we have decided to offer the OX Trailblazer Program, which offers shipping on most items within the continental United States for just $74 for an entire year! 

You MUST be a member to take advantage. So if you haven't bought a membership yet, do not wait! If you have, take advantage of the separate perk. It's $74 right now either way!

Act fast on this exclusive IndieGoGo offer. We expect our ranks to be full of Trailblazers in no time, and once the campaign is done, the price will rise!


The OX in the News!

We've been noticed by a couple big names, so go out and check out some of the great write-ups on us. We couldn't have said it better ourselves!

Urban Daddy



Outside Magazine


TechCrunch 




What Does a Membership Get Me?

A membership allows you to reserve a number of items from our online catalog for free, depending on your particular membership type. Our inventory includes hundreds of outdoor products split among the following collections:

  • Camping

  • Paddle Sports

  • Water Sports

  • Fishing

  • Beach

  • Hiking

  • Backyard Fun

  • Biking

  • Snow Sports

If you're into Pictures, This is an Example of what we Offer


All you need to do is reserve your gear two days in advance. Then, you can pick up your gear at any of our storefronts, have it shipped to a particular destination, or arrange for convenient delivery. Then enjoy the outdoor gear for a full week! Once you return the gear, repeat week after week to maximize your membership for a whole year.


Sounds Great... But What Does it Cost?

Right now, we’ve got three different levels of membership.

  • Our “Basic” membership includes one item per week.

  • The “Twice as Nice” membership includes two items per week.

  • Finally, “Outdoor Enthusiast includes four items per week.

We’re still a new company and will be fully operational in early July 2014. As a way to say “Thank You” to all our early adopters who get a membership through IndieGoGo, we’re offering all three memberships at 50% off! So once July rolls around, Basic Membership costs everybody else $200 per year, but everyone here gets it for at least $100.

But we’re not even slowing down there, let alone stopping! As part of the deal, exclusively available through IndieGoGo, we will guarantee your membership price for life! That’s right, no matter what else happens in the future, as long as you keep renewing the membership you buy with us here today on IndieGoGo, it will never go up in price.

These deals are exclusive to IndieGoGo! The deals will never again be as good after our campaign here ends.

Price Comparison

We want to make sure you know how great this deal is, so here's a quick example. Let's say you went on four trips requiring equipment rental: 

Trip 1: Kayak and Paddle rental for 4 hours, $90

Trip 2: Beach chair and umbrella rental for 1 day, $30

Trip 3: Week-long snowboard rental, $300

Trip 4: Bicycle tune-up for a mountain biking trip, $80

That's $500 for a year's worth of trip rentals! 

With the OX, you can get all those items over the course of that same year for just $100. 

So we hope you see that by joining the OX you’re getting an incredible value! For the same price as a base membership, you get that same kayak you would at the beach or the guided tour for an entire week, not just a few hours!

We also eliminate the hidden costs of ownership. Let’s say that you bought that $1000 kayak… after enjoying it, you have to clean it and store it. That’s time and space being taken from you! Instead, you could’ve had ten YEARS of gear access through our base membership for the same price, and never had to worry about the unintended consequences.


How Do We Reserve our Gear?

Visit our website for frequently asked questions (and answers!). And for a quick tutorial, we’ve put together the snazzy GIF below:


What About the OX's Future?

We've got big plans for Geographic Expansion, Philanthropy, and our Community Marketplace 

Geography

We're currently located in Northern NJ, but have our eye on several potential spots for expansion, and expect to be there soon. A few are below so you can get an idea: 

  • Oregon
  • Seattle
  • Denver
  • San Fran
  • Austin
  • Los Angeles
  • Chicago
  • Florida
  • Pittsburgh
  • Boston
  • Charlotte
  • Washington, D.C. 
We'll be travelling cross-country this summer to visit our customers! Let us know where we should be next! 


Philanthropy

As we expand into other geographic areas and increase our membership base, we plan on giving back to the community via gear donations and volunteering. For example, we are already helping the Brooklyn-based Trail Blazer organization, which gives inner city youths the opportunity to experience the great outdoors. 


Our Community Marketplace...

Yup! Imagine turning that snowboard, backpack, or tent sitting in your closet into cash during the 50 weeks it's not in use. Our first step is to lend out our own awesome gear for you to go out and enjoy. As our membership base grows and we get to know each other better, we're hoping you'll help lay the foundation of that collaborative consumption community by starting to rent out your own gear for other members to savor. With your help, we can bring the sharing economy to the great outdoors!


This Sounds Awesome! How do I Buy a Membership?

Buy a membership today with our exclusive IndieGoGo perks! Our prices will never get any better, and the lifetime guarantee on membership prices expires when this campaign does. 

Did we mention that, based on what you liked most, we’ll recommend new items we bet you’ll love? Discover more activities with us!

Like the idea, but not ready to be a member? Buy our "Try Before You By" voucher.

Know someone who loves the outdoors but hasn't heard of us yet? Spread the news by following us on social media (links below). Like the campaign, and tell your friends!

And we would love to to hear from you. Leave some comments to let us know what you think, how we can improve, and any questions you might have that we didn't answer. 

Come Out and Meet the OX

We've been going to outdoor events, and continue actively participate in the community. Here are some of the past and future festivals we'll be at: 

NYC Outdoorfest 2014


Brooklyn's Northside Festival


South Jersey's Beardfest




Enjoy the Outdoors with Your Family!



Remember Share us on Social Media!

1. Share the Outdoor Exchange campaign with your friends.


2. Hook your following up


3. Pass along the latest and greatest from the OX
